Reviews.Title: “Employee Cherry Davidson”
Reviews.Author: kidholly
Reviews.Content: Cherry went far beyond with the service i recieved from her. Thank you Cherry. Rebeeca Blad room 876

Reviews.Title: “Good trip!”
Reviews.Author: Nick M
Reviews.Content: Dave Pate took really good care of us and I really enjoyed the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: Sota22
Reviews.Content: little off the strip but still n close to all that you would need. friendly staff, clean hotel and rooms, would visit this hotel again

Reviews.Title: “Great, fun, clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: BridgetteLL
Reviews.Content: I came here last minute for the Las Vegas Marathon and the hotel host Christina Dunbar got me a really nice room. I was greeted by the friendly staff and my additional requests were met without any issues at all. Overall this is a fun casino, the rooms are clean, and the staff is great. I definitely recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Bingo Room”
Reviews.Author: Zendingo
Reviews.Content: Played the big game! Excellent time and superb service. Specifically the supervisor Lisa. She made sure to go the extra step. If only there were more Lisa's. She made our time a delight. We love your bingo!

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, great rooms, great fun in casino!”
Reviews.Author: Bev S
Reviews.Content: This is a great place to stay and play. The rooms are nice and clean, the casino is fun and the staff goes out of their way to make sure you are having a good time, especially Christina Dunbar. She is so fantastic at planning events! Go and enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “The Riviera is GREAT”
Reviews.Author: Edward S
Reviews.Content: The Riviera is the ONLY casino that I frequent in Las Vegas because over the last five years (several return visits), I have never had a bad experience.....just the contrary...VERY good experience. The check-in is organized, the rooms are conveniently located and clean, the food is very good, the staff is very accommodating and the overall experience is very pleasant. I would like to compliment two Riviera individuals in particular: Dave Pate and Addy Coco. These two employees always make sure that my trips are PERFECT!!!!!!! I have developed friendships with Dave and Addy which make my trips to the Riviera like going back to visit 'family:... Dave and Addy....thanks for EVERYTHING!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great customer service!”
Reviews.Author: Carol M
Reviews.Content: I have just returned home from a trip to the Riviera Hoteal and Casino in Las Vegas and they are making some positive changes. The VIP service was extraordinary and the floor workers Pilar and Julie went well beyond the expectation of implementing customer service. Some changes to the old "Kadys" now the "Poolside Cafe" were still in the works and we missed being able to have dinner there, but we are waiting to see the results of the renovations and expected hours of operation. We hope to return in September and we expect that Amy, our slot host will handle us with a lot of TLC. The rooms were clean, the atmosphere was exciting and it was nice to see the place so busy.

Reviews.Title: “Riviera an Oasis in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: satriani
Reviews.Content: Let me start off by saying that I am not picky at all when it comes to hotels and especially in Vegas where the hotel itself is simply a place to sleep. That being said, I was very surprised how much I enjoyed the Riviera. The location is next to nothing, but the bus service stops right outside the front door so you can go anywhere you want for $7 a day. So forget the over priced places and stay here!! The room was very comfortable and clean and the casino spotless. The Queen Victoria Pub was a pleasant surprise with a good selection of beers on tap and bathrooms very close by!!! The dances next to the black jack tables are not to be missed and the overall experience was great. There isnt a great deal of food options but who cares, get on the bus and go find somewhere to eat. Again, this is an older hotel but I felt very comfortable staying here and will book my next Vegas trip here as this is one of the cheapest deals.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tony m
Reviews.Content: I have been going to Vegas for many years now and I travel there at least 3 or 4 times a year and has stayed at the Riviera Hotel and Casino every time. The rooms were clean, housekeeping was excellent and the staff was very friendly . The food is Great. Every year we have between 60 - 80 people flock in for a big super bowl party. My Host Mr. Dave Pate does an excellent job of organizing this event. He is always available to help with any of our needs. I would not stay anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “R steak house and hotel”
Reviews.Author: vfowlkes
Reviews.Content: Best salmon steak I have had in a long time!! Robert V was excellent waiter and other staff excellent. Very gracious maitre D. Great retaurant experience! Stayed in MONACO TOWER . Decent clean fairly recently updated room. Good bed, nice linens. Hotel is old and prob parts of it needs to go. Extremely reasonably priced. Would be nice to have coffee pot in room. Lines terribly long at one coffee spot in a.m.

Reviews.Title: “Great time at the Riviera”
Reviews.Author: paith041
Reviews.Content: We traveled to Vegas to celebrate my 30th birthday and stayed at the Riviera March 22-28th. Our experience at was great. The only downside was check-in. We got in about 11 pm on a Thursday night and had to wait a good 30 - 45 minutes to check in. Once more staff came out the line moved quickly, but it wasn't a fun way to start our first night in Vegas. We did however get an upgrade on our room. We stayed in room 421 in the Monaco Tower which is one that has gone under renovations. Our room was very clean and had new carpet. Our only other issue was that the AC definitely hadn't been updated in awhile. It worked really well, but sounded like a boat motor was in the room with us! Thankfully we were exhausted at the end of each night so the sound never kept us up. The staff was all great and very helpful. The cocktail waitresses in the casino were definitely nicer than ones we encountered elsewhere. They always greeted you with a smile and weren't as surly as some other places. My favorite part of staying at this end of the strip was that it wasn't as crowded as the south end. It was nice to get away to some relative "peace and quiet" after spending a busy day farther down the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Great trip!”
Reviews.Author: Severin H
Reviews.Content: Good food, fun casino, clean rooms, nice pool, and Christina Dunbar is a fabulous casino host!

Reviews.Title: “riviera hotel & casino”
Reviews.Author: john n
Reviews.Content: My husband & I have been going to Riviera for a number of years. We have brought familly & friends with us on different occasions. Our stay has always been great because of a couple of people that work there, namely Addie Coco. We can honestly say if we needed or wanted anything, Addie was there to help. As far as being courteous, helpful, caring, there is no one better. Her job is ver important and so are her guest. This past Super Bowl we were with a large group of people from Louisiana. Because Addie was always there to help the whole group our stay was great. We hope to return again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Hopeful.....”
Reviews.Author: Louella M
Reviews.Content: Parking spaces were limited. We arrived around noon, but had to wait until 4p. (there was no signs stating c/i time) Long lines and under staffed. It clearly looked like some of the clerks hated their job, except for the lady who helped us. Her name is Joyce, she was happy even dancing to the music. There seemed to be a problem with our reservation but she managed to find us in the system. Apparently our name was mispelled. She explained everything in detail and even told us about other places to visit during our stay. That's helpful, since we are new to Vegas. I did not even think about the wait in line because she was efficient and made sure we were gonna have a good time. She's good for your company! The room was very nice except for the hallway it still had other people's tray of food that looked like it was there all day. Sadly, room service was not available. The food outlets were limited. There is no more coffee shop, why? We really do not care for buffets and the Chinese and Pub was not our idea of comfort food. Good thing Joyce told us about the Peppermill restaurant and the hot dog place across the street. The casino had alot of different slots to play but some areas were dark and it seemed so warm during the day. All in all, I would return to the Riviera for a next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Riviera hotel - I'll pass thank you”
Reviews.Author: pevey66
Reviews.Content: I was very disappointed with the Riviera, I will list the reasons why: 1. They only had two people checking in people and they were not to friendly. We were next in line so we started to walk up to the window this is what one of the lady's behind the counter said to us. " Did I call you? You stay right where you are until you are told to approach the counter" thank god we were checked in by a gentleman who we think just started his shift and he was great because if I had to deal with the other woman I think I would have snapped. 2. The internet for lack of another word sucks!!! 3. Parking was terrible I have never stayed at a hotel were you could not even park your car at the hotel you are staying at. we literately had to give a person a ride to her car so we could take the spot she parked in. 4. Trash there is pop cans, paper, beer bottles and other trash whipping around in the wind not only in the parking ramp but the front entrance ways as well and I wish I took a pic to show you. It was terrible. 5. fire alarm going off all hours of the night. 6. over charging for things. If you want good internet you have to pay a dollar a min. 7. If you want more than a few channels on TV you will have to pay $6.00 a half hour. The movie rates are average so that's not an issue. 8. The elevators are scary. In the parking ramp the elevators are not only very dirty but are in rough operating order. very bumpy ride and the doors don't like to close properly. The elevators going to the monico tower have doors that barely close. 8. The hotel employees are not too friendly. 9. we love oriental food however in their food court there is a place called 1st wok. I tell ya what don't even wast your time their food was terrible and not to mention over priced. The food was so bad we didn't even eat it we threw it away. Now the good points: House keeping was awesome!!!!! The dinner buffet was very good and the room was nice with a comfortable bed. Over all this hotel is not worth the price. That's just my opinion and I will never stay at the Riviera again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean off the beaten path”
Reviews.Author: votenochains
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel for the price. Clean room with nice space. The food options are a bit limiting and the times are hard to figure out. One place to eat breakfast.... buffet, couldn't really find some place for burgers and beer..... nice restaurant on property for dinner but high prices. Highly recommend the spa. the Staff there really know their stuff. Nice to be a bit out of the main fray. Check in took forever though (because it is close to convention site). I think its the best for the cost though!

Reviews.Title: “No Complaints!”
Reviews.Author: Charmaine921
Reviews.Content: Have been staying at the Riviera Hotel in Las Vegas for over 15 years and stay for at least a week at a time. The rooms are nice and clean, the food is great and the employees are all friendly. Christina Dunbar looked after us and I have no complaints. Always friendly, smiling and helpful. When we stay at The Riviera Hotel in Vegas it is like our home away from home. I believe when people and places are good to you then you should support them. Look forward to calling Christina and telling her we are coming back. Love it !

Reviews.Title: “Bingo room”
Reviews.Author: Yessigunz
Reviews.Content: Went to play bingo! Had a fantastic time and love the bingo ball. Lisa was a great help.

Reviews.Title: “OUTSTANDING”
Reviews.Author: Terry5000
Reviews.Content: Just stayed in a penthouse suite. Great Service and value. Treated with respect from the time I walked in the door. It really upsets me the bad reviews guests leave because they lose some money gambling.ITS CALLED GAMBLING for a reason.. Did I lose, Yes, but I was treated great and had a blast. And losing money should not be a reason to give a bad review. Try staying in a suite in LA or New york or Frisco You will pay over 5 grand a night. Not the 200 I paid THANKS RIVERA. YOU HAVE A CUSTOMER FOR LIFE. SEE YOU NEXT month.

Reviews.Title: “Lisa at Bingo is Great !”
Reviews.Author: lvgrammy4
Reviews.Content: I was new at the Bingo game and Lisa made me feel right at home in the Bingo room. She helped be at the desk letting me know what was my best package to purchase, let me know how the games were going to be called, told me about the free drinks and even checked up on me during the games to see how I was doing. I had so much fun, I stayed for all of the sessions. Lisa cares about her customers, and is a very kind lady. She has a lot of fun at her job and it makes it fun for all of the people playing Bingo. I have been back and I will continue to come back and bring friends. THANKS LISA !!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “B-I-N-G-O”
Reviews.Author: 1776tyler
Reviews.Content: Lisa in the Bingo Room was wonderful. Not having been to a Bingo Room before, she made me feel comfortable there. Thanks, Lisa!

Reviews.Title: “My first experience of Vegas. WOW...”
Reviews.Author: Jeri B
Reviews.Content: We (My husband and I) took a Trip to Las Vegas. We had arrive in Vegas the Front Desk Associate Christine M. had brought my dreams to life. We have be married for 23 years and never been any where together by ourselves since then. The first impression of our first room. not what I had ordered. She ( Christine M.) changed our room to the suite and and gave me our room. This room brought me to Tears. At the end of our stay. I felt like a NEWLYWED again. Thanks Christine... What an awesome Employee...

Reviews.Title: “This place is tired”
Reviews.Author: BrandonNCo
Reviews.Content: Stayed here to be close to the convention center. So here's one good thing: comfortable beds. As far as everything else... It's old and tired. Bad carpet, bad furniture, bad fixtures. Door falling off of dresser door kinda tired. But if you are looking for something cheap. Maybe it'll work.

Reviews.Title: “Bingo room and Agent Lisa Garcia”
Reviews.Author: eagerwieger1
Reviews.Content: To all those traveling and staying at the Riviera I just want to tell you how nice it is to relax in the bingo room very nice people especially Lisa Garcia what a nice lady ! I was late to the 5 pm bingo sessio and Agent Lisa sooo kind to help me get caught up and enjoy the rest of the games. and how nice and comfortable the bingo room looks. i will defiently be going back there and recomend all of you to do the same.

Reviews.Title: “Bingo room”
Reviews.Author: Bananas33
Reviews.Content: I had a great time at the riviera. It was a nice and clean hotel room service was wonderful. I had lots of fun playing bingo in the bingo room. Lisa even had the bingo mascot come out which was even cooler. What a wonderful employee she is.

Reviews.Title: “Bingo Room”
Reviews.Author: BingoLOVER109
Reviews.Content: Love bingo and Riviera is the only casino on the strip to have bingo! Love it!!! Kudo's to Lisa Wieger for all the help and information on the bingo machines!!! We will be back hope this bingo room stays open so happy to see this on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Older Hotel but great experience!”
Reviews.Author: Misty M
Reviews.Content: I went the Riviera Hotel and Casino recently with my friends (we're all locals) to play Bingo for the first time. I had never been to the Riviera before, and much of my visit was what I expected, the property was older and needed some updating, but once we made it to the Bingo Room I was pleasantly suprised. Having never played bingo before I had no idea how the process worked, but an employee there named Brenda Medina took the time to explain everything to me and even came back to check on us a couple of times in case we had more questions. Because of Brenda's knowledge and personable service we ended up having a great time, and will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Debra front desk”
Reviews.Author: KnarikN
Reviews.Content: Debra was absolutely amazing!!!! She helped us get exactly what we wanted at the price we wanted last minute!! She was awesome and very sweet and very helpful! Great employee.

Reviews.Title: “Great night of bingo”
Reviews.Author: bill s
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel for CES in January. Recently upgraded room was well done. Had a great time in the bingo room that was recently set up & there was a very friendly staff there especially a girl by the name of Lisa.

Reviews.Title: “Bingo at the Riviera with Lisa. Yeah !”
Reviews.Author: bonitaBabe34436
Reviews.Content: we so enjoyed our time ther playing Bingo ! however I didn't win. ! boo hoo. LIsa was so impressive, helpful and such a great personality. You go Girl ! Hugs Bonnie

Reviews.Title: “Understaffed and Stuck in the 1950's”
Reviews.Author: CarlyR73
Reviews.Content: The staff is pleasant, though there are far too few of them. At any given time, there were 5 to 30 people in line and only 2 desk attendants. Don't expect any modern amenities: no in-room coffee, no computers/business room, no automatic check-out. Ordered espresso from the menu but was told the machine is too old to fuss with to make it. Because the Riviera is 'having housekeeping problems,' it took one hour, 2 phone calls and a visit to the desk for towels to be delivered. They are having remodel problems as well: upon check in, we were told the water would be shut off to our room the next day for 4 hours (no discount or small comp offered). Construction in various parts of the hotel is ongoing. Wait until they finish rehabbing before you stay here.

Reviews.Title: “low budget Vegas vacation, out dated”
Reviews.Author: Carl I
Reviews.Content: I was expecting it to be more luxurious for a "Strip Casino" but it really needs updating. The restaurants were limited and so were the shows. The La Cage show was average but a good laugh. On the way to our room, the elevator stalled. They should really update the elevators because it could have been worse. RJ from security was very apologetic and assured us that they will look into this safety hazard. At least they were willing to acknowledge the flaws and apologize for them, so the guest service is nice. The room was also clean and looked liked they recently were updated but really, the rest of the casino and shows need a MAJOR facelift. If you are looking to get a good rate, which we did at 40 bucks midweek, then this is a good place to stay but take the time to travel to another casino for gambling and shows.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Ambam333
Reviews.Content: I had such a great time at the riviera planning bingo thanks to Lisa Wieger for helping out and being so kind

Reviews.Title: “I WILL RETURN!!”
Reviews.Author: Trudy G
Reviews.Content: I thought I would try my luck at 'BINGO' while I was at the Riviera in Las Vegas. I am a BINGO novice and Lisa, who works in the BINGO hall, was most helpful in steering me in the right direction. She explained the different colors, the electronic machines and answered all of my questions. She even stopped by during the game to see how I was doing. I did not win one game but had so much fun I returned for 2 more sessions! ... THANK YOU, LISA, I WILL RETURN!!

Reviews.Title: “Riviera Review”
Reviews.Author: Christopher C
Reviews.Content: Staff was extremely friendly. Hotel itself is very old and many areas smell too smoky. Valet parking staff was excellent and very fast & professional, especially Daniel Lawson. He deserves a special pat on the back!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent EVERY Time We Go”
Reviews.Author: siggyjam
Reviews.Content: Yep ... one of the "old landmarks" of Las Vegas was introduced to me by a friend years ago and I wouldn't go anywhere else. We are a lucky group because we have what I feel is our "own" personal service with Dave Pate, the person in charge of "Louisiana Player Development". Over the years, Dave has done everything imaginable to make our trip as carefree as possible from the time we arrive at the airport until we're on the plane on our way home. The "Riv' is a huge hotel ... I find something new every time I go ... whenever I need information about the city or the strip, all I have to do is get with Dave and all my questions are answered and options become clear for me to chose to my liking. Last several years we've gone for the excellent "Super Bowl" party held at the "Riv". Huge room with big screens everywhere with excellent view from any seat, food, drink, even temporary gambling set up in the room for your convenience. Don't know of anything else like it. Dave is always available to show us or tell us what, where, and how we get to fulfill our vacation travels, sights, and "adventures". This year I did something I always wanted to do. Rent a car and take a ride to Mr. Charleston. Dave showed us the car rental facility in the Riviera and "POOF" ... there was my car. My trip was everything I wanted it to be. Year before he told us about trips to the Grand Canyon, the options available, the west rim or the south rim ... on and on. That, too, turned out to be a sight of a lifetime. The Riviera has all types of gaming limits available, which I need, and the dealers were courteous and helpful to those who needed help. We ate in the restaurants and the food was excellent ... poolside cafe has the greatest breakfast anywhere ... The "Riv" is on the strip, not far from the more recently built casinos and closer to downtown than most of the newer hotels. Rooms were clean, housekeeping was excellent and staff was thorough and friendly. If I would have "won" ... I would have tipped them more ... hehehe If you would like a Las Vegas hotel that is still going after all these years and getting a little more "personal" than those other guys, the "Riv" is the place you need to go. Prices are very reasonable ... more of your vacation dollars to spend on having more "fun". And, when we go, it's usually NOT just us ... it's usually a gang of anywhere from 40 to 80+ people ... don't know how Dave can make all this happen, but somehow, without fail, he does. He is actually concerned that everything goes well for everyone. I don't even "thing about" going anywhere else, and have been doing so for years. Thank you Riviera, and thank YOU ... DAVE, for all you have done for us in the past and for the upcoming trips we'll take.

Reviews.Title: “Riviera Bingo Room!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Danielle L
Reviews.Content: Ive lived in Las Vegas all my life but the neatest place I have seen here is the Riviera its very friendly and calm. Sylvie Swanson in the Bingo Room made playing bingo way more interesting and laughable then anywhere I've ever played Bingo before.

Reviews.Title: “The only place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Jim918
Reviews.Content: Great place love the people especially sylvie swanson and bingo.it is the best.

Reviews.Title: “BINGO!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Arlene S
Reviews.Content: I am an avid bingo fan and Lisa Weiger, the "bingo boss", was a joy. Very helpful, informative and easy to talk to. This was a wonderful bingo experience and I surely will tell all my friends. And above all......I got to yell bingo!!! Arlene S.

Reviews.Title: “Bingo and Basketball”
Reviews.Author: AnnaJ63
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went there to watch basketball. It was too much for me. I saw they had bingo. I thought it would be a great way to kill some time. Lisa was very helpful. I played a couple of times, but didn't win. My husband also had a great time and we will surely play again. Maybe for thier Superstar Bingo. It looks like fun and for $200,000 it's worth a shot!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: Profsnowball
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the riviera and it was just amazing! The room was clean and the bed was so soft, I fell asleep as soon as I sat on it. The staff was very friendly and helpful especially an officer on a bike, he helped us with directions and points of interest around town. I would definitely recommend this hotel to everyone I know! Thanks riviera staff and a big thanks to officer wicker, you made my vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: JenelleMH
Reviews.Content: Overall, very comfortable stay at this hotel. The one and only complaint I had was one night I requested extra pillows, after waiting an hour I called again to let them know I still hadn't received them. Eventually I fell asleep and woke up the next morning realizing they had never shown up with the pillows. The next night I called again, let them know how displeased I was and they brought me more promptly. Finally.

Reviews.Title: “my Riviera review”
Reviews.Author: Alicia M
Reviews.Content: I booked on Expedia and I got the room for a really good price. Hotel hallways always had a horrible smoke smell. Carpets were dirty in inside and outside the room. There was no Jacuzzi in the entire hotel; I was kind of disappointed about that. We stayed in a classic room, it was outdated and the faucets were rusted and outdated and as well. Food at the buffet was good and not expensive. We ate at the Steak and Seafood restaurant one night, it was expensive and the food wasn’t that good. We got tickets to see Jan Rouven’s magic show called Illusions it was a good show, I loved it. Real nice guy he took pictures with us afterward for free.Overall the stay was ok. I wouldn’t recommend staying here unless you are on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “The worst customer service in the world!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Carla B
Reviews.Content: When we got to the hotel the first thing we asked the front desk was if we can pay for late check out up front. The answer was that we dont have to do it now because we can do it the day of without a problem. On our last day we went downstairs as she advised us, and the next we know we were treated like garbage. A different front desk agent was quick to bark "I'm not offering that today" and proceeded to walk away. We had nothing packed and were rudely informed we had to be out of the room within ten minutes. We spoke with the manager after and he wasn't any more helpful than she was. Actually, he was even less helpful and equally uninterested. So here we are, throwing everything in the luggages so we can drop them off with the bell boys, because our flight was leaving at night (check out is at 12pm). The bell boy: another slap in the face! The bell boy, barely speaking english himself, had the audacity to tell us that we don't speak enough english (mind you we are Canadian). There is nothing pleasant about this experience at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “There are better MOTELS downtown...although I don't recommend this hotel or those!”
Reviews.Author: MNVikings2011
Reviews.Content: I recently returned from Las Vegas and stayed 3 nights at the Palms and two nights at the Riviera. Now I knew I was downgrading slightly from the Palms to the Riviera but I just didn't realize how much. The place was not clean, the staff was rude, and my experience was the complete opposite of the Palms. I'm not new to Vegas; in fact, it was my 11th time. I only chose this hotel for a couple days because I had friends coming in and I wanted to be in the same "resort". Big. Mistake. There is also an $11.00 per day resort fee. I can handle resort fees as long as I feel like it's worth it. Here there is no justification. All in all, you can do better in Vegas for roughly the same amount of money if that is the price range you are in.

Reviews.Title: “Courteous and Friendly Service”
Reviews.Author: Hodgie8888
Reviews.Content: Maria Lopez was very courteous at the check in! Thanks

Reviews.Title: “Was pleasantly suprised.”
Reviews.Author: Kim P
Reviews.Content: After reading the mixed reviews and finding out the price I thought we were in for an adventure but that's part of the fun of it. In 2000 we stayed at the Bellagio and although excellent it kind of sucks your pocket unnecessarily dry so we decided for this trip we were going to try the cheaper side. Our check in was very smooth and our rooms were great. We ate a the pub and Poolside Cafe and our meals were reasonable and very good. The staff was courteous very helpful. I would most certainly stay at this hotel again and recommend it as a great place to stay. Also, while there you need to have a meal at the Pepper Mill, a great restaurant close to the hotel. There is one negative...bring your own toilet paper if you don't like sandpaper!

Reviews.Title: “Much better than expected”
Reviews.Author: Shane W
Reviews.Content: After reading peoples reviews on here i was very nervous about staying here and almost rebooked. We booked on expedia and decided to just go with it. We got there about 12 am and check in was a breeze took only about ten minutes there was only two people in front of us. We were put in the Monaco tower. When we got to our room it looked exactly like it did in the picture. The bed was freshly made the room was clean. The bed was very comfortable, we slept the best we have in months we wanted to bring the bed home with us. The casino did smell a lilttle smokey but it is fifty years old there probably has been fifty billion cigaretts smoke in there but it wasnt to bad. Our beds were freshly made every day and our room was cleaned. Overall we have no complaints about the Riviera it was a nice and enjoyable stay. Its not as fancy or busy as some of the other casinos down the strip but its not that far to walk down to the other parts. We went to a timeshare meeting which sounded like a good deal but couldnt do it. We got free tickets to the buffet at Planet Hollywood which was amazing the best buffet i have ever ate. We also got free tickets to the V Theater there which you can pick from several shows. We went to the variety show and it was great. I have never laughed so hard in my life lol. So it was worth going to their 90 minute meeting. All in all it was worth going to the Riviera and I would stay again for the price. After all it could just be your place to sleep and go down the strip further to check everything else out.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: sheri s
Reviews.Content: After all the bad reviews I was expecting a bad stay here. Actually it was pretty good. Arrived about 2:00 p.m. on Saturday March 10th. The check in line was very short. There was a problem with the dates of our reservation but the staff was very helpful and nice. Even upgraded our room for the trouble. We never encountered a rude employee anywhere during our entire stay. Everybody was very nice. The rooms are large and have everything you could need. The beds are comfy & clean and the bathroom was clean. The room could have been cleaner but it was clean enough. The parts that matter where clean.The whole hotel and Casino could use a good cleaning but for the price it's was good.

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointing!”
Reviews.Author: Linda J
Reviews.Content: Stay here started off wrong right from the beginning. Had to drive around the parking garage to find the front door and the lobby to check in. Bags were immediately grabbed by a bellhop who was told to just take them to the front desk but instead they disappeared into storage and when we tried to retrieve them other bell staff were rude and reluctant and annoyed at going to get the bags out of storage and returning them to us. Paid the unexpected mandatory $11/day resort fee for nothing since we didn't use the wi-fi, the pool was closed, and we didn't use the spa, and the parking garage is free anyway for anybody. When we got to our room there was one piece of soap and we had to find housekeeping to get more. Room was old, carpet was filthy, bathroom tub wouldn't drain and we were standing in water while showering, no fan in the bathroom, no coffee maker in the room so we had to buy morning coffee. There was food left in the hallways for three days before it was removed. There was a safe in the room and no directions on how to use it. Tried to access guest services on the tv set and the remote wouldn't work. Tried to call the front desk repeatedly and got voice mail. Finally called the operator who connected us with a supervisor who said a new remote would be delivered but it never came. Staff took no responsibility for problems stating in every instance that it was someone else's department and we would have to find and talk to someone else. One casino employee talked to us while picking her teeth with a toothpick. Cashier cage in the casino was terribly understaffed and it took forever waiting in line to be served. Not enough blackjack tables open to be able to play, many of them being closed and covered. Dinner buffet was fair but mediocre. We remember from years ago when we used to go to Vegas that the Riviera was a great place to stay. Management has allowed this hotel to deteriorate to the point where it will probably close completely in the very near future. Employee training is totally lacking and employee morale seems low. We'll never stay there again and wouldn't recommend it to anybody.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable Hotel in Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: KJR4
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a less expensive place to stay on the North end of "the Strip" (near the Stratosphere) then try the Riviera! We upgraded to the Monaco Tower...and were very happy with it. Clean, nice beds, The Tower is Not new, but not OLD feeling either. Our room overlooked the pool area. Nice affordable "shows" in the Hotel for eve. entertainment and plenty of "casino" type fun. (Lots of slots and tables) 15 min. taxi ride from the Airport and nice affordable little restaurants inside to choose from. Very near the newer Encore and Wynn properties. Take a taxi if you're trying to go farther south on the Strip... just too far to walk.

Reviews.Title: “Family Vegas Trip”
Reviews.Author: jcarreno
Reviews.Content: Had a Great time, Ate Breakfast buffet in our Hotel and was very reasonable in price ($10)was fresh and delicious. Weather was great considering it was February. The only complaint I have is the beds are hard and pillows aren't too comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal”
Reviews.Author: Remula
Reviews.Content: After reading some very unpleasant reviews I was apprehensive about staying here. But, we got a very good deal. The room was nice and comfortable especially for what we paid. The bathroom was pretty clean. I thought the tile could use a deep cleaning. .The staff I encountered was friendly. Well except for the coffee guy who jumped my butt for ordering a latte because the machine was broken. A sign to warn me would have sufficed. The next day he was much nicer but maybe because I only ordered a coffee.(still no sign) The overall the experience was good.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay in the cheap rooms”
Reviews.Author: Travelingtucker
Reviews.Content: When we stayed, we upgrade to the luxury rooms and I have no complaints. The bed was soft and the room was clean. Now, they were nothing special, but it wasn't bad. As long as you don't mind walking up the strip or taking the bus, to get to the action, then You will be fine here. I stayed here for a conference.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible”
Reviews.Author: sl2smove
Reviews.Content: The first night we got here after a 6hr flight teenagers were having a party on our floor which isn't a problem except for the fact that they were running all through the hall smoking weed blasting music etc. The shower water was cold. We rented a 2 bedroom suite and there was no microwave. The refrigerator was broken. The window opened completely full so you or your child can fall out and the list goes on.

Reviews.Title: “Nice bed, but dont stay here”
Reviews.Author: USESTATE
Reviews.Content: Six of my friends got three rooms in the Monaco tower of the hotel. I have stayed at a majority of Vegas hotel, and was not expecting much from the Riiviera. The rooms had a modern look, and the beds were comfy. The dressers were falling apart though. All three of are rooms safes did not work, so dont expect to keep your valuables safe. I originally aksed if they would bump us up to the Monaco tower for free, because we were celebrating a second life of my friend who was critically wounded in the line of duty as a Police Officer. The lady up front said there is nothing at all she could do. I normally ask at all casinos I stay at, and they are always there to see what they can do. Couple of my friends arrived later and someone else upgraded them for free, for just asking. While playing the table games, the automatic suffler broke on several occasions. We got masages at their spa, and we all came back with this funky smell on our bodies. When we complained about the smell and bad massages the manager said "what do you want us to do." Good customer service right there. When checking out we were unable to use our television, saying it was having technical problem. My room was unable to call the front desk, so I used a friends phone. When the front desk answered the phone they said "yeah...how can I help you." The crowd at the hotel is what you would expect from a cheap old hotel.. I would not recommend this hotel. Spend a couple extra bucks to stay at Planet Hollywood, MGN, Mandalay Bay, or anywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Depends on what room you are given”
Reviews.Author: sleepyhead_12
Reviews.Content: We were there last year in May for my sister-in-law's 80th birthday. Her daughters had a two-bedroom suite which was very nice. Our room was OK, but no refrigerator. There was a space where it had been, which we used for storage. One family member had a bad room--AC smelled and they saw a cockroach the day they left. They had been given a new room after complaining about the odor. The check-in takes quite a while, but all in all we were happy with the price and are returning in April. I think some areas are older, so we will ask for the newer area.

Reviews.Title: “Dump”
Reviews.Author: David N
Reviews.Content: This place is a dump. Plain and simple. You will get a good deal, then they hit you with a $25 per day resort fee. You have to pay to use the room safe, and the workout room. I'm surprised they don't charge you to each time you flush the toilet. The carpet in this place looks like it is the original carpet. The location is horrible. Too far to walk anywhere, so we took cabs which just adds to the expense of the "cheap" hotel. It needs to be blown up! Never again!

Reviews.Title: “Riviera Hotel Stay”
Reviews.Author: Robert H
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay at the Riviera. Short visit caused by delayed flight, but very enjoyable. Friendly staff, high energy in the casino and other areas of the hotel, took in a great Illusionist Jan Rouven in the Starlite Room. Really liked the vibe!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: David G
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a business trip in Feb 2012. The room was clean, comfortable and it looked like it had been recently renovated. If you are looking for an inexpensive trip to Vegas this is a great spot! The only complaint I have is that the check in process took almost an hour because there were only two people on the front desk while there were about 100 people in line.

Reviews.Title: “Get the dynamite”
Reviews.Author: April T
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 6 years in a row back in the 90's, but this was our first trip back in 12 years. Celebrating our 50th wedding anniversary we asked for a room with a good location. (not a big request since the place seemed almost empty. They gave us a room with a view of the back parking lot and a brick wall. Casino staff was unfriendly, cocktail girls were few and far between. We had to weave around the 'barkers' who were trying to get us to attend a timeshare program as they could be right pushy and they were located in at least two places in the lobby. Toilet paper holder was falling off the wall, air conditioner was noisy. Wish I had read the reviews before booking, but had so many great times from staying there in the past it didn't occur to me. Buffet was terrible, so we only ate there once...Never again..this place needs to be imploded like so many of the other old hotels that had lived out their time.

Reviews.Title: “Newly Remodeled Units are Great .. Loosest Slots .. Great Restaurants!”
Reviews.Author: Mr_Icu
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a weekend getaway and we got a newly updated room in the Monaco Towers. We got a king size bed that was very confortable with clean sheets and pillows. This is also the only casino both my wife and I had ever won on the slot machines so they must have some of the loosest slots on the strip! The Indian Food place in the food court (India Masala) was by far the best Indian food I have had in Vegas. It rivals the high end restaurants even though it is a food court place ... no jokes. They have everything from snacks to full course thali's at a great value ... available 24/7! Now my summery: Pros: - Renovated rooms have very modern and clean furniture. LCD screens, in room iron and blow dryer. - Water pressure was great with plenty of hot water any time when we needed it. - Rooms and hotel in general was very tidy - Some of the loosest slots on the strip - Great Indian food in the food court. Food court also has Mexican, Chinese, Quizno's and a PIzza parlour. - Breakfast buffet was a great value with plenty of gournet items available. - Very good soundproofing in between rooms .. couldn't hear a thing from the neighbours Cons: - Besides the rooms, the rest of the hotel is dated - The 2 nights we ventured into the casino and played some of the games, not once were we approached by a cocktail waitress for drinks - Parking is a bit hidden and have to go through a maze to get there. - It's in the north part of the strip not too close to any of the other casinos and the area is a bit rough.

Reviews.Title: “On my short list of good inexpensive Vegas properties”
Reviews.Author: RulesLawyer
Reviews.Content: I'd read reviews here and elsewhere, and was more than a little worried about what I'd end up with. If it was just me, I'm happy to stay almost anywhere, since I spend very little time in the room, but my wife was with me this trip, and she likes taking things a little more leisurely. She stayed with me at the Flamingo last time we were in town, and I'd hoped that this would be almost as nice. For the price (three comped nights, Friday-Monday!), I decided to take a chance. I'm glad I did. We got a non-smoking room near the top of the Monaco tower; the room felt like it was renovated about a year ago. The cabinetry was a bit scuffed, the view was of a parking lot with the Wynn golf course further out, and the AC unit had a damaged grate. Other than those three issues, I've got nothing but praise. It felt similar to a well maintained Red Lion. Check-in at 4:30 on Friday was immediate, although when we left the hotel a couple hours later, I saw that the line was much longer. Water pressure's good, bed was comfy, carpeting seemed clean, refrigerator worked, internet was fast. The valet service was top notch; by Sunday night, even though we'd switched cars, the valet recognized us. We never needed to wait more than 5 minutes for our car. Single-zero roulette in the casino was a blast, even though I ended up behind; slot play was slightly profitable. I'd been warned to avoid the buffet and to make sure to eat at the steakhouse, but did neither. Having a rental car feels like a must here. It's only a six minute walk to Encore, but making it past the WynnCore complex to anywhere else is twice as long.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected based on earlier reviews”
Reviews.Author: David D
Reviews.Content: Last minute booking for 5 day getaway....didn't really care too much about hotel,as long as bed clean and shower works,don't go to Vegas to stay in hotel.....reviews had us nervous however..."endless checkin/out wait"..."rude staff"...etc.Well ,checkin line was long but moved as fast as possible....staff super friendly,being close to elevator woke my wife first night....staff agreed to move us without hesitation to very quiet corner of tower.....positive experience all around!!

Reviews.Title: “Almost had to leave”
Reviews.Author: llamaTrekker
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a conference. The room was barely clean. Got a non-smoking room but ventilation was such that it always smelled smoky. On occasion I could get a hot shower, but mostly it was tepid. Water pressure was abysmal. Looks and feels like a hotel that hasn't been renovated in 30 years. Check-in, at midnight, was about an hour. They had 3 very incompetent clerks who would often disappear into the back room. Quite a walk from this place to the rest of the hotels on the strip. While walking back one night, my friend almost had his phone stolen out of his hand. Beware the extra "resort fees" they tack on upon arrival.

Reviews.Title: “Might as well have been in the 3rd world”
Reviews.Author: bucktil4d
Reviews.Content: Overall I found the Riviera extremely disappointing, but to be fair, I will provide pros and cons. We travelled with friends. Checkout was over an hour wait and the personnel seemed untrained or unable/disallowed to make any decisions of their own as with each guest, the clerk would disappear into some back room and reappear often. The friends we travelled with had their handicapped brother with them and as such needed adjoining rooms so they could supervise/assist him. The hotel did not have any adjoining rooms when we got there (2AM) and they graciously upgraded their accommodations to a Penthouse Suite at no extra cost. This was a big plus for the hotel and staff. Hours after we checked in, one of our travelling companions had a major coronary event and needed an ambulance. The front desk phone went 35 minutes unanswered! Finally a call to security resulted in an almost immediate paramedic crew from a local ambulance crew. No onsite personnel for medical emergencies are at this hotel. This information is provided as neither a pro nor a con, but is provided for informational purposes. Incidentally during the whole 4 day stay, 4 attempts were made to contact the front desk and the phone was never answered once although it was manned. With our friends at the hospital and my wife and I left to look after their brother, it was left to me to get the front desk straightened out as to what was going on. I failed to mention that when we went to check in that the hotel had, for inexplicable reasons, split my reservation into a single night and three nights. At 2AM when we were checking in, I attempted to get it put together, but they were unable to do so and I was told to come back in the morning, or later in the morning in this case! I did explain to the desk that my friends were unable to get their rooms swapped and that their stuff and a handicapped man was still in the room due to the emergency. After much sweet talking and pleading, the clerk disappeared behind the seemingly magic door and reappeared with news that they could remain in the penthouse (which is very nice) one more night. This was a big plus, but it is pretty much the last one. My wife and I stayed in room 3605. At first look, the room is noticeably outdated with a flatscreen television that somehow seems surreal in the antique room. There are no coffee pots in these rooms and ours was missing a hairdryer although the bracket was there. When we asked for one, we were answered with a huffy, “There is supposed to be one in there!” My wife felt like they were accusing her of stealing it, but they did bring one after a considerable wait. Most of the staff we encountered were either rude, clueless or moved at the speed of a glacier. Please know that our expectations are not high and we are friendly, outgoing people and have never written a bad review ever. Back to the room… The bathroom was Spartan to say the best. One of the sink faucets had no stop in it and turning it off was like breaking into a safe until you could find just the right combination. The room was dirty and I am pretty sure the bedspreads only get washed after someone dies on one of them. The windows were incredibly filthy. I am one to recognize that when I rent a room for very little like we did that carpet will be threadbare and things will have chips and scratches, breaks etc, but even those things can be cleaned. The telephone is useless because nobody at the other end even answers it, although I did find it interesting that they still have a rotary switch! Last disgusting note on the room: when we were packing up to leave, I checked under the beds as always to look for the misplaced sock or whatever and when I lifted the bed-skirt on the unused bed on the outside wall, there was, God as my witness, a used condom lying there. It gave me the heebie-jeebies and I couldn’t get the wife to take a picture of it for the review, but you cannot make that sort of thing up. The breakfast buffet was fairly unremarkable although there are lots of choices. The food was average, but the service was abysmal. We had the misfortune of having a server named Cornell (I told you I would remember your name), and this guy either hates his job or is independently wealthy and doesn’t need it. We were seated at a recently used table by the hostess and we noted that there was a large amount of eggs, food and God knows what else lining the edge of the table. We nicely asked if it could be cleaned and he, in a flash got a really snotty attitude and stated we should sit somewhere else if we wanted it cleaned. Slightly aghast after not getting any sleep whatsoever the night before, we noted he was pointing at the floor and we explained we were talking about the edge of the table. He slapped a rag across it and some of it was removed while some of it found its way to the seating surface which I just cleaned myself after seeing how volatile he was. When he asked for our drink order, I asked my handicapped friend what he wanted and he replied, “White milk.” I asked Cornell for 2 coffees and white milk and he snottily replied, “We only have one kind!” Off he went in a huff. Shaking our heads, we went and loaded some plates with mediocre, but filling food. When we returned we noted there were only two sets of flatware, so with just a little apprehension, we asked for another set. He glared, and went off to the magic silverware place and returned with 2 sets, but now here is the good part…. As he walked past our table toward some other unfortunate guest, he literally pitched the silverware on our table and it slid to the back edge. I have never seen anything like it and I have teenagers! That was our last meal at the Riviera Buffet, and management, if you are reading this, you can thank Cornell for us eating there once. The food was bearable. He was not. (Readers: The Circus Circus accross the street has nicer people and better food at their buffet. Make the short walk.) The Casino is okay. Drink service is slow and unpredictable. The bell staff move like tortoises but at least they mean well and are very polite. I have more to tell, but think you get the picture. Stay somewhere else until they get their act together. The place actually has potential, but they need to clean things, train staff and basically make people feel like they enjoy serving them. Oh yeah, one last feature… No hot water the last day before we checked out. Maybe that’s how they get people to check out faster?

Reviews.Title: “Vegas History all around”
Reviews.Author: McGeepers
Reviews.Content: Room type; Penthouse suite : Stats: Beds; comfy large king. Bathroom; 3 in total, one with a spa, old school styling and fitting. Check in; Slow. Overall impression; It was great to stay in a suite where some of the best entertainers may have spent some time. That was the attraction for us. The suite is impressive with high ceilings a wet bar and a large balcony with seating. The 2 let downs were the time to check in and the fact that for a penthouse suite the room was a little ragged (stained carpet etc). There are only a few of the old Vegas places like the Riviera left so visit them for change.

Reviews.Title: “would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: daren777
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights. Good flight & hotel deal on expedia. Room was clean. Staff were helpful. Didn't have any issues.

Reviews.Title: “loved my stay here :)”
Reviews.Author: Manda J
Reviews.Content: was here feb.24th - 26th! easy checking however had wait a hour for our which is fine we cause we checked in early and it wasnt ready so i understood ! got a free upgrade to the manaco towers luxery room ! our rooms were so nice and the staff really worked with seeing as this trip was gift to my mom for her 50th bday ! i personally belive people are to cirtical of this hotel it perfectly fine hotel ! ya get what you pay for and i personally love the riviera and deff will be returning on our next vist to vegas!!! the staff was excellent thanks mary for all your help you were a doll :) the room was beautiful and clean and beds were so comfortable i slept like a baby! casino was awsome love the cheep slots won 25 bucks :)

Reviews.Title: “OK, but will neer stay there agian”
Reviews.Author: MrsSmirnoff95
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Riviera for three nights 2/18-2/21 and it was OK, you get what you pay for: poor customer service, just OK casino with bad AC and a long walk to the front desk. After reserving a luxury room and paying for it we were told that all of them are non-smoking even thou they charge us for a luxury/ remodeled room we had to get a deluxe room with old and uncomfortable furniture and bed. After talking to the front desk we learn that they will not to do anything to reimburse us or put us in the room that we paid for. Room was clean but in need of remodel or at least a touch up. Housekeeping was another story, so after the first night we left good tips for a housekeeping person just to come back to our room to find out that our bed was made and we got three new towels that was it. No vacuuming, no clean cups, full ashtrays and of course money were gone. The last night of our stay we came back at the hotel at two in the morning to discover the dirty laundry all along the hallway, just dumped in front of the rooms. The buffet was nice; of course the menu was not a five star restaurant, but good choice of breakfast and lunch food and a lot of fresh fruit.

Reviews.Title: “Untrained staff ruins it all”
Reviews.Author: Carlynn
Reviews.Content: Yes this place is affordable and clean enough, has decent rooms, restaurants and shops, and the casino is well laid out. Nothing feels nice though, with a bunch of ill-mannered keystone cops running the whole thing. Check-in was a nightmare. Took 2 hours, with the desk staff yelling at customers rather than greeting them. I was assigned a room already in use, made the long trek with my luggage only to walk in on someone, returned to the desk to straighten it out and the woman picked up the phone and started yelling at the man in the room to get out. Poor guy spoke little English, had just had me walk in on him while he was napping, and now was being told to pack up and leave! When her brilliant supervisor suggested she give me another room, there wasn't an apology to either one of us. During this whole time, I had left the family to wait by the elevators. The 2 teenagers sat on the floor and the guard made them stand up. They then decided to go get ice cream at a vendor they could see from the elevators and the guard again told them to stand up against the wall and not move, even though there were no gaming tables between them and the few yards they needed to walk to get a treat. The final straw was when I called downstairs to say the hallway was flooding (someone had turned on the bath water and then fallen asleep). It took forever for someone to come up to check on it, and then wanted to use our room to call the adjoining rooms to see who was in. When I told them we were getting ready to leave, that we had already waited for them so we'd know our room would be okay, their rudeness became threatening. If we had run into a few disgruntled employees, I wouldn't have thought much about it. But everyone seemed to have been trained to treat guests like an enemy of the house. Don't spend a minute of your vacation in a place like this.

Reviews.Title: “Older hotel, but still clean and kept up”
Reviews.Author: Sewfastnow
Reviews.Content: We stayed there because it was a great price. We stayed in the newer refurbished tower. Pd 20.00 extra per night. It was very clean, friendly and we felt safe. The shower was powerful. I'd stay there again if we got another good price.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Room, Nice Bed and free WiFi but beware the B'fast Buffet!”
Reviews.Author: zildana
Reviews.Content: Now that the Hilton no longer owns the LV Hotel I was looking for another low-key, moderate-priced hotel with at least some of the amenities I used to get at the former Hilton like free wifi, mini-fridge, spa/fitness center and breakfast. Surprisingly-- for a Vegas strip hotel--the Riv does offer hotel-wide wifi and fitness center acccess as part of its addtional mandatory daily "resort fee" and for $5 more I got an upgraded room with a micro-fridge. The breakfast buffet was a relative bargain at $12 and though limited in variety, the quality was fairly good and I quite enjoyed my made-to-order omlette the first day though I was disappointed there was no lox and no grapefruit or tomato juice or any special teas. Unfortunately, the 2nd AM the omlette was a bit runny and I stupidly ate it anyway cuz I was in a hurry and almost immediately regretted it. I had planned to try the dinner buffet but decided against it and also passed on breakfast the last day. I agree with other reviewers that it's an older property and the staff was not particularly warm or welcoming--even the valets didn't address me by name! They do seem to be carrying out extensive renovations and the pool area looked very nice but it was too cold to use it. Though on the strip it's closer to downtown than the airport but I always rent a car so I getting around was no problem. It's actually not far beyond Wynn and just across LV Blvd fron Circus, Circus. The bed was comfy and there was good water pressure in the shower/tub. The room was smaller than at the Hilton or Flamingo and cost more due to the added resort fee but given how hard is is to find free wifi and fitness centers on the Strip it wasn't unreasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Clean rooms, comfy beds and great location.”
Reviews.Author: FitMom68
Reviews.Content: Stayed here Feb 10 -15 as I was in a Wedding at this hotel. Wedding was great and the Hotel staff did a fantastic job organizing. Front desk are quick and efficient. However, they lack welcoming warmth. I had a room that was remodelled and it was clean, comfy and quiet with a good view of the city and pool. The Casino was overly smoky so I did not hang around them. Not a lot of action here but just one block away you will enter the new strip of Las Vegas where it's booming everywhere. I liked this location for it's convenience, price and that it was quiet. I don't understand why they have resort fees for $ 11.00 per day. The pool was not open and it was too smoky to hang around the hotel. Terrible ventilation. WiFi is free but not consistently working all over the hotel. Room service was quick and very tasty food. Good healthy choices to choose from. However, Coffee was pricey. If you want cheap breakfast and good coffee then Denny's is just a block away. Next to the Hotel is a food court where you can get a variety of choices. The Taxis are overpriced but you can get the bus everywhere for $7.00 all day pass. Hotel Airport shuttle from Riviera is only $5.00. Good deal! When I went walking through the newer hotels they had signs up saying no resort fees and although people were smoking the ventilation was good. Next time I will probably choose Encore just down the street as I was able to breathe there and there are no resort fees. I don't think I would book here again due to poor ventilation.

Reviews.Title: “Historic, rustic and vintage.”
Reviews.Author: Mraschio
Reviews.Content: All the terms used for out dated places. One of the cheaper spots on the strip. Booked with Casablanca of course the room has only two doubles so we have to pay for a upgrade to king bed. So much for customer service. Don't try VI. Bunch of used car salesmen! The Asian food was lack luster.

Reviews.Title: “January Trip to Vegas”
Reviews.Author: luvtogamble_10
Reviews.Content: Made a quite trip to Vegas in January and stayed at the Riveria. The rooms were very nice, the staff were terrific but it really isn't in a nice area. I was quite uncomfortable walking back to my hotel the first night and rode the bus the rest of the trip. I don't think I would go back, not because of the hotel, but the location is not for me.

Reviews.Title: “Ok, but very tired hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Candi P
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here February 16-19, 2012 for the Nike football clinic. I was a little nervous about staying at this hotel after reading other reviews, but we decided to try it. At arrival we had to wait at least 45 minutes to check in, and this was at 11:30 at night. The girl who checked us in did not offer any other information than where our room was. We wanted to know if there was Wi-Fi available, check out time, you know your basic information. I felt customer service was lacking on her part. Our room was a newly remodeled room in the Monaco Tower. Our first night was not peaceful! Our next door neighbor took a shower at 1 am and I heard everything! The music from outside was heard through the windows as were the people walking in the halls at 5 am. I think they need to invest some money into sound proofing their rooms. I asked to be moved and they graceously moved us to a higher floor and we had no problems after that. The room was nothing fancy, but clean. The casino is tired but you can tell it was the place to be in it's day. The food court was filled with over-priced food. My husband enjoyed the buffet. Unfortunately, we will not return. We had issues with the price of the room, but I don't want to bash this hotel anymore than I need too. I will pay the few extra dollars and stay in a different hotel next time.

Reviews.Title: “I liked it alot”
Reviews.Author: ontarioeskimo
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one week April 2011. There was no long line for check in for me. The rooms are fine and I did not have an upgrade and there was an in room safe for a small fee. Staff was friendly. Casino was never overly crowded. I like to play poker but there never seemed to be much going on in the poker pit. The breakfast buffet was good. The food court offers good choices. The pool was a good place to chill and read a book or people watch. Circus Circus is across the street and so is Slots O Fun . Bus stop right there too. The giftshop is handy to grab a beer or snack or souvenir.

Reviews.Title: “BEWARE- Read all reviews before staying”
Reviews.Author: JSJGSedona
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked the Riviera for our Anniversary. Had planned a trip on the strip but somewhat "away" form everything so we could have a weekend at ONE resort. Planned to see all the shows and stay on property for the entire weekend. Well that did not happen. After a 3 hour dirve we had to stand in the check in line for an hour, asked to upgrade our room. Upon check in of our room the bathroom was disgusting, it had not been wiped down at all, the toilet had blood on the toilet lid, hairs all over the bathroom and the ceiling was full of mold. We contacted the front desk, they convieniently sent a doorman up to move our room. Second room we entered and there was a dirty wash cloth on the floor and the bathroom was in worse condition than the first. Fecal matter on the upper and lower lid of the toilet, The shower had not been cleaned. At this time, we returned to the front desk and asked to speak to management, they never arrived. The front desk staff member stated "we want to keep you in this tower because this is our best tower".. REALLY what would we have been staying in if we did not uhm UPGRADE? He did "graciously" place us in a petite suite. Okay conditon was so so. Not impressed at all. Then stated that they were placing a $179 charge on our card, could not explain why and advised us to keep an eye on our accout to make sure it would fall off. Went to the second room to get our belongings, moved to the petie suite and realized one of our bags had been left in the first room. Called down asking to have soemone meet us to get this and got sent to lost and found? Finally was able to get housekeeping, yes apparently they do have staff in housekeeping. To meet us to get the one bag. After our 21/2 hr process of checking in we went to the casino floor to play and have a drink. The casino floor was HOT, dirty and smelly, we opted for a draft beer at the lounge which came out as warm vinegar. We left the property at this time and enjoyed shows at dinners at the other properties! Our weekend that was to be romantic and in one place ended up being we spent that entire time moving and relocating to other properties clear down the strip, which was time consumig and we eneded up spending more money that could have went to the prorperty we chose to stay at. However, the Bed was comfortable and the only highlight to our stay there was our one meal on site at the Pool side cafe (which had holes in the ceiling) was the food and our server was amazing, she made that place. Unfortuanatly not enough for us to ever consider staying there again though. In looking at the previous review they have been advised of these issues and managemnt address them staying we will improve and have clearly failed to.

Reviews.Title: “Don't be lured by a bargain price.”
Reviews.Author: SusanKS_912
Reviews.Content: Stayed during a convention which was held at the Riviera. Don't do it, the place is awful. Dirty & worn out.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, nice staff!”
Reviews.Author: WillTravel2TryFood
Reviews.Content: We received three comp nights at The Riviera so we decided to stay. It is an older hotel so I was not sure what to expect. We were pleasantly surprised. The room was on the 45th floor of the new tower which I believe they mean newly remodeled. The room was very nice and spacious. It was non-smoking and modern with a flat screen TV and very comfortable bed. The food court was a bit outdated but food was descent and prices were average. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “have they lost the plot?”
Reviews.Author: Derekpen
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel a number of times over the past ten years. It hosts a convention which I attend and is therefore the obvious place to stay. The Hotel rooms and public areas have been remodelled recently in an attempt to inject a breath of fresh air into this dated Las Vegas Hotel. Unfortunately customer service has gone down hill. Check in is a tiresome process and long lines are not uncommen. Last weekend saw delays of two hours or more! Free wi-fi looks good however the system is useless wih low signal and very slow connection speeds rendering the whole excercise futile. We were expected to pay the full room rate up-front, usually we have paid on departure. I guess this is a result of the hotel's chapter 11 financial situation. not a good omen. I shall not be returning to this Hotel. Time has run out for them. There are many more Hotels on the strip which would appreciate my custom. I look forward to visiting them in the years ahead.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed there 3 years in a row.”
Reviews.Author: Kerik7700
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Riviera 3 years in a row, each time for a week. We booked the rooms in support of our use of the conference rooms at the Hotel. Each year the check in line is an hour wait, (only 6-10 people in line) (every time we walked past there were frustrated people inline) Rooms were not properly cleaned. Not even wiped down. We reserved Two double beds online, They told us in person, "That Means NOTHING" Ended up with a King Bed & COT, Not impressed. (They renovated, last year but is still very dated.) Mobile Entertainers will hopefully band together to have our annual event relocated. D. Kerik

Reviews.Title: “Good location but renovations needed asap!”
Reviews.Author: Donnamar
Reviews.Content: We had two rooms on the 5th floor in the South Towers and they both had problems with heat/AC and electrical. They both looked well worn, although clean and the mini fridge cabinet in one was rotted out. They moved part of our family to another room but it was not much better. They also moved registration to the back by valet and the self parking garage so the walk to our elevators was pretty long with our luggage. The food court should be done away with as it is so old and lame and horrable. I walked across the strret every morning for coffee. We went to the buffet breakfast once and never again. We have eaten all over Vegas and we like small, less expensive places but this was over priced and just not good. We went to Palace Station for their wonderful $4.95 breakfast buffet...yum! Overall, the location to the airport is great and central location on the strip is good but they desparetly need on overhaul.

Reviews.Title: “A classic that has lost it's class”
Reviews.Author: lex_loci_david
Reviews.Content: So this is a cheap hotel and casino which hasn't been renovated since the 1970's. It used to be quite the place. Now it is faded, jaded and sorely past it's use by date. Having said that, it has some charm. What can you say about a place that has it's own tattoo parlour? I Liked that: - The staff were friendly and happy. - the hotel provides free car parking and free wireless Internet which worked fine. - My room was clean and quite large. - the TV channels were quite good. - the beds were quite good I thought. I can also say: - the decor is cheap and tacky. - they charge you a mandatory resort fee ($11). If the pool is closed you still don't get to use it. - a convenience store is located in the building. - the casino looked pretty lame. The place has a food court which was ok (I guess), but I recommend going next door to the peppermill which is fantastic (although it costs more). This is not a good hotel for kids.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Room - Sub Par Otherwise”
Reviews.Author: BoiseTravelGirl
Reviews.Content: We had a convention at the Riviera so we decided to stay there. We had a newer room in the Monaco Tower which was pretty nice. Small fridge, flat screen tv, wireless internet. The hotel and convention center need help. They want to promote their rat pack history but arent willing to invest in it - even to play music from that generation would help. Convention center had constant sound problems....embarrassing for a disc jockey convention! The small restaurants in food court are great - and have reasonable prices. We didn't eat at any of the other restaurants in the hotel because of other reviews.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap Prices for a reason”
Reviews.Author: Macer19
Reviews.Content: There was hair in the sink when we got there. We had a renovated room and it was still disgusting. Flat screen TV and the comfy bed were the only two positive things. Worst smelling casino out of all of them. Location isn't great but it is on strip (Far North End). Casino itself was outdated,smelly, and quite ugly compared to all the other casinos on the strip. Wifi did not work in the room once. Had to call some random IT number and they said they would notify us when it was fixed. That never happened and suffice to say we had no Internet access.

Reviews.Title: “Buffet at Riveria Hotel Casino”
Reviews.Author: KDWorldTraveler
Reviews.Content: I have visited most of the top buffets in Las Vegas, not only on the Strip, but surrounding neighborhood Hotel/Casinos as well. The buffet at the Riveria for $14.26 cents has to be the absolute worst food experience for the dollar that I have seen yet. In all of Las Vegas. I am being this hard in the review because of the ridiculous price they are charging for mere school cafeteria quality food. I should have realized I was in trouble when at noon, I was the only person in line. Salad bar, better at a pizza hut. Soups, better from Progresso. Meat, only a ham, and a cheap one. Vegetables? a steamed new potatoe. Wow. The brocollini was OK, mini corn cobs, Really? Fried Shrimp, right from the frozen bag they came from, 90% breading, tiny tasteless shrimp. I did not dare try the BBQ ribs, I feared shoeleather. In summary two can eat for this price at one of the Station casinos with about 75% more choices of quality prepared foods. The flan for desert was passable, but for $2-3 more, you can eat like royalty at Paris buffet. Take the cab ride and really enjoy your meal. I will never eat here again. It should be $5.95 and appeal to those who dont care where their food comes from, just quantity.

Reviews.Title: “Ghost town version of the 70s”
Reviews.Author: nuttinsweeta
Reviews.Content: My husband and I received a free stay in the Riviera for going to a time share presentation. When we walked into the casino it was like being transported back into the 70s. The whole time we were there, there wasn't a single song played in the lobby or the casino that was made after 1979. And the people who worked there looked like they had been working there since the hotel opened. Sadly, it seemed like there was never more than 10 people in the hotel. It was very depressing. And the Riviera is so far from most of the action on the strip that we ended up spending as much in cab fare as we would have spent on our hotel room.

Reviews.Title: “This is NOT a resort!”
Reviews.Author: Loretta L
Reviews.Content: This place is a JOKE! We had to change rooms 3 times after a long trip. Talking to 'management' everyday did nothing to resolve our problems. The last room we were in was so disgustingly filthy we didn't even want to stand in the tub to shower let alone sit in the whirlpool tub. The windows were grimy and our view was of garbage bins and a parking lot. I would never stay here again and I pity the poor fool who ends up booking a room here!!

Reviews.Title: “Horrible”
Reviews.Author: pov p
Reviews.Content: Dont stay here. We stayed here for 2 nights at 24/ night. The heater was very loud and woke us up everytime it turned on. The casino smelt like crap, there was poor air ventilation and our clothes and hair stunk pretty bad of stale cigarettes for 2 days. The carpeting in the halls of the main floor were all worn out, the servers were old hags in short shorts and the pole dancing girls looked like dudes, looked anorexic and danced very skanky. We were on the top floor and the room was nice but the tub had a PUBE in it. we kept hearing thumping and banging and apparently there was a penthouse above us and they had a function till 11pm. So we were woken up at 7am by LOUD frickin piano music being played, complained to the security, then suddenly it got louder. It went on for 3 hours. We complained to the manager, (because they NEVER answer the phone wtf!) she hardly made eye contact with my bf, looked very annoyed, said sorry, switched our room, gave our resort fee back (which the wifi didnt work for me anyway). She said "one minute" then didnt return, she sent the guy back instead. (lovely management) You get what you pay for and we did not enjoy our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Needs Work”
Reviews.Author: ReceptionManager319
Reviews.Content: Booked online through another vendor, room received was disgusting; the bathroom had mold, the walls and floors were horrible. Asked to change rooms and received a similar room with a different bathroom, this time a bath tub that looked dirty and the shower head had mildew as well. When reported it to the front desk the next morning and showed them pictures of what I saw in the room and asked to get a cleaner room and a possible upgrade, the reply was: 'You booked online and that's what you paid for' if you want to upgrade there's a charge. I said: okay, what do I need to do to change rooms? Reply: come back later, housekeeping is here until 5pm but I have nothing ready now. I asked to guarantee my upgrade and the person at the desk said: "We do not guarantee anything at the desk" Really!? What an answer. I left and returned after 5pm, spoke to the same employee and she gave me keys to a different room on a different tower, better room but this hotel needs major attention. Surprinsingly, I was not charged for the upgrade, I think she realized how wrong she was when dealing with me. Would not recommend.

Reviews.Title: “My stay at the Riviera”
Reviews.Author: sporster80
Reviews.Content: The hotel isn't one of the fanciest in Las Vegas but it is also not the most expensive . It's very convienant to the Las Vegas Convention Center and other hotels . Service is good and the restaurants are excellant

Reviews.Title: “Great stay for the money.”
Reviews.Author: Tootsie238400
Reviews.Content: Nice big rooms and clean. The rates were great best stay for the money. We were comfortable when we were in the room. The bed slept comfortable. Went to Johnathan Clark there.He was incredible!! A must see. He will be big time soon their. and we see alot of shows. The poolside cafe had great breakfast but you paid for it. like $20.00 per person. I ate breakfast their all week if that says anything.lol Under new ownership, so they have changed a few things around, took a little to get use to but like they say change is good. needs some updating but i would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel on the strip”
Reviews.Author: Barry P
Reviews.Content: This was perhaps the worst experience that I ever encountered in Las Vegas. They charge a $7.00 resort fee but the pool was drained, free internet did not work, and I cannot figure out where the resort part of the hotel is. I went to lock up my laptop in the safe but they charge $3.50 per day. That's right, $3.50 per day to keep my stuff safe from THEIR employees. Drinks in the lounge were the same price as the top end hotels but here they were out of most of the popular bees and drinks. It was obvious that the hotel is experiencing significant financial issues.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the price”
Reviews.Author: fatboygirl94
Reviews.Content: We stayed there from 1/26 to 1/30. The check in was a breeze, the room was very nice and clean. We stayed in the newly updated rooms. The elevators were very fast. No complaints at all. There is a restaurant next door called Peppermill which is awesome. The casino was a tad smokey, but not bad. We had free internet and it was great. Had a very strong signal and no problems at all with that. The shuttle stops right out front and takes you up and down the strip. Check out was also a breeze. All in all, it was a great place to stay, especially with the low rates.

Reviews.Title: “Is being cheap and close to the LVCC really enough?”
Reviews.Author: KnaveSharpener
