Reviews.Content: I hadn't looked forward to staying at the Riv. Previous reviews hadn't painted a great picture of the hotel, or its hospitality, but since the Sahara, my previous Vegas home from home (see my two reviews of it), had closed its doors in Spring 2011, the Riv was the nearest inexpensive full-service hotel to the Las Vegas Convention Center, a walking distance that wasn't onerous. There was quite a long line for the checkin desk, but I wasn't in a hurry, and the checkin clerk was courteous and helpful. I left the desk with a "fun book", and a map to guide me to my room - a nice touch. I couldn't help thinking that it took much longer to check in than at other Strip hotels - definitely a procedural thing rather than a staff problem, as all three clerks on duty were taking about the same time per customer. The Riv could do with buying in a consultant's time to find out what's slowing things, and work out how to streamline checkin without appearing brusque. I had a "signature room" (non smoking) in the Monaco tower. It was a very nice accommodation, with perhaps a little more space than the Sahara offered. The bedside alarm clock/radio took a bit of working out, but was fine. The room also featured a decent-sized safe - more than big enough for a 13" laptop and all the valuables I wanted to store. Wi-fi was included in the price - but more on that later. The bed was big and _very_ comfortable - I can understand how the Riviera has a sideline selling satisfied guests the same brand of mattresses they use in the rooms. A steam iron and board were provided, and - big win - a decent-sized empty fridge. The room, one of those recently refurbished, looked and smelt clean, and was very nicely furnished and finished. The one disappointment was the aircon unit, which was shockingly noisy, even on the lowest settings, and unusable at night. The bathroom was Vegas average: a slightly short bath (necessary for water conservation, as the Colorado river simply isn't delivering as much volume to the Hoover dam as Vegas needs), and a reasonable-sized faux-marble counter with a backlit mirror. The sink had a crack, but didn't leak. Nothing special there, but fine. The extractor fan was noisy, but stopped as soon as the bathroom light was turned off - in some hotels, the fan runs for ages after the light's off, which is frustrating when you just want to turn in and get some sleep. I said I'd come back to the subject of the wi-fi. Basically, it didn't work. Sometimes the nearest access point was "visible", but ran at the speed of a slow dial-up; sometimes it just didn't appear on the list. And that wasn't because my wi-fi devices were broken - I had no problem "seeing" several access points at Circus Circus across the road. I did my best to find other guests who did have working wi-fi. I couldn't find any. Now, with apologies to other readers, I'm going to shout at the Riviera management: PARTICULARLY FOR OVERSEAS VISITORS, THE INTERNET IS *NOT* AN OPTIONAL EXTRA. When you're looking at roaming data costs of $10/MB (yes, that's per megabyte, it's not a typo), you DEPEND upon a working internet service at the hotel - and the Riviera's was terminally stuffed. This hotel gets its volume custom from Convention Center visitors - staying on business, in other words - and they ABSOLUTELY MUST have access to their email, web browsing, and so forth. I note that the hotel manager has been responding to reviews critical of the wi-fi, stating that the Riv is working to improve coverage. It's certainly true that there are not enough access points, as the current installations clearly do not have the capacity to cope with a full hotel's worth of connection attempts, but it's also pretty clear that the backhaul - the Riv's external internet "pipe" - is not nearly adequate to the task. I see that on the desktop lamp base, there's provision for an Ethernet socket. Wiring Ethernet to each room, and bringing that out through the lamp base's socket, would at least overcome the wi-fi side of the problem. Beyond the room itself, let's talk about the rest of the hotel. The layout is...bizarre. It does take a bit of getting used to, but the map given to me at checkin helped. I didn't eat at any of the hotel's restaurants, so can't rate them. Parking was plentiful: there were more than enough spaces even during the peak CES week. The casino floor was never all that busy. Part of the problem might be related to the annoying little stickers on every machine: "Minimum 25c bet to qualify for free cocktail." I can't imagine which [--]-clenched penny-pinching little bureaucrat thought _that_ would encourage people to stay and play (many of the penny machines only went up to 15 or 20 paylines) - but suffice to say that I've never seen anything like that in any other Vegas casino, and suffice also to note that I've never seen so few people playing the slots. There was a stage behind one bar overlooking the main casino floor, and there was some good music coming from it. Unfortunately, unless you were seated at that bar, the piped music over the general PA fought tooth and claw with the live music, resulting in a miserable mish-mash at close range, and inaudibility beyond. What's the point in paying decent performers, if you drown them out? Far better to hook them into the PA, and broadcast the live performance across the casino floor - it might even inject some life into the place. I did spend some time (well, about 4-5 hours if the truth be told) at the Pai Gow Poker table on my last evening, a Friday. Over that period, we had several dealers, most of whom were friendly and fun - although one did look as if someone had taken his teddy bear away. The cocktail waitress was noticeable by her absence most of the time, but it wasn't her fault - there was only one for more-or-less all the gaming tables. (C'mon managers, if people go dry, they wander off; do you really want that?) Whoever's in charge of the casino floor is asleep on the switch, or hasn't ever risked asking visitors what they think of it. It's by far the worst and least hospitable casino I've ever experienced in Vegas, and I think I've played in most of them at some time or other. Even the off-strip small-scale hotels are universally better than this. The only redeeming feature is the staff on the casino floor, who seem a decent bunch, if over-stretched. I ended up doing most of my evening playing at Circus Circus over the road, or the Tropicana at the other end of the strip, whose gaming floor is brightly lit and cheerful, the cocktail waitresses are friendly and so regular that I never had an empty glass, and played a great music selection, mostly classic rock, over the PA. So what's to be said for the Riv? On the plus side, the signature rooms are pretty decent, apart from the ridiculously loud aircon units. And it's cheap, convenient for the LVCC, and car-friendly. On the minus side: the appalling internet (non)connection, long waits for checkin that could be fixed by staffing the remaining windows and sorting out the checkin procedures, and a casino that offers potential players more hostility than hospitality. For next year's CES, I'd have to see evidence from staff and reviewers that the Riv has its internet problems fixed before I'd consider it again. I'd _like_ to use it again, but I really can't justify the cost savings if I can't keep running a business because there's no connectivity. I'm seriously considering the Trop for next year. If the "minus side" problems were fixed, the Riv would rate at least three "blobs", maybe even four, but I can't award more than a two-blob rating as it stands, even though the room was better than I could have hoped.

Reviews.Title: “One of the old greats!”
Reviews.Author: delong
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Riviera as part of a tour package. It is an old hotel, very inexpensive, and needs a little upgrade....but....it is old Las Vegas and for that......it gets a little break.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel with glorious past in great need of rehabilitation…”
Reviews.Author: FRWorldCitizen
Reviews.Content: Stayed 5 nights in January 2012 during CES for an average of 200€/night, breakfast not included. Old fashioned hotel ideally located on the northern part of the Strip. Walking distance from the Convention Center. Clean standard rooms with a comfortable king bed, a desk area, a large drawer-dresser, a small bathroom with a bathtub. Bar fridge, safe & cable TV. Free wifi but extremely poor connection… Lousy facilities include an uninviting steakhouse, a shabby Chinese restaurant, an english pub, and the usual casino. Free self parking. Won't get back…

Reviews.Title: “Recent renovations improved hotel/casino greatly”
Reviews.Author: vickibrower
Reviews.Content: I am at the Riviera for the first time in 5 years as I write this review. The hotel changed ownership last year and the new owners revived renovations that had been put on hold. Some construction is still going on, but it doesn't interfere with traffic and getting around the casino. Monaco towers was updated with new carpets, drapes, vanities and fixtures and large flat screen TVs. No smoke odor in tower or sleeping room which is a big plus for me! New penny slots have been added which are nice for those of us who aren't big gamblers to play on. Housekeeping was timely this morning and housekeeper was both friendly and thorough. Queen Victoria Pub is a nice hangout and very British - even has a dart room. Great Beatles review Mon - Sat at 9 on a stage replica of the Cavern Club where the Beatles were discovered. On N end of strip but lots to see and do nearby.

Reviews.Title: “The WORST Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Eileen S
Reviews.Content: This is the Worst hotel to stay at in Vegas! The management only cares about getting your money! Service is awful. Room service menu is a Lie! and they only serve till 10pm, IN VEGAS? What is up with that?!!! They don't even think enough of their customers to let them come in and check in at the front! You are SO embarrassing to them, they make you come in the back alley door! This is one of the worst managed hotels in Vegas! I have stayed here before several times but NEVER again!!

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away...Lots of better choices”
Reviews.Author: Chuck W
Reviews.Content: My worst ever stay in Vegas! Dying old hotel in need of a good cleaning and lots of paint. Booked a deluxe suite (non-smoking/king) and at check in they tried to "bait-and switch" to a petite suite. Had a front desk manager lie to my face about what I booked. Lucky I had my printouts of the reservation! They coughed up the correct room after I "insisted", it was smoking but a suite as booked. I had booked an ajoining deluxe(non-smoking/ king) room and when they corrected the suite issue they screwed up the ajoining room. Asked for an upgrade for the inconvience and they blew it off. They came up with our second room for us 9 floors away in same building. It was a nanny's room between two suites, no fridge with two queen beds and a broken room safe. They said it would be an hour to make up the room, took 6 hours to get it right! Called for fix on safe and 5 days later it still was dead. Gave us buffett comp/ worst ever buffett, yuk! .Charged resort fees of $11/day to stare at drained pool, wi-fi did'nt work. There are to many better choices and they had more than one chance to "make it right" they failed every time .NEVER AGAIN>>>

Reviews.Title: “The old lady lives on”
Reviews.Author: Monirae
Reviews.Content: This hotel/casino is one of the oldest on the strip and if it were not for the convention being held there we wouldn't chose to stay here. It isn't that it is dirty or anything it is just old and they haven't kept up with things like they maybe could have.

Reviews.Title: “Visit the Steakhouse”
Reviews.Author: Greyhound661
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my husband in October. The hotel is a bit older but it is an excellent value. The rooms were comforble and well appointed. The steakhouse was amazing; there were few other people there so we were helped quickly. It's upscale but much less expensive than other comparable upscale restaurants. The poolside cafe was also great, it looks trashy but we had a great meal. I highly recommend staying here if you are on a budget and want to stay a cheap cab ride away from the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Classic Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Summertime4me
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my family last August. We will for sure be back this coming summer! The RIviera is a true Vegas Classic as Vegas should be. While it is at the end of the Strip you can still walk the strip after all it is only 4 miles and there is so much to look at along the way. We arrived early . The only down side to this hotel is that check in is at 4 if they have a room ready you should be able to check in no matter what the time is. The hotel was Vintage Vegas which is a breath of fresh air considering all the others except a few are way too modern. The room we had was in the Mediterranean North Tower.It had just been remodeled which was nice . It had Comfy beds nice shower and for those who like them a flat screen tv, which I could care less about your are on Vacation you are not there to watch TV. Everything was extreamly clean that is the one thing I worry about. The size of a room and what is offered in room is of no intrest to me. The food court was nice they had a nice choice of food. There is a McDonalds across the street and a Dennys about a block down. The pool was very nice and clean. The Casino is also very nice because it is not crowded. There isa Duce Bus stop right in front of the hotel so you can hop right on. This is a Great Hotel to stay in if you want Vintage Vegas and less crowds. Thanks for a Great Stay Riviera!! Looking foward to stay with you again this year

Reviews.Title: “not bad for the money”
Reviews.Author: BluegirlMinneapolis
Reviews.Content: Had to be in Vegas for a couple of trade shows, and the swankier hotels were horribly overpriced. Found a good internet deal for "recently renovated rooms" for a jaw dropping $38.00 per night. Weekends were $56.00. Rooms were about average. Bathroom was recently renovated. I was plagued by the short people shower faucet though, and had to practically bend myself in half to get my head under it. Room service wasn't bad. Fan would not shut off and was very noisy. Beds were OK. Check in was fine, no waiting. Ate at the R restaurant - very good. Also checked out the Banana Leaf - OK, not great. Did grab coffee at one of the many little stands throughout the hotel. All in all, for what I paid, this was a deal with no problems.

Reviews.Title: “Good location for CES, otherwise, room for improvement.”
Reviews.Author: RespectTheTruth
Reviews.Content: We chose The Riviera only for its proximity to LVCC - no taxis needed at either end is the only selling feature of this hotel. Check-in on January 9th was beyond dreadful -the lineup at 10:30 PM was over an hour long, which could have been easily avoided if the registration counter had been staffed with enough people. A bellman later informed us that lineups earlier that day were up to 3 hours. During our time in the lineup we saw that the staff was poorly managed - there were 2 clerks near the VIP check in section who were not participating in the general check in when there were no VIP customers checking in. One of the 2 spent inordinate amounts of time on the phone. There was caustic disregard for guests waiting in the line...not a single chair or couch was provided for those accompanying the guest who was checking in. Does no one get it that hotels are supposed to be in the service business? Then when our turn finally came, we were told that our confirmed non smoking room was sold out and we were given an inferior room in a smoking area of the hotel. Only after a frustrating series of phone calls the next morning were we moved to a decent room in The Monaco Tower. Poolside Cafe staff and breakfast food were good as was a little snackbar near the registration desk. Wifi was unacceptable and was rarely available. The room rate for CES was reasonable, but the improvements to the problems described above are not high cost fixes.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible experience”
Reviews.Author: footballmom3
Reviews.Content: No internet access although you pay for it. So I'm screwed and can't work. R steakhouse staff rude. Buffet is disgusting. Call front desk and be prepared to be on hold forever.

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad place to stay..”
Reviews.Author: bkmDenver
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a birthday weekend. Had an adjoining room with some friends. The good: The rooms are ok. The beds were good. There are nice flat screen tv's in the rooms and the small referigerator was great. We walked down to the store next door and picked up beverages to keep at the roon. We had a great Irish breakfast at the Queen Victoria pub. McDonalds, Circus Circus and Slots O' Fun are right across the street. The Deuce Bus picks up right in front of the casino. They have a late check out (6pm) for $28. Well worth it. The bad: No coffee maker in the room. The gym/spa was pretty sad. It had 1 working elliptical and about a 1973 stairmaster. There was a good selection of weight lifting equipment though. The pool was closed (for the season) and the hot tub in the gym/spa would have been $15 per person. The tennis courts were very rough. There are pretty bad pot holes in them. I waited on hold for about an hour to request a late checkout. I finally just went down to the front desk. This hotel/casino seems very quiet compared to the places on the south end of the strip. There is not much going on here. There are a few things around the hotel, but you need to go up to Freemont St. or Down to the south Strip area to see the sights.

Reviews.Title: “I'm embarrassed to tell people I stayed there.”
Reviews.Author: TokyoBob1975
Reviews.Content: Stayed from 9 to 13 January 2012 to attend the Consumer Electronics Show (CES) 2012 along with 20+ co-workers.  My last stay at this property was Jan 2006, and my first stay was early 2003.  Overall, the public areas of the hotel to include casino floor, hallways, hotel grounds, and food court have not changed since 2003.  Not really a good point, because they seemed run down in 2003.  I did notice the renovations to my room (Monaco Tower) since 2006. Hotel gave taxi, and in our case, limo drivers instructions to drop off at the South Lobby.  The problem is that drop off point is the furthest from the hotel’s registration desk.  No bellman or other staff at this drop off point, so guests are expected to find their own way to the registration desk.  In the past, check-in was possible at the South Lobby, but it was entirely shut down. Room included 40” LCD TV mounted to the wall which restricted viewing angles.  At most, there were 15 channels; the “best” channels were TBS and TNT.  Of course, the hotel does not want you to sit in your room watching TV.   WiFi cost $9.99/day, but during my entire stay, the longest I was able to stay online at one time was 1 hour—after midnight when other guests logged off.  Most often, the WiFi signal would drop every 10 to 15 minutes, if you could get a signal at all.  The fastest speed I was able to measure via SpeedTest was about 650Kbps-- not Mbps, Kbps.  Do not expect to use Skype, Netflix, or any other service that requires a real Internet connection.  Lack of a stable connection made it difficult to keep up with work e-mails.   Bed, pillows, and bed linens were nice and comfortable.  Bathroom towels had torn edges and should have been taken out of service.  Water pressure was good on the 8th floor, but hot water was hit or miss.  It just depended on the time of day. My clock radio was set 1 hour ahead, and I could not figure out how to reset it.  Left a note for housekeeping to reset it, but it was not done after the first day.  It was done after leaving another note.  Co-worker had similar issue, but his clock was off by 4 hours.  Seems minor, but we were already 17 hours from our home time zone, so an incorrect clock can make a big difference. CES brought an extra 140,000+ people to Las Vegas, but that fact was not obvious from the Riveria.  Only once did I see a line at the taxi stand.  No crowds in the casino, in the shops, at the food court, etc.  As a side note, AdultCon 2012 (a porn convention) started in the hotel’s convention center the night before we checked out.  Even that event did not seem to increase the number of people in the hotel.   If you do not care about TV channels, WiFi connection, hot water, or an empty hotel, this is the place to stay as long as the price is right.  Save your money to eat, drink, gamble, and have fun.  At the same time, I would not recommend to family, friends, or co-workers. My co-workers also commented on the lack of TV channels, non-existent WiFi, lack of hot water, and the emptiness of the hotel.  The overall experience of co-workers will make this our company’s last visit to the Riveria.  I was / am actually embarrassed to tell people that I stayed there in 2012.

Reviews.Title: “worst hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: Brian H
Reviews.Content: The package included a free wifi for duration of the stay which I chose this hotel for. It never worked not even for few minutes during my 4 days of stay at this hotel. to make the matter worst, I was never able to get hold of the front-desk. Anytime I called them, I was put on hold by an automated voice system saying that their agents are busy and I should hold. After 5 to 10 minutes of holding and not getting any response I would hung up. I tried them during 4 different time of the day and nights with the exact same results. The worst part was the front desk agent that was very rude and argumentative, when I brought to her attention of my dissatisfaction of their lack of customer service.I would not recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Not for me, thank you”
Reviews.Author: John_Car_1957
Reviews.Content: I arrived in Riviera on Friday, January 13th, 2012. I have been going to Las Vegas for business for the last three or four years, and I have also visited before, so I know my way around the place a bit. For the last few years, I've been staying at another hotel, right across the street from the Riviera and was pretty satisfied with it, if it wasn't for the long lines to check in and out (about 10-15 people waiting). This year though, I decided to switch to Riviera, due to its better price. Big mistake. Problems started as soon as I arrived, on a Friday evening about 7pm. The line for checking in was simply incredible! Nothing I've seen before compared to this. I waited for more than an hour before I was in front of a reception employee, who appeared to be overworked and less than eager to help. Let's just say that it took some frustrating moments to find my reservation, since she couldn't understand that in Greek a person's name can be totally different than in English, even though my passport shows both the latin equivalent of my Greek name and my American name. After taking some moment to solve the name issue, and after the employee apologized, I was given a room, which however was not for smokers (as I had requested). I was promised a switch to a smokers room the other day. This is not the "welcome" I expect after being in planes and airports for more than 24 hours. The room given to me the first night, was in the Monaco tower and was OK, comparable to other rooms I've stayed in Vegas. However, the free WiFi connection promised in the reservation web site, was a joke. It never worked OK with Skype, I guess that the hotel is somehow blocking Skype in their system, because it never worked properly while I was there. Then, it kept throwing me out of the network, if I was not overly active. If I had my computer check for my emails on a 5-minutes schedule, I never got any emails. I had to switch to a once-a-minute checking, to maintain an active connection. Then, it won't allowed me to have both my computer and my phone connected on the network. I eventually managed to overcome that issue, but in general if you want a good WiFi connection, look elsewhere, the one Riviera is using is a joke. And of course, there was no in-house support, which is provided via an outside company, whose technicians don't even answer the 800- number I was given for them. An automatic system takes your call, and if you are lucky, someone will call you within the hour. Huh? Being a member of the press, I need 24/7 reliable Internet, I can't wait for an hour before problems are solved, if they are resolved at all. As I said, if you need reliable Internet connection, look elsewhere. So next morning, I was expecting to hear from someone, to arrange my switching to a smokers room. Well, that didn't happen, I had to personally go to the front desk and ask (or rather demand) the switch. A very reluctant employee had me come and go at least three times, since they had to move people out (those leaving) and have maintenance clean the rooms before they could move me to a new one. In the mean time, newly-arrived guests were moved into their rooms just fine. Overall, the hotel personnel lacks the attitude that you would expect to find in such a hotel. The hotel I used the previous years is much better in that respect and it has a reliable, unrestricted Internet access. More details: 1. Rooms: the rooms are adequate. "Tired" but they provide what you would expect from such an old hotel, in that price range. They are usually spacious, even if you were to add a third bed it won't be a problem. 2. Restaurants: I tried the Food Court and the R-Buffet. They are (again) nothing to write home about, at the same level as similar restaurants in other hotels in Vegas. Keep in mind, that you'd better get there early, if you are used to late dinning like us Europeans, you may find that some of the buffet entries are getting "old", I was served a very dry beef slice by the "Chef" in R-Buffet, when I visited that restaurant at about 8 pm. 3. Bars: I haven't tried them, so I can't tell, but from what I saw the Queen's Victoria bar looked attractive. 4. Personnel: Usually unfriendly and non-professional. I have to mention though, that I was surprised by one high-rank executive I've met in the elevator. I knew she was a hotel employee, but I didn't knew her position at that time. We briefly chatted in the elevator and she insisted to walk with me to the hotel Business Center, to pick up a package which was waiting for me there, because it was almost 5 pm (closing time for the Business Center) and she wanted to make sure that I would get my package, even if they had just closed. This lady was an example of how the hotel staff should be. Thank you! The only other employees which were friendly and helpful were the Vallets at the rear entry of the hotel. Great friendly guys. 5. Other considerations: The hotel location is a bit far from the center of the Strip, so be prepared to do some walking if that's what interests you. It's not a huge hotel, like some of the others on the Strip, so you do not need to walk much to reach its various areas, but that also means that your choices inside the hotel, are limited. For those interested in the casino details, there seemed to be a variety of tables you could play all the usual games, as well as a lot of "slot machines", so if that's what interests you, you probably won't be disappointed. I am not into gambling so take this with a bit of salt. Room service is kind of strange. In one of the rooms I stayed, there was a sticker which advised you that the sheets wouldn't be changed unless you ask for it! If you do not, they just make the bed with the existing sheets and call it a day. Come again?!? Also, floor managers have the tendency to enter the rooms without waiting for permission. One of them caught me undressed, as she opened the door immediately after knocking! Would I stay in Riviera again? No. I need a few basic things from my hotel, during my business trips. A prompt service during check-in (lacking in Riviera, the waiting line for check-in is usually 30-50 people long), a decent, clean room (OK in that respect) and a reliable, unlimited, unrestricted Internet connection. The Riviera scores low in two of my three requirements.

Reviews.Title: “Old & Outdated, not a good place to experience Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Japan_Expat_07
Reviews.Content: If you are coming to Vegas for a convention and you are on a tight budget and only need a bed art night, then this place is ok. However, if you want to see Vegas, have a nice meal (either at the hotel or close by) then this is not where you should stay. The casino is ancient, run down, and mainly resembles a maze. They have a food court with various food type options, but it's self service and the food is below average. If you must eat there, they the Indian place on the left hand side, it's probably the best. Te rooms are small and outdated, but they are clean. They have minimal amenities, but again, it's sufficient. My room did have a fridge and not a minibar, so I was able to stock it with drinks from the ABC Store downstairs. The hotel WiFi is a joke, and didn't work most of the time. Be forewarned that getting a taxi from here is difficult as most taxi's don't want to come down this far on the strip. Give yourself plenty of time.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad at all”
Reviews.Author: djoleman
Reviews.Content: Luxury rooms are good, staff are friendly, no free wifi tho, which is ridiculous

Reviews.Title: “Meeted the needs of what we wanted.”
Reviews.Author: HopeToSeeTheWorld
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights in October with my boyfriend and his family (5 adults in Total). The hotel seemed very quiet, Casino not busy nor restaurants and bars in there, so not sure if this is ususal. Check in took quite a while becasue of a que even though we arrived very late in the evening, but was not a problem, i have been to vegas before and checking in has always taken a bit of time becasue of amount of people,Unfortunately at check in we were told we could not have our rooms as booked, we had booked a room with an extra bed for 3 adults and a double room. The check in staff said that in Vegas there is a law saying three adults can not share a room (honestly have you heard that before!) They refused to sort this and said the only way we could stay there was to book an extra room, which we did in the end due to the time it was taking. Luckily when we got to the room there was a hotel brochure saying that extra beds are available so the next day we complained to a manager who rectified the situation and refunded the money paid and that was handled extremly well. Whilst in Vegas the weather was cold, cloudy and rainy which was a shame and unlike what you would expect, but we still had a good time, the only thing it affected was our Grand Canyon trip and the staff member that dealt with tours at the hotel (he was located in the entrance near the bus and taxi drop off to the side of hotel) was amazing and was trying everything he could to make sure we could go to the canyon. He was just fantastic. The rooms were okay, a bit tired and worn but had all we needed.There are areas of the hotel taht they are definately improving over time as we saw some rooms taht looked nicer in a different block. The hotel itself was good, lots of facilities, nice swimming pool, restaurants were quiet whilst we were there but food and drinks all good and cheap. The free drinks in casino were a bonus and just a good tip initially, kept them coming all night. We found the walk to the strip okay but it is a distance if you want to go all the way but depends if you like a walk. Absolutely love vegas and would happily stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel I've been to in the whole US”
Reviews.Author: Dcodish
Reviews.Content: I must say that this is the worst Hotel experience I've had in the entire US. I'm extremely disappointed and plan to recommend that this hotel is removed from the recommended hotels for CES. I'm writing this review since I could not get any of the staff members to address my issues and it really seems that no one cares. This is wrong behaviour. 1. Upon arrival to the hotel, I was greeted by the receptionist with comments about how can it be that I arrived so early (11am) and that I should go somewhere and return at 4pm. At first I thought she was joking but she wasn't. After paying $20 extra I was given a room. This is the first time I hear that even though rooms are available, I cannot get one after a 28 hours flight. 2. In the past 3 days, I have not had usable Intenet access in my room (which as Press, I must have). Apperantly, this is a known hotel issue but every time I complained about it, it was treated as if it was a surprise to the staff and perhaps only my problem. In fact, some staff confessed to me that this is a known issue that is being addressed by an external company and they have no idea when it will be resolved. 3. Talking with reception about the issue, I was yelled at (yes) saying that there is nothing they can do about it and that's it. 4. I've called front desk 3 times in the past days. On all events, I was put on hold for up to 5 minutes, after which no one appologized for the delay. When I asked about the Internet issue, I was given a 1-800 number to call for tech support although the Hotel knew this was known issue and that tech support cannot help me personally. I've just waisted more time on this. DO NOT, get anywhere close to this hotel. There are so many others in Vegas, it just doesnt make sense to insist on this one.

Reviews.Title: “An Honest review of the 'Riv'”
Reviews.Author: ports11
Reviews.Content: Ok, we checked in about 20:00 on New Years Eve, straight to the desk with no queues so that was a great start! A guy called James checked us in and he was a lovely fella, very freindly polite and professional and as an unexpected bonus we were upgraded to the Monaco Tower!! We paid the $7 per day resort fee and this included wifi and the safe, I know some people have commented on this so I guess the Hotel have listened and now include these in the price. We also got free local calls as well. We battled through the crowds to our room and the room was fine, it was clean smelled fresh, had a big telly and a bed you could sleep forever in! The only criticism was the maid service was very poor. We never had our sheets changed in 7 nights and the room got very very dusty and not cleaned all week, that was a shame but still I,thought the rooms were great value. The Hotel is quite small in comparison to the top end of the strip but I preferred this, it was easy to find your way around and you didnt have to walk miles to get to your room so we were happy with that. I dont think us Brits are used to hotels the size of Caesars or MGM etc, they were beautiful hotels but you would walk miles everyday in there!! I'm not really used to casino's but the Riviera's was fairly small but loads of slots from pennies upwards and plenty of game tables too. It was smokey in there but its a casino right? I quite like being able to have a drink and smoke inside as we're not allowed in the UK anymore so it was fine for me. The waitresses were regular with the free drinks and if you tip a $10 straight up then they're back very regularly, as we mainly played the penny slots this made the drinking very very cheap!! We had a few beers in The Queen Victoria Pub in the hotel and the service and beer were great, maybe a bit more expensive than some bars but you always pay more in a hotel bar so not really unsurprising or overly expensive to be fair. They always had Football (soccer to our colonial friends!!) or sports news and plenty of live music at nights too. There was a great atmosphere in there. We always found the staff to be polite and helpful and most of them smiled and greeted you as you passed, I know some guests have made comments about this but I reckon the Hotel have taken this on board and done some extra training. We didnt eat at the restaurants other than breakfast buffet on our last day. I wish we'd had the breakfast earlier!! For $10 it was great value, loads of choice and the service was excellent. The waiters were regularly topping up coffees and soft drinks or juice, we really enjoyed it. If we had gone there on our first day then I'm sure we would have gone back everyday. We got a cab from the airport and the strip was closed (due to New Years Eve) so the taxi driver went on a scenic route and robbed us, $40 to the hotel. We learned that the Hotel was in the opposite direction and you dont have to go near the strip to get there. The fair should have been $15 maybe $20 max. Please be careful of this, a better way is maybe get a shuttle bus. There are plenty of them right outside and its $7 dollars each, Bell trans gave us a great service ( we flew to San Francisco for a day during the week!) and only a 10 minute ride so I would recommend them. Overall, we really enjoyed our stay at The Riviera. It was comfortable, friendly, clean, reasonably priced and not too far to walk for shopping and the ''main'' hotels up the strip. If walking is a problem then get a Deuce bus, $7 for 24hrs and stops right outside. They run every few minutes and well worth riding. Thanks to all the staff at The Riviera, it was our first trip to Vegas and we really enjoyed it. Would I go back to The Riviera? yes definately and I would recommend it to friends and family too. Great Hotel and great price, remember how much your paying. Pound for pound its excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap, but you get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: KenSV
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay at the Riv. I picked it for its price. I asked for the "new" Monaco tower, because of the comments I read on this site. The rooms (we had two) were reasonably clean and large, and the mattress was not too soft. But the paint was peeling in many places in the room. The cabinet door was only attached by one hinge. And there is no coffee maker in the room. I called housekeeping but they don't have any either. Like others said its location is too far from the other attractions. I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: topbox
Reviews.Content: We got a deal from our travel agent and because of that we stayed in the Riviera.I would not have booked this hotel out of choice,but we were pleased when we arrived.The hotel is very tired but our room was spacious and very clean.When we arrived we were updated to the new part.The hotel was very quiet and we had a very comfortable stay.The staff were nice I would stay there again if I had a deal.I thought the food court was poor and there was no way I wanted to eat in their restaurants they all looked cheap.We tried the coffee shop but it was awful,so we went across the street to McDonalds had our coffee there and caught the deuce to the rest of the strip.

Reviews.Title: “no complaints, nothing great”
Reviews.Author: justmecin
Reviews.Content: I have been to vegas 7 times, and I stay at a different hotel everytime. I do this to change it up and to try new places and things. I wouldn't recommend this hotel, but if your on a budget and can get a good deal then I would suggest it, but not encourage it. The staff is mediocre in how friendly they are and the rooms are barely adequate. The hotel is located at 1 end of the strip and a bit secluded, which may appeal to you, but its vegas, so I'm thinking.....not so great! lol The buffet is good, but if you missed it, then no reason to cry about anything.....if anyone could make it there for new years, hit the strip, its an experience I'll never forget.

Reviews.Title: “ALWAYS treated like a king!”
Reviews.Author: lee_dorn
Reviews.Content: Ive been using "The Riv" for years and the GREAT service is always the same, they have spent some MAJOR money in the last 3 or 4 years, remodeling the rooms and the pool. Yes it is one of the older hotels in Vegas but that dosent stop the "Grand ole lady on the strip" from being the BEST IN VEGAS

Reviews.Title: “The Riv ya gotta love it”
Reviews.Author: whouwhoami
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at the Riv for many years and have never been disapointed. This past December we had 2 seperated stays. The first three nights in the Monte Carlo tower and then 5 nights in the Monaco Tower. Both rooms had been recently renovated and were nicely done. The bathroom was still a a bit dated but the shower had great water pressure and was clean. Both rooms Recently renovated and upgraded with modern amenities, 32” flat screen television, AM/FM alarm clock radio, refrigerator, complimentary in-room safe, “Euro” pillow top mattresses, iron and ironing board, hair dryer. The Casino portion of the Hotel is very "Old Vegas" which I happen to like. More quiet and less crowed then the new mega resorts. Of course if you do need more action the Encore and the Wynn are just within walking distance. Also within walking distance the Fashion Show Mall with food court, Walgreens, Ross (discount store/ great buys and prices) and Resturants such as Denny's and Fireside Inn. Check out the Peppermill Restaurant and Fireside lounge just next to the Riv. The portions are huge (we usually share) and delicious. The Fireside lounge is a bit funky with the firepit but if you are lucky you may run into a celeb or 2 early/late at night. The restaurant and lounge is a bit of an icon in LV. The Riv also has a food court, buffet, English pub, asian food and The R steakhouse. As far as buffets go it is just "ok". If you go to a buffet and are under the assumption that you will like everything then I guess it is better to skip buffet food. The breakfast is great and most items on the dinner menu were good. The R steakhouse was exceptional and not that pricey commpared to some Steakhouses. Deffinately worth checking out. Besides like the Rivera for the above mentioned I also like it for the easy in and out if you rent or come by car. The self parking or Valet parking (which I usually do) is easy and fast. You can leave your car or get it delivered quickly compared to long hours in a line at other properties. The check in is also just inside the door from the parking / drop off area. You don't have to walk thru the entire casino to check in. Another Riv plus!!! You also have easy access to Paradise road that will get you away from the busy strip. For the price you can not beat the Riviera!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “WOW!! Deceived from the phone call on the reservation”
Reviews.Author: Kyle M
Reviews.Content: Called for a 4 night reservation from 12/31/2011 through 01/03/2012; reservation specialist indicated I could get a better rate by booking on the hotel web-site. Asked if the photo of the one bedroom suite was the actual room availabl and the answer was YES!!! Booked the suite and headed for Vegas. Lines were long at check-in, but it was not the hotel's fault, just an abundance of people there for New Year's. Got checked into a nightmare, and the suite on their site was not they provided us, and was not even close to the same. Of course, NO one was able to help the situation; NO other suites; NO refund of the room; NO comp for the deception; just shut up and enjoy your stay. During the first 24 hours, we gambled approximately $5,000 on table games, and one of the pit supervisor's indicated we should talk to Casino VIP services about getting the bad room comped, or maybe even moved. Took the time to go to VIP services and the informed us that for a Comped Suite, we would need to bet $50 per hand for minimum of 4 hours each day; if we wanted any comped food, in addition to the comped room, we would need to bet $80 per hand for a minimum of 4 hours each day. If you play slots, comps racked up at a whopping $1 for 300 hundred points ($300 in wagering); with a minimum accumulation of $20 in your account before anything could be done. NO offer to rectify our situation!!! Male Pit Supervisors could not care about anything unless you were wagering over $100 per hand. There were a few players, at the blackjack tables, wagering well over $100 per hand, and the Male Pit Supervisors were bringing VIP Hosts to the pits to provide anything they wanted!!! Bottom Line: False Advertising on their web site; deception when dealing with reservations personel; and total disregard for resolving any problems unless you are willing to gamble $100 per hand, then the world is your oyster. Old hotel in need of updating; food is some of the worst on the strip, don't waste your money. If you like Old Style Vegas, are not a mini-high roller and don't mind getting deceived then this is the place for you!!! Even basic rooms at Ceasar's International; MGM Resorts International; Boyd Gaming are MUCH BETTER, and those companies take care of ALL the visitors (gamblers or not). Have read comments on Trip Advisor where manager of the Riviera indicated they would have loved to had the opportunity to address the issue when it occurred; however, they had the opportunity and did not care of us, because we only were betting $10 and $25 per hand, and sat at the tables for over 7 hours providing them the opportunity to take $5,000 of our money. STAY AWAY!!! Beware!! If you want a better stay, with better food, better rooms, better overall experience contact Ceasar's Internation, MGM Resort's International or Boyd Gaming. Travel out there for relaxtion at least 7 times per year; biggest mistake was Riviera. See photos uploaded of the One Bedroom Suite on their web-site that Reservations indicated was the only ones available, and the photos of the wonderful one bedroom suite they gave us. I totally HATE being Lied To, and that is what the Riviera does best.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible hotel - Old, cranky staff”
Reviews.Author: Allen T
Reviews.Content: There is really nothing positive I can say about this hotel. Had a business meeting booked last min and had to tolarate this awful hotel for 2 days. Few in at 11 PM exhusted. Went to hotel. Explicitly asked for non smoking during booking. They gave me a smoking room. Hardly slept before meeting. Beds were terrible with cig burns throughout the sheets. Loud area of hotel. One of the worst 3 hotels I have ever been in. Next day they gave me a non smoking room at noon. The only improvment was the simple fact that the sheets did not have holes in them. Avoid this place at all cost. But you get what you pay for....

Reviews.Title: “the only scary part is the lobby...”
Reviews.Author: WNNX
Reviews.Content: Honest! The worst part about the hotel is the lobby; once you get to your room everything will be OK. I was hesitant about booking here since I had read all the negative attention it had received on these pages. However, I followed what other people on tripadvisor.com said and everything fell into place. I asked for a room in the Monaco tower, high up, away from the noise. The room was very decent - nice bed, good-sized room and decent shower. The drain in the shower didn't flow very rapidly but that is my lone negative observation. The casino is tired - but outside of the premium properties (Bellagio, Wynn, etc.), almost all of the casinos seem tired. The staff are attentive. There is a food court associated with this hotel and they have a lot to offer. Mind you, they are not cheap but they are cheaper than a lot of other options. There is a McDonalds across the street along with Circus Circus eating options (circus type of fast food). Stay at the Riviera - you won't regret it and you'll save a ton o' cash.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Alburtis26
Reviews.Content: Went for a quick vacation between the holidays. Have been going to Vegas since 1989 and am well aware of the area that the Riv is in. We stayed in the original tower (Med. North) which is located directly over the casino. The room was clean and comfortable, Kingsize bed, standard room on the 8th floor. Flat screen TV, desk, dresser and table and fridge in room. Small area outside of bath for wife to do make up. Aside from the TV, all furniture may well have been 10 years or older, but it all was clean and was more than capable of doing what it was intended to do. The lights worked, the shower had good pressure, no issues with any fixture. Check in was quick and easy, but I did notice lines later in the week - but not nearly as long as lines we saw at other hotels reg. desks during the same part of the week. They had moved the reg. desk to the convention area and the self kiosks were not being used. We ate at the buffet 3x and found it more than we expected. Don't let someone elses tastes rule where you go. While the omelet bar may only have 6/7 options, it was well made, tasteful and quick. We went to Planet Hollywood's Spice Market Buffet and were very dissapointed (except for the crepes). If you want a quick meal with some variety that is within reason price wise, the Riv's is fine. The casino has a wide variety of games and table minimums. Dealers were very friendly. A great asset to the Riviera, which I never see metioned, is the ease of driving to and from the hotel. With access to Paridise Rd. for driving to places south, and able to get to downtown with 10 mins, and west (Red Rock Canyon) by using Sahara, the Riviera is ideal for those who rent a car. The only neg. I can think of is that the parking garage is a little small and during busy times it is hard to find a space. Yes, the Riviera is cheaper than the newer strip hotels and you know that at those prices no one is going to tuck you in at night. But for those who have been to Vegas a number of times and want a room stricly for sleeping, grabbing quick meals and being able to gamble at levels you are comfortable with, It is perfect.

Reviews.Title: “It used to be better”
Reviews.Author: kesibmik
Reviews.Content: The hotel has really gone downhill the last 10 years. The hotel is definitely showing its age. The rooms and hallways look very worn down and haven't been updated in what seems like 20 years or more. A lot of the doors were missing room numbers! The room was large and bed was comfy but the room could have been cleaner. The pool area looks like it could be nice in the summer. The location isn't really the best. There are closed down properties (Sahara) just down the street, abandoned developments surrounding it and the disastrous Circus, Circus across the street. It is a very far walk to the heart of the strip were the real action is. It also is a very far and sketchy walk to Fremont Experience. They really need to do something to make the property stand out more. Right now its just another eye sore on the north end of The Strip.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location on the Strip and Great Price!!!”
Reviews.Author: boat33
Reviews.Content: I only stayed for 2 nights, But considering that this one oldest Casino property and Hotels on the strip. it has great make over. The rooms are modern and nice.and best of all cost of the rooms are resonable..

Reviews.Title: “BED BUGS AT THE RIVIERA”
Reviews.Author: Robin Y
Reviews.Content: I just arrived back in California. I stayed at the Riviera, room 5039, from December 26-28, 2011. I woke up itching with bites on my arm the day I checked out and did not really think much of it. As I drove home with my husband, the itching began all over. My arms, shoulders, face and legs had bites and red splotchy marks. I am furious. I made a report with the Security Department. I was told they should get back to me maybe by Tuesday, January 3, 2012 because of the holidays. My husband and I attended a time share presentation set up by CASABLANCA EXPRESS to see the Jockey Club. DONT'T DO IT!

Reviews.Title: “Budget hotel, Needs improvement”
Reviews.Author: Avi3639
Reviews.Content: This is my review for my visit to Riviera in September 2011, I had visited Riviera in the year 2005 and was overall happy with my stay, but I was not as happy this time, The rooms, the corridor,the toilets were not up-to the mark, and they badly need renovation

Reviews.Title: “Time for a major revamp!”
Reviews.Author: cuspub
Reviews.Content: The good: Cheap. The bad: Everything else. Look, the fact that the place is cheap and comes with all of the basics of your typical casino goes a long way for many. For me, well, it's a very different story. The accommodation was booked for me by a company I was visiting while attending the SEMA event at the convention centre. So I can't complain, except that we decided to stay an additional 3 nights with the booking made weeks in advance. I didn't know how bad it would be otherwise I would have booked into the Bellagio or the like. The bottom line is that the Riviera is old and needs a thorough revamp. Truly, a complete refurbish is necessary, as is a change of staff ( I found most to be uninterested and poorly presented), and for the whole place to be moved a kilometres along the strip to the better part. Sorry, but the rooms were musty, contained old furnishings, were noisy (I could hear the lifts going up and down all night thanks to poor sound proofing) and lacked some of the obvious inclusions you would expect at The Venetian, Caesars Palace etc. Location is a little off-putting as you really need to walk at least half a mile before arriving at the cleaner, well presented prestige casinos.

Reviews.Title: “lots of luck”
Reviews.Author: needabeach69
Reviews.Content: We won a 2- 4- 1 vacation for a Halloween costume contest and this is the hotel we received. So its not conveniently located, but we would leave every morning and just start walking. When we got tired we would jump on the bus to get back home... or downtown... (only $7 dollars a day) best deal if you are just sight seeing . Our first room was wwwwaaayyyy small, many things were not working so we were moved by the next day. Different tower, better room. The beds were very comfortable, and for the price... a great time we had. oh yeah.. take the shuttle from the airport, vs. a taxi, much cheaper. Have Fun and Good Luck !!

Reviews.Title: “Great price”
Reviews.Author: Bmnme
Reviews.Content: We were given a great price and a good room. Service was prompt and pleasant. The worst part of our stay was the coffee kiosks. Don't buy coffee from the booths over priced and disgusting. We had a rental car and there was plenty of parking. We plan on returning.

Reviews.Title: “nice place to stay, good value”
Reviews.Author: cludasdulac
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 weeks in Nov 2011, we were given a large room clean room. Check in was within 10 minutes. The hotel is at the end of the strip but still within walking distance to the shopping centre's and the main attractions. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “convienient for the price”
Reviews.Author: JJ J
Reviews.Content: My lady and I are in our mid 20's and early 30's and we had a blast. People say their are long check-ins, but we were in and with an upgrade to Monico tower in a matter of moments. We checked in about 11 pm on a Monday with no hassels. The food is so so on the cite but food is everywhere in vegas. The tram is a ten min walk and takes you all the way to MGM in moments. Nice people, descent tables, and overall happy with our stay, oh and house keeping was on it every day. Thanks Riviera for making my ladies first vegas trip a good one.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money, rooms ok.”
Reviews.Author: bexdaisy
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel as it was good value for money and on the strip. The breakfast buffet was good value for money with a v good choice. The hotel is in need of renovation work around the lobby area. Upon arrival we had to wait some time to check in. The staff were v friendly and helpful. Due to the resort fee charge on arrival I don't think it turned out excellent value as a lot of the main hotels don't charge this fee. The rooms were cleaned every day with fresh towels. Would probably stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Riviera at Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: RaquelJ505
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in the heart of Las Vegas and has a lot of entertainment choices that are very affordable and very entertaining.

Reviews.Title: “Food old and stale”
Reviews.Author: lucylou1961
Reviews.Content: On a recent trip, my husband and I ate at the buffet at the Riviera Hotel and Casino. There wasn't a good variety of food and the food that was present was old and looked stale!!! It was barely edible!!! Not worth the $$$.

Reviews.Title: “Rip off”
Reviews.Author: Charlotte R
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel instead of a hostel as I had read bad reviews about hostels in Vegas. when I got there I found a dirty room with bits of tissue all over the floor!?! without apology I was given another room which was smaller, and though clean the bath was still dirty. This was not the cheapest hotel I found on the stip but thought I would pay to feel safe and comfortable, but it didnt have the ameneties I always find in basic travel lodges/ holiday inns, etc- no drinks facilities in the room, no hair conditioner, I couldn't believe breakfast wasn't included, and as it is far from the centre of the strip you don't even pay for location! the water in the cold tap was hot too- not pleasent when brushing your teeth! all of these things may seem little but for the price I paid I'd expect a much higher standard of customer service. I think this hotel has had its day and people should choose from all the other hotels on the strip- I wish I had stayed at the Luxor as it is much cheaper and I have heard only posotove things about it!

Reviews.Title: “Trip to Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: alokehalwai
Reviews.Content: Good budget hotel on the strip, nicely located with just opposite to mcdonalds and Circus Circus. One of the good casinos of the city. Over all a good decent place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: eastdowne
Reviews.Content: Even though the Riviera is one of the older hotels on the Las Vegas strip and down the road a bit from the newer venues I found great value. It wasn't just the lower room prices I enjoyed, it was the wonderful service from the staff. They seemed to enjoy their jobs and beha Ed as if they where happy to see us. The room we had was comfortable and clean and well maintained. I have stayed at a number of hotels on the strip in the past and I'm sure my choice will be the Riviera on my next visit to Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “They sell a room they do not have”
Reviews.Author: sjhan12652
Reviews.Content: I made a reservation for my son and his friend through Vegas.com for 2 nights. I made it very clear on Vegas.com website that my son needed a room with two beds. But when he and his buddy arrived at the hotel, they were told that only a room with one king size bed was available and offered a rollaway bed. I call it a bait and switch and dishonest business practice. Should I blame the hotel or Vegas.com or both?

Reviews.Title: “3rd times a charm!”
Reviews.Author: MajNelson
Reviews.Content: I just stayed at the Riviera for 3 days in Sept '11 while attending a trade show. I was on the 15th floor of the Monte Carlo tower overlooking the pool. I was very happy with my stay. The room was big and clean, I don't think it was one of the newer updated rooms but it was nice enough. The nicest thing was that it was quiet. I was able to get a decent nights sleep which is nice when you have to get up early for a trade show. You could hear the music from the pool area but that did not start until 9 or so. I have stayed at the Riviera at least 2 other times and this was by far my nicest stay as far as room and quiet was concerned. Much quieter than Harrah's. Room was close to hotel elevators that came out right near casino floor and coffee shop. The only drawback to the Riv is that it is a bit of a walk to where the Strip action is.

Reviews.Title: “Riviera still disappointing.”
Reviews.Author: hollyg2
Reviews.Content: Attending the same conference I attended last year, and extended my trip to get direct flights, so spent a week at Riviera. I paid for the upgrade this time, and ended up requesting they just put me back in the north tower - the extra money paid for a refrigerator, nothing more. For me, not worth it, plus I like to do yoga in my room, so the bigger older rooms were better for me. The Monaco tower rooms were smaller and much darker than the other room. They told me the bathroom had been redone, but they've put in a new counter - the tub was old, small and dirty. I requested a room with new linens - white and comfortable - but the rest of the room is the same. Old, tired. There is an 8 dollar a night resort fee here - which I have to say I'm appalled by - it doesn't pay for anything - you get free access to the gym - but most of the cardio equipment at the gym is broken, and the equipment is all 30 years old. Wireless costs an extra 10 bucks PER DEVICE PER NIGHT. I honestly would not have a problem with the Riviera if the rest of the hotel wasn't charging such outlandish strip prices for everything. I buy NOTHING at the Riviera while I'm here, not a meal, barely a coffee - because the place is old and grungy and awful - if they were charging accordingly I'd be more inclined to hit the buffet or the cafe. If you're going to be a budget hotel, be a budget hotel. I was with a HUGE group - over 1000 of us here - and everyone left the hotel to eat and get coffee and do everything - a crappy coffee and a muffin you could buy at a gas station cost 9 dollars here. It's Vegas, it's expensive, I know - but come on, Riviera! So I guess the Riviera is a budget hotel that will nickel and dime you to death if you let it, and it's about a 20 minute walk to the "real" Las Vegas Strip. You're better off to pay a little more at a better resort and be in the middle of the action. Again, if I didn't have a conference here, I wouldn't stay here at all. No coffee makers in the rooms, so if you drink tea or coffee bring a portable or a kettle - they won't give you a cup of hot water anywhere. the room description says they have ipod docks, but they don't. The walls are paper thin, so if you're stuck next to a party room, you're in for a long night. They don't answer the phone when you dial zero, there's usually only one or two people at the desk, and they're checking in guests, not picking up the phone.

Reviews.Title: “Riviera Casino, Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Ian g
Reviews.Content: Flew out from manchester with Delta airlines transfer time at Atlanta to do passport control about 1 and a half hours was very tight 5 mins to spare. No problems with picking up my car from Dollar at Las vegas airport, next time I will get car at hotel and return itand use shuttle bus at airport. Check in was smooth no problems, finding it took time then finding your way to your room even with the map they give you, we had a smoking room and we had a free upgrade to a bedroom dressing area and bathroom, it was all a little tired but clean the beds where very good and we had no trouble sleeping. our room was cleaned everyday and there where plenty of clean towels.The problems that have been written about this hotel is lack of staff, there are new owners and they are underway sorting it out. at peak times I did see people waiting to check in. I found all of the staff very polite. This hotel is old Vegas and you get what you pay for to me it was a bed on the strip, clean and one could eat all sorts in the eating hall. I also had a very good steak in there steakhouse, I only found it on my last night as nobody really tells you about it. would I stay there again yes I would the new owners are slowly changing it, its cheap and cheerful in parts and the glory days have gone. staff shortages seem to be the problem also use the room tv to check out, and the machines near check in to check in. The hotel overall is in need of a upgrade. but if its a bed you want at a good price this is the place

Reviews.Title: “Convenient for North of Stip”
Reviews.Author: EdandAnn29
Reviews.Content: We stayed in October for 5 day so we could go to the Drag Racing it was well situated as we did not have to go through the large amount of traffic near Plant Hollywood to get to the north of the strip for the racing. Room was nice and cleaned well view not that good as were on 2nd floor of the North Tower could see sat dishes and pipe work. Staff helpful. Would stay again so long and

Reviews.Title: “ru kidding me ?”
Reviews.Author: Christine R
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Riv several times , and hadn't been there since 03,it certainly has gone downhill. Filthy rooms , torn furniture, bed lines with hair and other debris , ceiling sprayed with God knows what, horrible . They upgraded to a petite suite , only difference was a bigger filthy room , showers not clean, more torn furniture, a true disgrace. Food at the restaurants was poor at best, and it took several talks with management to get anywhere. Stained wall paper , one down comforter had a huge urine stain in the middle of it on the side facing down on the bed, and I have pictures to back up all of this. I'd close down if you can't do any better than this. Was also told they would give a partial refund , that was in SEPT , still waiting in NOV , haven't seen a penny.... CHEAP rooms , bah don't waste your money here. I'd give a negative rating but 1 is as low as I can go.

Reviews.Title: “So-so”
Reviews.Author: kbcware
Reviews.Content: Pros: * Good location, the hotel is near the Deuce bus terminal * Affordable price * The rooms are reasonably clean Cons: * No free internet in the room. You have to pay about $11. * The rooms are a bit old * The good rooms are in the far side from the entrance -- The Monaco tower has good rooms, but about 5 minutes walk from the entrance of the hotel * VERY SLOW check-in/check-out process. You need at least 15 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Another Vegas hotel tha just keeps getting worse”
Reviews.Author: Sasso74
Reviews.Content: I stayed there twice. Once in Sept 2010 and again back in 2006 I liked the poker room so went back to visit the Riviera over my last trip in September 2011 (stayed at the ARIA) This place just keeps getting worse and worse. Seems the management there have given up even trying. Staff look bored and uninterested. The buffet, which was decent a few years ago, is totally crap. The location is horrible. It's about a 30min walk to the main strip. The Riviera should be imploded

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay here”
Reviews.Author: SusieRoseCardiff
Reviews.Content: There are a lot of negative reviews about the Riviera but my boyfriend and I have no complaints. We must have been in the new tower as the decor was very tasteful and we had the biggest bed ever. We ate at the breakfast buffet which was great and the service was good also. The bathroom was clean and spacious. When we checked in and out we did not experience any long waits in the queue's. Its right at the bottom end of the strip nearer down town but that did not put us off. We like to walk down the strip and experience everything. There are plenty of restaurants and shops here if you want to grab a quick bite, we did not choose any of these for an evening out though.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay with my dad”
Reviews.Author: elvis4life
Reviews.Content: Had a very nice pleasant 2 day stay with me & my dad. The room was great as well as the staff & food there. I recommend it to anyone visiting Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “clean rooms friendly staff not the fanciest but good value”
Reviews.Author: Midcanada
Reviews.Content: We stayed for five nights got early check in no problem the rooms were fine in the monaco tower we walked from the riv to mandalay bay and always felt safe over agressive time share guy outside of the riv was very rude he was located in the gravel parking lot food at the buffet was fine

Reviews.Title: “Decent spot - good price”
Reviews.Author: Extorsys
Reviews.Content: OK, normally i do not understand why people are so critic with hotel reviews; it is my view that if you go on vacation is to go sight see, not stay in your room 24/7. That said; i found the hotel to be decent. The check-in process was smooth, the room was clean, with flat tv, free wifi, iron, iron-board, closet, drawers, alarm clock. No refrigerator, and not microwave. the hotel was in an OK place (it is on the strip). we had to walk about 20 mins to in the middle of the strip. the staff was nice, but not over the top (which i like). checkout was simple as well.

Reviews.Title: “Bugsy Segal was under my bed”
Reviews.Author: lawchicago2850
Reviews.Content: The room was so dirty and out of date I thnk Bugsy Segal was buried under the bed. What a dump the windows overlooking the parking lot were so filthly it actually improved the view The hallways from the elevators were so long I thought I was on the "Death march from Battan after the first night in the morrning we had some famliy link up with us and we were talking in our room . We heard banging on the wall from the next room from some woman who said shut the F... Up I have a hangover and I dont what to hear about your flight! It has to be one the most overtated hotels in the world . Book a relative here if you dont like them !

Reviews.Title: “You can tell it's an older hotel”
Reviews.Author: whitea8
Reviews.Content: The rooms are basic, no frills. There is a mini fridge and safe. They charge $9.95 a day for internet access and a hotel tax fee of $8 daily, above and beyond their room fee. Wasn't really all that great of a deal. 5th visit to Vegas, least favorite hotel. I did think it was better than the man in the adjoining room who you could hear through the walls complaining about what a "F'ing sh** hole" he felt it was he ranted and raved for 3 hours and we could hear every word. Could also hear him when he used the bathroom, what a pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Not Top of the Line, but Not Bad Either!”
Reviews.Author: Dave Tibbals
Reviews.Content: First, with all the competition in Vegas, there are a lot of hotels available at reasonable prices. The Riviera is like old Vegas, not so posh and not so glitzy. I stayed in a suite in the "new" Monoco Towers. Clean and retro! Problems: The alarm clock could not be reset without the instruction book which was missing. The internet service, which was a $10 per day surcharge, was not reliable. Check in at 5PM was still a 30 minute wait. As an older hotel (kind of nice that they were not ALL blown up), the layout is a bit challenging. One addition to another is not excactly a smooth transition. Now for the good. The price is OK for the room (value), and there are several good eating venues in the property. R has some wonderful steaks, and Queen Victorias Pub is a fine place to meet with friends for drinks.

Reviews.Title: “3rd time back, Still a great experiance!”
Reviews.Author: rl_referre
Reviews.Content: Posted 2 reviews of this hotel in the past. Still after my third time there I still find it very comfortable and pleasure to spend my money and time there. Spacious rooms, more table games were open this time around which was good. Thanks for another great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable but average”
Reviews.Author: GTHowie
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Monaco Tower from the standard rooms. Check in was quick as we came in during the evening. The staff were very nice and polite. As we were celebrating our 31st anniversary, I asked for an upgrade, thinking they would comp that. Nope, we had to pay for that ($20 upgrade). Not happy about that since the hotel was not filled up. The first room they gave us, the toilet was leaking water on the bathroom floor. We called and waited 30 minutes for someone to come but they did not. So, we hauled our luggage back over to the main desk. After telling them what happened, they immediately gave us another room. Same tower, different room, same scene. The bed was very comfortable but the room still had cheap furnishings and the room had a mildew smell. Found out if was the fridge. It leaked water onto the carpet and it made it smell like it was mildew. I could not use it as it would make our food, drinks taste bad. I don't think I want to pay the extra $ again for an average room. I felt what we were already being charged was pushing it. We go 2 times a year and would love to stay here but I was rather disappointed that it turned out to be just average for the price we paid. Our "special" night out to the steakhouse was a major disappointment-overpriced for the amount of food (ala carte). You pay for each portion of food on your plate. Not enough choices. Not sure I would stay again or recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good location if you're attending the Las Vegas Convention Center”
Reviews.Author: Grizzly660
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Rivera before because it is within walking distance of the Las Vegas Convention Center which saves money on taxis and time waiting for shuttle buses. The Monaco Tower is nicer than the other towers (newer) but they have recently increased the rate for these rooms. The room is modern and reasonably clean although there was mold on the bathroom ceiling. The heating/cooling system in the room was very noisy and you had to turn it off to sleep. My only contact with the staff was the front desk person and she was friendly. If you're looking for a luxury vacation hotel, this wouldn't be my first choice, but for business the price and location make it acceptable.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay for first-time visit!”
Reviews.Author: pav777
Reviews.Content: Stayed here during the last week of October for my first visit to Vegas, and I'm very glad I did. The Riviera is one of the oldest resorts on the strip, and though it's seen numerous renovations, it retains an old Vegas feel. I was checked in quickly by a very friendly girl. The wait was about ten minutes, not bad considering I arrived in the early afternoon. Don't bother using the self-serve check-in kiosk, they rarely work. Ask for the Fun Book, which contains coupons for use all around the resort. My room in the Monaco Tower was excellent, very clean and modern. It seems the reason for the disparity b/w good and bad reviews here is due to the quality of the rooms. You have to choose the renovated rooms to ensure a good stay here. Even with resort fees, the cost for my room was under $60.00 a night, a great deal. There was a flat screen TV, fridge, safe. fog-free bathroom mirror, and everything else you would expect, except for in-room coffee. A/C was cold and the king size bed comfortable. Overall a really nice room. The rest of the casino is great, too. I went to the buffet for dinner and breakfast, it was fine. It's not the most extravagant buffet on the Strip, but the food is good. There's a food court near the entrance with a decent selection of food, and a great breakfast special. I won some money playing roulette and video poker, so no complaints about the casino either. Drinks are free while you're gambling, of course. Don't forget to tip the girl. What I liked most at the Riviera was the relaxed atmospere. I usually avoid crowds, so I was relieved that it's not too busy here. In comparison, the Bellagio was swarming with crowds when I visited there, creating an almost frantic scene. Not sure what's appealing about that. It was a relief to return here each night. I can definitely recommend the Riviera.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and nice”
Reviews.Author: Jan T
Reviews.Content: Apparently "Unbelievably Bad" had a bad experience, but we stayed at the Riviera for the first time from 10/25 to 10/31/2011 and had a great room that was absolutely clean, beds comfortable, absolutely no bedbugs and believe me I did the hairdryer test before unpacking as I would have done at any hotel we booked. One minor problem with the toilet that was corrected with one call to maintenance within 15 minutes. The staff was friendly and helpful. We had absolutely NO problems and would stay here again and recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Christopher H
Reviews.Content: One of the oldest ledandary hotels in Vegas. Hotel does need updateing, but room clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Worst experince of My life”
Reviews.Author: Daniel C
Reviews.Content: Stay anywhere expect the Riviera hotel and casino vegas. Building is falling apart and staff are extremely anal and unfriendly, never mind the total lack of respect for its paying customers! Just stay somewhere else!!!!!! For more info, please e mail me at info.danocutts@gmail.com

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location on the strip!”
Reviews.Author: Shane H
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in the perfect spot to go to both new and old Vegas. It is about half way between Fremont street and the new strip attractions. We would recommend a car rental to stay here since the bus is quite a meat wagon. There is a Hertz car rental in the back lobby and the staff are very nice. Most of the best restaurants are off the strip making a car a necessity as far as I'm concerned. You can rent the car with the money you save on your room. There is a Denny's and Peppermill almost next door for a less expensive meal. The pool is very nice with a free towel service and lounges. The rates are very low and the rooms are old but clean. I loved the nostalgia in this hotel. There are stars out front for Elvis, Sammy Davis Jr. , Dean Martin and Liberace to name a few. If you've seen one casino you've seen them all but this one has a very large bingo hall if you like that. I heard that the odds are better to gamble here but they could use some 5$ blackjack tables.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded my expectations...”
Reviews.Author: ashandbrent2009
Reviews.Content: I wasn't looking for anything lavish when I booked the Riviera and it wasn't.... but to my surprise it was ALOT better than what I was anticipating! The rooms are very comfortable and updated! Pillow top matresses, updated linens, flat screen televisions - the bathroom was updated but the cleanliness of the bathroom was a minor issue. The location of this hotel is PERFECT for anyone trying to do "Vegas on a Budget" you're across the street from Mcdonald's, Subway isin't to far away.... the Riviera even has it's own little food court with Quizno's, Asian cuisine and a Phillycheese Steak place -- so if you're not looking for anything fancy... this is the perfect place. You have a good long walk to be able to cross the street to catch a bus to drive you to the center of the strip but if you're going downtown the bus picks you up right in front of the hotel. Don't use the hotel phone... which I think is common sense but I even got "dinged": with calling card fees.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: CiaranandEmily
Reviews.Content: I stopped here for 5 nights and although check in was quite slow possibly due to being 8 of us in the group but we were happy with our rooms. Our rooms were very modern and clean with good views although our party were split with our rooms far from each other. The hotel has a large pool however due to the time of year was always closed even though the weather was quite warm (we wore t shirts and shorts in the day). The casino is very impressive with many tables games etc, the myth of free drinks whilst you play is a little misleading as a botlle of corona only cost 2 dollars and although the waitresses do bring you the drinks for 'free' if you dont tip them a couple of dollars you wont see them again as 1 of my friends found out.
