The location of the hotel is a 15 minute walk to the main centre but there are buses going past all the time to jump on but we walked more times than not. Although there for 5 days you cant see everything in that time frame but from what we saw, a must is the bellagio fountains, Treasure Island show, the Stratosphere rides (although very scary), the whole of Caesers Palace and New York New York rollercoaster. On a night theres alot of bars to choose from but in New York New York theres the Coyote Ugly bar and the Irish bar which has a live band and dancers which was fantastic. We were well looked after due to being in fancy dress which the americans loved and got us free entry, q jumps and lots of free drinks in alot of the clubs but Ceasers Palace was the best for this. The hotel was amazing value for money, the only downside was the walk into the main strip however this was not a major thing. If your wanting value for money it was excellent but when i revisit i would probably pay abit more for a top hotel, but for a group of lads on a short cheap break was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Lost my reservation and charged me twice!!!”
Reviews.Author: Amanda A
Reviews.Content: It took me an hour to check in because of a clerical error. The hotel room was under my boyfriend's name instead of mine and because of this I was connected to the reservation helpline. I was on the phone with them for an hour and I was put on hold after each piece of information that was given. This was all information that the agent already had right in front of her and I realized this when she told me that she had to verify the things I told her. I asked multiple times if I would be charged twice because it sounded like she was cancelling my original reservation and she said "no." Low and behold, I check my account the next day and I was, in fact, charged twice. I waited a total of 43 minutes on hold before ever talking to someone about trying to clear up this issue. The rooms were decent and the original front desk clerk was very friendly, but it was not worth the hassle and definitely not worth twice the room rate. What should have been an easy fix, especially when they charged MY credit card for the original reservation anyway, turned into a huge headache and waste of time. Never again!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel for its price”
Reviews.Author: Ali469385
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from Vegas after spending 5 nights at the Riviera Hotel and Casino The hotel is located at the north end of the strip and is about a 20-25 minute walk to strip centre. But the location by itself is amazing ! McDonald's just across the street, Wall Green, CVS both a 2 minutes walk and plenty of other stores for drinks and restaurants. There is also a Ross store nearby for a bargain purchase ! The circus Circus casino is also across the street, one of the oldest yet charming casinos especially for slots. As for the hotel, we stayed in the Monaco Tower ...rooms were spacious, spotless clean and even luxury with a refrigerator, in room safe and plasma TV. House keeping were friendly and efficient. The pool area is well maintained and clean- it was a bit cold and we didn't swim- although other guests sis swim. I tried the buffet restaurant for dinner once and my experience was really good with a large variety of food for a reasonable price - 16 $ !!! The internet is not for free and costs 9.95 $ a day but was very fast. I read many reviews complaining about slow check in and lines...this is common in all Vegas hotels.However, my experience was different, we arrived at 11:00 am and were offered room immediately and check in took us last than 5 minutes !! and the staff checking us in and out were all very friendly. I heard that a new management has taken over this hotel and things are really changing. I will definitely stay there again and recommend you give it a try and not to judge based on other reviews. This place is really good and their casino is well maintained with large variety of slot and table games. We used to walk every night to the strip centre and the walk was really nice - we like walking. Also try to shop at the north end premium outlet mall ..its worth it and only a 12$ taxi ride. Overall, our stay was very very pleasant. Just make sure you stay at the Monaco Tower....I haven't tried other towers.

Reviews.Title: “Unfriendly staff”
Reviews.Author: lindelbus
Reviews.Content: We just visited Las Vegas and for the first time stayed at a "resort and casino". I felt that the rooms were quite nice, roomy and clean. I just was very disappointed that there was no coffee in the room, the desk staff on check-in were rather abrupt to the point of being rude and couldn't find anyone to direct us to our rooms when we tried to find them. The friendliest people were the valets and the gentleman who came to replace light bulbs and tv remote. The lady who checked us out in the evening was also friendly and helpful. There was no internet access unless you had a laptop and then there was a charge on top of that. Couldn't check-in for our flight and was told "You can do that at the airport" again in a very abrupt manner. I'll go back to Henderson and the Wingate next time.

Reviews.Title: “There's way better values out there”
Reviews.Author: WiMomof3
Reviews.Content: At check-in we waited 3 hours in line. As we walked by throughout our 4 day stay the line was always at least that long. We had booked non-smoking and they gave us smoking. They told us we could switch rooms the next night if we paid an upcharge. The room was dirty and smelly. The location is on the end of the strip so it's a hike to get to the main part of the strip. I would never stay there again. We paid around $100 a night plus a bunch of upcharges that we found out about at check-in. A few months later, we booked Aria for $150/night. Totally worth the extra cost.

Reviews.Title: “Just Adequate”
Reviews.Author: Upfromhere
Reviews.Content: Never having been to Las Vegas before, we really didn't know where to stay. We decided to go with a round trip flight / hotel package deal. Knowing that we would not be in our room much, I only read reviews to make sure that it would, at the very least, be clean. That is all that I will say good about it. Even that was minimal. The location is not good either. Seemed everything that we wanted to see or do was on the other end of the Strip. This section of town is old, rather rundown, and not much happening. You do get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Served its purpose”
Reviews.Author: YouKnowMe30
Reviews.Content: Check-in took a little long but once being served the process was painless. Housekeeping was great, very considerate to sleeping guest. Food court wasn't the best but served its purpose for a quick bite. Used to smoke free businesses so the horrible smell of cigarette smoke was annoying but nothing the hotel could do about that with all the gambling smokers. I would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Monaco Tower”
Reviews.Author: rosport
Reviews.Content: Great stay at the Riviera apart from the slow Check-in which is very annoying when one has been travelling for 20hours from the UK and the horrendous music played around the pool at high volume especially at the week-end for some reason which was driving people away i swear maybe this is the idea to get folks back inside spending money. Great room in the Monaco Tower very well serviced too by a lovely lady.

Reviews.Title: “Front desk very bad experience”
Reviews.Author: Michael K
Reviews.Content: My brother booked 5 rooms and used his credit card for our family vacation. The idea was to be able to reserve rooms as close as possible to each other. Both he and I stood in line while the other members waited off to the side. When we got up to the front of the line to check in we were told by the front desk person “Bianca” that he could not check us all in and everybody needed to check in individually. As the group started to walk up we were told very harshly they needed to get to the end of the line. To make matters worse, I was told that I had to “get back in line and wait while she checked in a VIP”! My brother booked 5 rooms and used his credit card for our family vacation. The idea was to be able to reserve rooms as close as possible to each other. Both he and I stood in line while the other members waited off to the side. When we got up to the front of the line to check in we were told by the front desk person “Bianca” that he could not check us all in and everybody needed to check in individually. As the group started to walk up we were told very harshly they needed to get to the end of the line. To make matters worse, I was told that I had to “get back in line and wait while she checked in a VIP”! My brother booked 5 rooms and used his credit card for our family vacation. The idea was to be able to reserve rooms as close as possible to each other. Both he and I stood in line while the other members waited off to the side. When we got up to the front of the line to check in we were told by the front desk person “Bianca” that he could not check us all in and everybody needed to check in individually. As the group started to walk up we were told very harshly they needed to get to the end of the line. To make matters worse, I was told that I had to “get back in line and wait while she checked in a VIP”! At the time a couple of us had planned on upgrading to a suite but were treated so badly we decided to stay in the rooms we reserved. The rooms and hotel were fine for the price however the front desk staff was just plain rude and nasty! When we return in April it won't be at the Riviera Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Good when your on a budget”
Reviews.Author: joanne s
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Monaco Tower rooms and they were great. They are not 5 star but they dont claim to be nor are you paying top dollar. We travelled with friends and had 3 rooms all of which were clean and comfortable. The hotel is facing Circus Circus with bus stop right outside! Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “The Bargain Bin”
Reviews.Author: butterfingerx10
Reviews.Content: I have started this review numerous times. Since I am not sure what I want to include, I think a quickie will do. If you just want the Vegas experience, want cheap, don't care about cleanliness or getting any sleep, this is the place to stay. If you have questions about Vegas, what is where and how to get there, you won't find help here. With the exception of the Bell Captian, it didn't seem like anyone was interested in being courteous or friendly to the guests. If you want coffee in the morning-you will have to head to McDonald's (across the street) since the coffee shop doesn't open until 7 :( If you want an awesome breakfast-head to the Queen Victoria's British Pub :):) You get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Bland in no man's land”
Reviews.Author: spanky132
Reviews.Content: The Riv is like your kinda-cool grandma. There's a lot of potential, but it's just not that cool. Nestled between two vacant lots, the Riv is close to almost nothing. The show quality is low, and there are plenty of hidden fees added to show tickets. The rooms are actually pretty nice, updated, and have great views. The pool is old school deep and oval. Tables seem high for this low end joint.

Reviews.Title: “Bargins at the Riveria”
Reviews.Author: Never_Home_9
Reviews.Content: Twice within the last three months, I have gone online to the Riveria web site and found rooms for $33 and $23 a night for 2 people. Booked them and each time helpful people at the checking desk upgraded us to a better tower room. Both times my room was clean, staff excellent, and with easy parking. Good casino and bus stop is right out front. Excellent value! Easy way to see Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “Ask for the Monaco Tower”
Reviews.Author: FloridaRetiree2010
Reviews.Content: We just stayed twice - upon arriving in Las Vegas and upon leaving - with a trip to the Grand Canyon between. We booked the Monaco Tower and are very glad we did. The room was clean and modern - newly renovated - and nicely upscale and reasonably priced. The bed and bedding was "over the top" - very comfortable and luxurious. The reception at check-in was very friendly and helpful. A couple of concerns, howevr. When we reserved online, no mention was made of a nightly "resort fee," which we were told when we checked in the first time - a little over $7 per night (not a lot, but it should have been told up front). In our second room, the TV remote did not work. We called housekeeping and were told that someone would bring new batteries. An hour later (and no batteries), we called again and were told that it has been assigned to the electrician and that he had several other stops. Four hours later (after returning from dinner), no work had been done and the remote still didn't work. Given the late hour, we didn't call again. During our second stay, we listened to our neighbor's television ALL night - we wondered if housekeeping has left the TV running and that no one was actually staying in the room. Exiting from the Monaco Tower takes one into a nicely appointed elevator lobby, but as soon as leaving the elevator lobby, you encounter strong smells of cigarettes. The self parking garage is old and shabby - and the elevator is dirty and dangerous/ Overall, our experience was good, but the facility could use some further upgrades.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty, Smelly & noisy”
Reviews.Author: angie g
Reviews.Content: We took our son for his 21st birthday to Vegas. Made reservations at the Riviera Hotel, expecting it to be a nice, comfortable hotel (not a Motel). Were we wrong. It was dirty, smelly and noisy rooms. A buzzing sound was all we hear every night. Showers were nasty and the flow of water was very low. We decided to go to the pool in the evening, to our surprise, it closes at 8pm. 8PM? are you kidding me! The bed sheets were dirty and the ceiling has stained and peeling off. DO NOT STAY at this hotel, they need to shut it down to do major remodeling. We were unable to find parking in the structure do to limited parking spaces. This was just an overall HORRIBLE experience. Please pass it on to others, it's not worth your money.

Reviews.Title: “Vegas on a shoestring”
Reviews.Author: jobegg
Reviews.Content: Stayed here as we were only in Vegas for one night before heading out to Grand Canyon. Cheap as chips, and no worse an experience than anywhere else. Has a pool, but stuck in the middle of all the high rises mean it got no sun. Didn't visit the casino, but it was suitably dingy, dark-lit, no clocks, resident slot-machiners etc. Decent enough for a night's sleep. Check-in was a joke though - had to queue for about half an hour. Not fun after a looooong drive.

Reviews.Title: “Top value for money - old school charm!”
Reviews.Author: Tinkknowles
Reviews.Content: Was worried having seen some reviews about cleanliness. Was pleasantly surprised, room could not be faulted and staff were all pleasant. Hotel has an old school charm - the casino is quiet compared to midstrip but still ok. If u r low in budget and want to spend money in Vegas rather than on a room worth a punt!

Reviews.Title: “OMG, this place is a dump”
Reviews.Author: GotTheTravelBug_9
Reviews.Content: We have been to Vegas twice before and stayed at the Bellagio & Palazzo. Yes, we know, those are 5 star hotels, and the Riviera is a 3.5 but ther is NO comparison. The rooms are like a regular run-of-the-mill hotel room, but filthier. We had to ask to have our bedding changed when we got there because of the white stains on the brown bedding. Gross. And the black hair everywhere didn't help (we are both blonde). There is nothing to do at the hotel either - it is dead and you are far away from the action on the strip. The pool is small and tired-looking. Sorry, this place needs an upgrade.

Reviews.Title: “Viva Las Vegas...at a reasonable price!”
Reviews.Author: Kathy S
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Riviera for 7 days, Oct 9 thru 16, 2011. As with others, I had read some of the not so favorable reviews posted and was a bit leery with all I had read, as to what we would encounter at the Riviera. We knew it was way down the strip, but we are walkers, so that didn't bother us a bit! Just a little more exercise to wear off all of the good food and beverages to be had on the strip! Check in was quick on a Sunday afternoon...about 20 mins (and we were checked in ahead of scheduled check in time of 4pm) . We were upgraded to the Monoco Towers at no charge when I asked. The room was very nice...nice, new and comfortable king size bed. Room was very updated, clean and tidy. Bathroom was nice too....good working shower, drain, toilet, fan, lighting and a mirror with a heating element, so the mirror didn't fog up! Nice towels too. All in all a pleasant room! And we've stayed at many other hotels for more $$ that didn't even have the basic working features in their bathrooms! Vegas is alot of fun...but you have to be prepared to walk or the bus will cost you $7 per day per person! The folks at the Hertz rental car desk at the Riviera were very friendly and helpful with our renting a car to travel to the Valley of Fire State Park and the Hoover dam...and the concierge was very helpful as well. The only negative I have to say about the Riviera is that if you stay on the pool side in the towers....they start up their LOUD pool music at 8:30 am and it goes all day til they close (which is relatively early). If you want to sleep in or take a nap during the day....you'd have alot of noise. Didn't particularly bother us as we were up by 8:30 every day. The other negative was the rudeness/inconsideration of other people staying at the hotel...yelling, laughing, talking in the halls and in and out of rooms all hours of the nite. This didn't happen every nite....but about 3 out of the 7. Not the Riviera's fault, as you will encounter rudeness in other guests no matter where you stay...seems that some people forget there are other people trying to sleep behind all of the closed doors. Vegas is a 24/7 party town...so be prepared for some of that if you visit. All in all a fun time and a good price in a fun town! Long live Sin City!:)

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad at All”
Reviews.Author: Varvara H
Reviews.Content: The Riviera is old, but surprisingly, nice. The room prices are excellent and the shows are pretty darn good. Staff was pleasant and welcoming. Their room-service menu is varied and reasonably priced. All together, the Riviera actually offers a good room and good service at a good price.

Reviews.Title: “Surprised!”
Reviews.Author: shellis129
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Riviera for 4 nights, October 13th thru the 17th. I gotta say, I was pleasantly surprised at it. After reading about the long waits to check in and some of the other reviews, I had my expectations a bit lower than I normally would have. I figured that it would be comparable to the Fremont or 4 Queens downtown. It was a lot nicer than those places, though. Check in was a little longer than I'm used to but it wasn't as bad as I thought it would be. Very friendly service and I was even upgraded to a "luxury" room for no charge after being booked into a basic "deluxe" room in the Monaco tower. Once I got up to the room, I was really surprised at how clean and comfortable the room was! Nice TV, nice bed, nice chair, nice desk. Unfortunately, no coffee maker, though. Probably the only disappointment. It woulda been really nice to not have to get dressed to go downstairs for a cup of coffee before getting my day started. The casino was nice, too. Machines were clean, bartenders were great, and the tables were nice. I'm a card player (but in no way a high roller) and I like to play at the $5 tables. Sure, I'll up my bet to $10, $15, or $20 but I like to be the one to decide that. Really disappointed that the Riviera's minimum bet was $10 at the BJ tables. I played for about an hour or so at a table but after that, the money was gone and I never went back to the tables at the Riviera. I'm big on playing where I stay but they have $5 tables at Circus Circus right across the street and it's a really quick walk. As for food, plenty of choices. A food court, a steak house, and a very good Asian restaurant is right in the casino, McDonald's is across the street, and the Peppermill is a 5 minute walk down the strip. Unfortunately, there's not a lot going on nearby, casino wise. Circus Circus is across the street but that's about it. There are a couple stalled out projects next door and across the street where the Stardust was located so if you're looking for other places to visit, you'll have to do some walking/driving. But you'll be doing that wherever you stay, really, if you plan on seeing some of the major resorts. You can be staying in the heart of the strip but there's always going to be another resort that you wanna see that's going to be a couple miles away. Bottom line, if you're looking for a decent hotel at a good price, the Riviera would be a great choice. Would I stay at the Riviera again? Of course!

Reviews.Title: “Pretty average but great location!”
Reviews.Author: andypluswendi
Reviews.Content: The Riviera is conveniently located on Las Vegas Blvd right across from Circus Circus on the northern end of Las Vegas Blvd. A short bus ride will take you to Freemont, or hop on the southbound duce to the newer casinos. They do, however charge a stupid "resort fee." Which to me is absolutely ridiculous - since they are getting all your money in the casino anyway. Plus, what is it for? Use of the average pool & fitness center? I know average hotel chains that let you do that just for staying. I did like the food court their (sometimes buffets get old!) And it's also gotten a bit seedy. There are stripper poles & passion pits where scantily clad females dance while your gambling. Ok for men, but a bit odd for me (female.) Overall, a pretty average experience. Their buffet is just ok. The plus is the location & cost. But be prepared for their lame resort fee!

Reviews.Title: “A value, but mistakes were definitely made”
Reviews.Author: TravelDJ1981
Reviews.Content: I didn't have high expectations of this place based upon reviews I read on here and other sites before we stayed here, so I wasn't too surprised and was prepared for what I experienced. I do want to say a couple of things before I begin to review this property in order to be fair. I have worked in the hotel industry as a laundry worker, breakfast bar attendant, bell attendant/shuttle driver, and front desk clerk. Because of this experience, I can relate to some of the mistakes that were made during my stay. Now for the review: I reserved my room online through southwest.com's website as a combo package. I looked at the room selection and decided to pay for an upgrade to a "Signature" room so that my wife and I could be comfortable. So we arrived at the Riviera. Now I knew ahead of time that the hotel was located on the north end of the strip so we rented a car to get around (parking is free so we didn't really care). In order to find the self parking lot we had to take a few turns around the block and it's not really in the most "bright" area, but that was something we were willing to deal with. Upon leaving the garage and stepping into the hotel you could tell that it had a darker feel. It's an older property so it wasn't too surprising. And we had a bit of a hike to hotel registration. Now based upon the reviews at this site and others we were prepared for a nightmarishly long check in line. I was surprised that check in was relatively quick, but I was shocked when I was advised that they had run out of rooms with one King bed. I guess I was willing to deal with that and checked in to my two Double bed room. This is when the mistakes began to happen. When we opened the door to the room we were surprised to find a hanger and crumpled tissue on an unmade bed, ironing board out, garbage not taken out, and a mans razor still on the bathroom sink. Of course I was disappointed and immediately began taking pictures of the room to take downstairs. Now I didn't cause scene TA, but I did then take the opportunity to express my disappointment with the mistake and requested that they make it right and also honor my upgraded room (since the "Oasis" room felt suspiciously "interstate side Motel-ish"). The front desk clerk then (I assume mistakenly) offered me an upgrade at an additional cost. This was definitely not going to fly (especially since I had already advised her that I had paid for an upgrade). She then corrected the error by finding us a "remodeled" room with one King bed non-smoking as I had originally reserved. Upon arriving in our new room (which was definitely better than the first) we found a couple of things odd, but liveable. The lack of lighting when you first come into the room is awkward. The vanity outside of the bathroom had two blown light bulbs (which is understandable in a city where money is spent keeping the lights on the outside of the buildings bright). There were other minor things, but one main thing that stuck out was a missing chain or security hatch for the door to the room. On the plus side, this location does save you money. We only ate one meal here which was breakfast and it was okay for the cost. By renting a car, it did give us easier access to the center of the strip without having to always get a cab. And getting a rental car allowed us to get to the other "off-strip" properties like the Palms and Rio. The hotel is old, and feels old. That being said, I did enjoy this trip and appreciated the value of a comfortable room at a decent price.

Reviews.Title: “A good deal”
Reviews.Author: vammer
Reviews.Content: For a friendly, reasonable, subdued hotel stay, we always go back to the Riviera. It is the best, The hotel is updated, clean, never too busy, but a relaxing change from the hustle, and bustle of some of the bigger hotesl. Food experiences have always been great, gambling has always been lucrative, spend a few days here about 3x a year and will always continue to go back.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for.”
Reviews.Author: Fernando S
Reviews.Content: Worst hotel I have ever stayed at. I've been to14 hotels this month and this one was the worst. Rude people work here and they do not care about your needs. I plained a special trip for my wife a got garbage. First they don't garuntee you a romm you reserved. I asked for king size room with a view and got a view of the ac unit. I called the offixe and she said that they didn't have anything. So my promise to my wide of a view of the strip was pi there door. We got some dirty sheets and we called the house keeping and she said yea its stains but we cleaned it. We went back and forth and my wife said we didn't pay for blankets. The manager said did you pay for them? Really?!

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay at the Riv!”
Reviews.Author: Prince-O
Reviews.Content: We love coming here! I made a mistake with my reservation but Blanca was great a straightened it all out. The staff has always been terrific & helpful. And yes, there was a line at checkin but it moved right along. Tell me where there isn't a checkin line in Vegas? We like the improvements they're making. Also, the pool area is simple but well kept & very relaxing. Great value in a Vegas Strip hotel, albeit the other end of the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Riveria Hotel Las Vegas October 2011”
Reviews.Author: langer_kim
Reviews.Content: Stayed there 1st week of October 2011. Hotel very nice and good value for money. BUT please be aware that the Gym is a waste of time, cardio equipment is all broken, all 2 cross trainers and 4 bikes, no treadmills at all. The only thing available in gym is weights, so if looking for hotel with gym, look elsewhere. The swimming pool looked nice, but did not use. Also be aware of resort fee as was not advised this was a daily charge. Also WIFI is chargeable.

Reviews.Title: “Revealing Riviera”
Reviews.Author: Travelbuny
Reviews.Content: My friend and I recently returned from an 8 night stay in Las Vegas, 3 of which were spent at the Riviera Hotel. I've been reading with interest the negative reviews on this site and I'm wondering if these people stayed at the same hotel we stayed at?? Our experience was nothing but positive! I have been to Vegas many times and stayed at many hotels up and down the strip, but never at the Riviera. Its the last of the "old Vegas" hotels on the strip and thank God a group of new investors stepped up this year and decided that it was worth keeping! The first 5 nights of our trip were spent at the Flamingo, where our Jr. Suite wasn't half as nice as our standard room at the Riviera!! A lot of the negative reviews about the Riv. involve the long waits to check in. I'm thinking that if people would just pay more attention and ask a few more questions they would have noticed that there are two very clearly marked self check-in kiosks right at the front desk. A very friendly & helpful front desk clerk named Alex was standing right there and was available to help us. It was all very easy and we were checked in and had our rooms keys within about 15 min. while approx. 20 people continued to stand in line waiting to speak to a clerk. Alex even said in a loud voice a couple of times to the people standing in line that they could use the kiosk. The only thing about the kiosk is that you might not get the room you originally requested, but for us it wasn't any biggy. I'm sure that if we would have wanted something different that Alex would have help us change if we had asked. Also if you use the kiosk versus the normal check in you need to give a $50.00 per day hold on your credit card. I never did ask why, but it didn't matter. As soon as you check out the hold is taken off of your card. Our room was a low floor recently refurbished room in the San Remo tower. I've done a lot of travelling and by far the beds at the Riv. were the most comfortable I've ever slept in!! We had good and efficient maid service everyday. The hallways and common areas were clean with no 3 day old room service trays and dishes laying around unlike the "other" hotel we stayed at................. Everyone we dealt with at the hotel was friendly and helpful. As a previous poster on this site has stated you need to keep in mind that this hotel is presently in the process of doing a lot of re-modeling, so make sure you ask for an already upgraded room. I suspect that some people that had problems with bad rooms ended up in one of the old, not yet re-modeled rooms. The pool area was also very nice & clean. Yes, the Riv. is an older hotel a little further away from the strip action, but we enjoyed that part. You can always easily travel down the strip by bus and enjoy all the action and then return to the more quiet Riviera for a good nights sleep on a great bed! We're already planning for our next stay at the Riviera and can't wait!

Reviews.Title: “Seriously...lots could have been better”
Reviews.Author: mshellrosie
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to Las Vegas...we will be back, but we won't be staying at the Riviera again. We first had to wait in line for over 50 minutes just to check in. At first there were 4 people helping people check in...but as time went on they slowly dwindled down to only 2 people with the line moving at the pace of grass growing. What was bad was watching people in the back as they drank their coffee laughed and discussed how they were going to spend their night after they got off!!! And here we are with all of these people waiting to check in and no one showing any urgency that there was all these people waiting in line. I had just flown two hours and now I had to stand in line for another 50 minutes. Good grief I was having a flashback to standing in line at Disney land waiting for the rides. Nothing was being done until one of the customers in line blew his top and asked to speak to the manager. After he did that all the sudden we had people galore smiling at the counter, waiting to help us (figures someone has to scream and shout to get help). What blew alot of us away was when a hispanic couple came up and asked for help and the hotel clerk looked at them and said "sorry we don't speak spanish here and can't help you". Those poor people! It pretty much then went down hell after that. Room service...none...they even missed our rooms to clean. We had to call and get help for clean towels (and of all things at 11:00pm !!!!) toliet paper. So here is the tip. You want cheap...go to the Riviera...you want bored clerks with no urgency and whose fake smiles saying that they could care less if you were checking in with them....Go to the Riviera...your broke and could care less...go to the Riviera. Otherwise you want to pay an extra $25-$50 a night and get treated the way you should (remember the economy sucks and if you are planning on spending the big bucks you might want to go somewhere were the people know and appreciate your buisness) Go anywhere else BUT the Riviera. Also we were informed that someone else has now taken over the Management of the Riviera...I also work in management and the way the hotel staff treated their customers I would have FIRED the lot of them. Expecially the woman who totally ignored the poor hispanic couple...if she would have asked I could have even helped them...I know enough spanish to get by...

Reviews.Title: “The Riv's a great deal!!”
Reviews.Author: airbrush101
Reviews.Content: I had 2-nights comped there in mid-September. I stayed there previously about 2-years ago. Each time I stayed in the newly remodeled Monaco Tower. The room was great, comfy bed, flat-screen & fridge. Since the last time I was there they have updated their sports book/bar, and many other parts of the casino. I enjoyed the many $5, 3/2 BJ tables. And I thought the slots were really loose. The dealers and pit bosses were super friendly, and went out of their way to say hello to you. Though my nights were comped, I wouldn't have a problem paying for a room there if I had to. But "free" is always better!

Reviews.Title: “Vegas done right!”
Reviews.Author: StrictView
Reviews.Content: Thank you so much to Brent, one of the Managers, for helping to make our stay a good one! And to the rest of the staff...in Banana Leaf (the Asian restaurant), Jitters (the coffee spot), Quiznos (a sandwich shop in the hotel food court), Queen Victoria Pub (one of the hotel restaurants), and ABC Store (the gift shop/convenience store)...EVERY one of you was so informative and friendly. I'm an avid hotel go-er/review writer and I've got to admit, overall the staff at The Riv are some of the friendliest I've encountered. Thank you so much! What to expect --- Don't expect to walk into a 5 diamond star hotel...that is not what The Riv is about. The Riv is a classic Vegas hotel. It's probably the oldest hotel on the strip but it's good. Our room in The Monaco Tower looked nice, comparable to any 3 or even 4 star hotel room. Sure the furniture has some dings but all that is expected in any hotel. The linens felt good, the carpet was clean, the curtains were nice, bathroom was clean, nice TV...not sure what else is needed beyond that. Fyi, there is a fridge in the room but no microwave or coffee maker (as with most hotels in LV though). From the food court to the other restaurants in the lobby, the hotel offers several fairly priced food options (even for late night). My friends and I were glad we chose The Riv...after touring the strip we were happy to come back to somewhere that didn't charge $16 a drink or $15 a hamburger. Sure the casino of The Riv is not like the casino of Caesar's Palace...but gambling wasn't our thing anyway. And if we had really felt like some serious gambling we could have just walked to the nearby Encore or Wynn...still the casino at The Riv had some good games and lively tables. Obviously you're in Vegas to see everything...not just the lobby of your hotel! The pool area was decent/very clean even...nothing to really complain about. They even have a live DJ and towel service...I even saw cabanas to rent (if that's what you want). One thing I do want to note, some things are under construction but it's not a huge bother...plus you've got to appreciate the effort being put in to improving The Riv. Getting around the strip --- we used the unlimited bus pass for $7 per person (all day). You could also opt for the hop-on hop-off tour bus (the kind with the tour guide) for $35 per person (til' 6pm)...the stop for both of these are directly across The Riv at Circus Circus. Oh, and listen to all the people passing out flyers, coupons, and free passes...we did a couple of these and got free VIP access, free drinks, no-line waiting at a couple really nice, otherwise pricey places...Tryst Nightclub in The Wynn and Chateau (the rooftop beer garden) at Paris Hotel...to name a couple. See my pics! Expect The Riv is be a 3/3.5 star hotel that is trying to improve itself and you won't be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “What a dive...”
Reviews.Author: itslisaj
Reviews.Content: The manfolk had received a call from a tour company named Casablanca Express. For $150, we could stay three nights in Vegas and receive some discounted meal/entertainment vouchers. We both own timeshares but thought "hey, it's $150 and it's Vegas, baby!". He asked them how they could offer such a low price and they said that The Riviera had gone through a remodel and they were wanting to show off the new accommodations. I had checked Trip Advisor and noted the comments from other travelers. I thought that they were probably kind of snobby and "how bad could it be?". Let me tell you how bad it could be. Our taxi dropped us off and upon entering the registration area, there were at least 30 people waiting in line. There were only four people available to assist the guests. We waited in line for 45 minutes. Note that there is NO where to sit and it would probably be impolite to sit on the ground with your suit case. After getting to our room, I noted the two beds. Jokingly I stated that we each get our own bed. Then I noticed the size of the bed. They were full size beds! The only question the attendant had asked was smoking or non-smoking. We are not large people but at my age, I really prefer at least a queen size bed. Other than a few "special" times, we slept in separate beds. Very romantic!! Then we get to the room itself. When we were told that the property had gone through a remodel, I would think that they would put us in one of the newer rooms. No, our room was circa 1975. There was a sticker on the mirror in the bathroom that asked that we keep the staff safe and if we had any hypodermic needles to dispose of to ask housekeeping for assistance. Seriously?! There was a Dole banana sticker on the bathroom counter that was there when we arrived and was there when we left, even though housekeeping came in each morning. The cupboards under the sink wouldn't close. The room was not clean. The window, that overlooked the pool, had mold/fungus in the windowsill. I wouldn't have noticed this except the drapes were falling off the hooks and I was trying to put them back up. On one of our ventures out, I noticed a room service tray outside one of our neighboring rooms. The tray was there for more than 24 hours! I know that we didn't pay much for this hotel stay. As I told the manfolk, if I make it out alive and without bed bugs, I'll consider it a blessing. If you must stay here (why would you?!) ask for an updated room. Otherwise, contact housekeeping if you must dispose of your syringes. Ugh.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Feelings”
Reviews.Author: JennW78
Reviews.Content: So, we went to Vegas for our anniversary. Once we got there, waited a long time to check in as it was late and there were only a few people working the front desk. Once we got up to our room, we were surprised to see 2 little beds in there. I went back down to the front desk and waited another 1/2 hour to talk to the lady to see what was up with the 2 beds, I had reserved a kind size bed online. I mean really, who spends their anniversary in seperate beds?!? The woman told me that there was nothing she could do, and insisted that I reserved 2 beds. I showed her my reservation and she suggested that I call Expedia and maybe they can put me in another hotel if I was unhappy or I could pay to upgrade. The first night was rough, I didn't want this to ruin our trip so I spoke to a manager the next morning who upgraded us to a suite and apologized. Although they made it right in the end, th customer service in the beginning left a lot to be desired. If you try and call the front desk from your room, prepare to be on hold at least 45 minutes. Would we stay there again? Probably not, it's cheap and clean for the most part however I would pay the extra money next time to get quality service up front.

Reviews.Title: “Riviera in Dire Straits”
Reviews.Author: John M
Reviews.Content: This is the first time I have put anything on the trip advisor .we booked to stay in the Riviera hotel in Las Vegas from the 14/9/2011-29/9/2011,we have stopped in this hotel for the last few years, going twice a year for a total of 30 days in total each year. We booked with Expedia and paid extra for the encore room (Monte Carlo tower) where we always stay, had read some bad reviews since it was taken over this year but thought some people just like to moan and have always enjoyed the hotel every time we stayed there. On arrival we had to wait 45 minutes in line to book in a lot of people were complaining about their rooms. When it was our turn we gave the receptionist our booking and she said fine and then said that will be $111 for resort fees we said we always pay that when we leave to which she replied it is now paid when you book in, so we paid it, she then said you can’t have the encore room and we said we paid for an encore room and that’s what we want, she said no one is staying in that tower as work is being done to upgrade that tower, we were not happy and she said that we were to be upgraded to a better room we said no thanks we just want what we paid for, she said at least look at the room, so we went to see it .it was in the Monaco tower and the room was a lot smaller with the old type of noisy air conditioning unit it also had a connecting door, but more to the point these rooms cost less than the encore, so we went back down and said we don’t want the room, she said that’s all we have take it or leave it. I just looked at her and said get me the reception manager and was told that she was on her break for the next hour, by this time I had had enough so I said are you sure that no one is staying in the Monte Carlo tower and she said yes, so I replied well the workmen must be staying in the rooms then as we saw lights on and people in the rooms when we passed, so I will just go up and check to see who comes out of the rooms and ask them if they are guests shall I, she then said that what she meant was that no more rooms were being let out in that tower so that work could start in that tower, I said we booked with you 6 months ago so why were we not told this, she replied not our problem and anyway it’s a first come first served basis and as you didn’t book with us direct it’s not our problem, speak to your tour operator it’s their problem, I just said what’s the name of your manager she said Annette, I said tell Annette we will be back to see her. We went back and had to stand in line again while 4 people in front of us were complaining to Annette, when we got to speak to her she was very offhand with us and I said we are not stopping in that room and I do not like being lied to and told her what had gone on previously she just looked at us and I said well, my wife said so we are at a stalemate and I said we have been travelling for 18 hours so get me the c.e.o. of the casino, she said that he was only in charge of the casino and I said well he is in overall charge of the whole casino of which this is a part, she then said that we would have to wait until the next morning to speak to him, and I said well we do now have a problem as we will not stop in that room and we have stopped in this hotel on numerous occasions and if you check your records it will prove that we always stay in an encore room, she went away and was some time when she came back it was with a totally different attitude, she then gave us a key to a room in the south tower room 763 the room was bigger but had a connecting door and the air conditioning was making a lot of noise, so we went back and said no, she then gave us the key to room 761 same room but next door it looked better than the last room, by this time we could hardly keep our eyes open, so we took that room, on checking the bed found it had only 2 sheets on it, no cover, blanket or duvet, so we rang housekeeping and had one sent up. I wish that we could say that was the end of it but no. Next morning after a sleep we checked out the room and it was terrible very badly run down and furniture covers all ripped, air condition unit filters had not been cleaned for years so the unit not working right. There was water on the floor at the bath (later found out that the toilet was leaking) when we complained about it you would think that all you had to say was that it was leaking please fix it, no I had to explain in detail where it was leaking from, I felt like saying just send me up the tools and I will fix it myself .the fridge was coated in filth and set to highest output controls ripped out so totally iced up. We stuck it out for 2 days but had had enough, so we booked into other hotels downtown (main street station, Freemont, Fitzgerald’s and the Las Vegas club, all of these hotels were far superior in every way polite and helpful staff, nice rooms and far cheaper than the Riviera. Also there were no resort fees and the safe was included. In total we spent 5 days out of 15 in the Riviera and out of them we ended up with a Mexican couple with a child in the next room to us from the 23/9/2011-26/9/2011,we had to suffer screaming and shouting up to 4am for 3 days and to add insult to injury in the morning they had a do not disturb notice on the door. The maid service was just about none existent a quick flick around, we had the same sheets on the bed for 10 days I know this because the top sheet had a rip in it and 3 holes on my side. The hoover was run over the room 3 times during our stay we checked the room most days. I could go on and on but to finish I will say we were booked to go back again in November for 16 days at the Riviera but we phoned up and got the travel agent to change our bookings to another hotel thank god, as for complaining to the management why keep complaining my advice to anyone considering staying at the Riviera don’t go elsewhere where you are treated with respect and politeness, even when we booked out all that was said was that’s you all paid up .no hope you enjoyed your stay and look forward to seeing you again. So go elsewhere don’t put up with rubbish treatment and bad service it’s your money and your holiday

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly Fine!”
Reviews.Author: fee-vee
Reviews.Content: Stayed there with hubby & our two friends 27th Sept-4th October and found it to be fine! Spotlessly clean & comfortable beds and daily maid-service including change of towels! Not as 'posh' as many others on the Strip, but you're not in your room all day so it's perfect for getting your head down. Had breakfast in The Queen Victoria Pub, but didn't try the other eateries as we were out all day. The only thing that lets the hotel down is the check-in staff, who are unwelcoming, unwilling to speed up (the check-in queues were horrendous!!), unpleasant & extremely unhelpful!! Our safe didn't work and we were told 'tough'!! The cashier staff were fabby (especially Kathleen) who helped us with a safety deposit box for free ($20 deposit is refunded when you return the key). DON'T hire the room safe & you'll save yourself $3.50 each day!! Enjoy your stay!!

Reviews.Title: “Does the job”
Reviews.Author: Rodeway
Reviews.Content: We got it at a nice price and it served us very well for the few days we were there. Can't understand some reviewers saying it was far away. It's on the strip a bus , cab or walk away from anywhere you want to go unless your too lazy to move. Forget about the eating choices and get outside. Nice pool area and friendly staff. We have stayed at luxurious 5 star resorts around the world but for the price would have no complaints about The Riviera.

Reviews.Title: “Stop moaning”
Reviews.Author: ccfcway
Reviews.Content: Read the reviews on here and panicked before we went, so emailed the manager who gave us an upgrade. Was it 5 star, no, but it was clean, the beds really comfy and at only $30 a night what more could you ask for. The bar staff were good and drinks were flowing. Is it the best hotel on the strip, no, but do you get value for money, deffo. Brent Tary and the team did good. What's not too like !!!

Reviews.Title: “Living on borrowed time”
Reviews.Author: genemean
Reviews.Content: The casino section was built in 1954 and looks it. It has an abandoned feel to it. The Sahara down the street has been boarded up. The end must be coming.

Reviews.Title: “you get, what you paid”
Reviews.Author: aidaliz0130
Reviews.Content: Hotel is old and the elevator was durty, Buffet at the Riviera was nasty, food was cold and not that much of choices to eat. Also I have to talked to the Manager because they forgot to clean my room.

Reviews.Title: “Check it out!”
Reviews.Author: wcavalli
Reviews.Content: We just got home from our annual Vegas vacation. Usually we would avoid the Riviera because it is one of the "older and decrepit" strip hotels. Before our trip, I read the reviews on TA and learned about the remodeling and the Monaco tower. We checked in for a long weekend and had a fabulous time! Here is what you need to know if you want to have a great experience and save loads of money. 1) The breakfast buffet has everything you expect, INCLUDING an omelet chef and is only $10. 2) The room we had was unbelievable for the price. We stayed in the Monaco tower and had a pretty nice looking room with a flat screen TV, a pillow top mattress, and a refrigerator. 3) The pool was awesome..and best of all NO KIDS! In fact, we did not see any children running around the Riviera. Maybe they were all across the street at Circus Circus. (We have kids of our own, but we do not take them to Vegas.) It was nice and quiet by the pool without any screaming or splashing. 4) The Bingo Room is awesome! I am not usually a bingo player, but my husband was napping and I was bored. In the bingo room, I got a free drink, 24 cards to play with simultaneously for 13 different games (the computer keeps track for you if you want it to) and an hour of entertainment. All for 26 bucks. It was so much fun! 5) We are big football fans and could not turn away from Sunday Night's game, so we had pizza brought up to the room. It was very good and had loads of cheese on it. I think we got a 16 inch pizza with 2 drinks and an order of cheesy garlic bread with marinara for about 20 dollars including delivery. Yum! The casino is not special, it is pretty typical and has all the games you expect. It is a little smoky but not unbearable. This hotel is ideal if you want a very nice room on the strip for a very reasonable price! The only reason I did not give it a 5/5 rating was because check in took forever, and because we are members of Las Vegas Advisor and they would not take our 2 for 1 coupon. (expiration 12/30/11) We were told that because the buffet had changed its name from the Garden Buffet, the "Garden Bouquet coupon" was no longer valid. That seemed pretty petty to me.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing Good about this place”
Reviews.Author: Zak C
Reviews.Content: I went to L.V. for a hockey tournament. The first night @ the Riviera my hockey gear was stolen out of the trunk of my rental car in the parking garage. The room was an upgraded room, but it didn't have a refrigerator, the hairdryer was not there in the room, the entertainment center/dresser the the front door broken and set to the side, the maid service only came to the room 3 out of 5 days, and saw a roach in the bathroom. I will never stay there again and would not recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “What A Dump”
Reviews.Author: PHXCUSTOMSDOTCOM
Reviews.Content: First off, I always questioned how some hotels get their star ratings. I booked the room because of their 3 star rating / price. The check in process was quick because I chose to do the self check in kiosk. If the line is has even one person for the regular check in use the kiosk. I waited 15 minutes with one person in front of me until I gave up and went to the other line. Once I got in to the room I was overwhelmed by the musty smell which seemed minor after I flipped on the bathroom light and saw all the roaches (I counted 6) scatter about. I picked up all my stuff and went back down stairs to get a new room. The front desk staff was nice enough to move me to another room which was o.k. at best. The bathroom was tiny with a pedestal sink which made it tough to spread out your toiletries. The beds were suprising comfortable. Overall.... I probably wont be coming back to the Riviera unless there is a major overhaul.

Reviews.Title: “Good overall, although a bit far from the heart of the strip”
Reviews.Author: City_explorer78888
Reviews.Content: It was a great stay at the Riviera. Not very expensive, friendly staff, nice swimming pool, and the fact it's not too big means you get to your room quickly. The food court is ok and we did not try the other restaurants, but if you're looking for a nice cheap place to sleep on the Strip, it's a good deal. It is a bit far though, and we strongly advise taking the bus down the street especially when it's really hot outside. Oh, and the best odds on the street, if you're playing the slot machines and that sort of things.

Reviews.Title: “Very helpful”
Reviews.Author: mazzzLeeds
Reviews.Content: The only hotel on the strip to get Super-league rugby league on their "big screen" they went out of their way and couldnt do enough for us - the english bar and all the staff and Terry in particular were great - we had a platter of sandwiches which were great... 10-10 for customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Room for Improvement”
Reviews.Author: Antanette R
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 days on a group trip. The experience was mediocre. Check-in at the registration desk was a slow process. Upon receipt of room key, I was sent to a room that had not been cleaned and smelled horrible. Went back down to the registration desk and was reassigned a room that was better (i.e. cleaned). The hallway was very dim and the carpet smelled like it had not been cleaned in years and the bathroom shower needed more water pressure. It is far down the end of the strip, so if you're unable to walk it, you will need to buy a $7 all day pass each day you will want to venture up the strip. I specifically went on the Riviera website to give a review, but it does not offer the option, which gestures they're not concerned about suggestions on how to improve a patrons stay at the establishment. Overall, the price is the only draw to the hotel. There is plenty of "Room for Improvement". Unfortunately, if given the option again, I would not stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Cheesy, loud and worn out”
Reviews.Author: sjssf
Reviews.Content: Physically this has got to be the ugliest hotel in Las Vegas. Someone redecorated in the 1980s and the rooms like sets from Dynasty. Everything is worn. The paint has scratches. The carpet in my room looked like it had caught fire at one point. There was a long black hair in the toilet seat when I arrived and the beds were hardly made after that. Staff is over the guests and you should expect lines to check in or out. The pool is crowded and there is bad pop music playing very loudly. The music follows you everywhere, and often it competes with the din of the casino and several tv's all blaring different channels. The whole place is sad and I would avoid it at all costs. Sinatra would not be happy.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for the price”
Reviews.Author: hiphopjunkie
Reviews.Content: Got a great deal on Priceline. Stayed at this hotel about 2 weeks. When I first stepped into the hotel, I was a little alarmed. The lobby and the casino looked old and worn down. There was a large bucket in the walkway to the elevator catching a heavy leak from the ceiling. But the hotel was packed and nobody else seemed to be bothered. Maybe they were too drunk to care! After all, nobody comes to Vegas for the hotels. I was surprised that the room was modern, spacious, and clean with a fridge and flat screen TV but no microwave. Thought that was kind of funny. The hotel is near the end of the strip, across the street from Circus Circus. $10 a night for internet service is excessive, there are a few no frill cabana rentals across from the pool. Pretty good choice for travelers on a budget who want to experience Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: momacuda
Reviews.Content: I read reviews for EVERYTHING before choosing the Riviera. I was nervous after the many negative comments about check in and out time.I decided that for the price we would put up with some inconvenience. Although it was true the self check in kiosks were NOT working (they really should get their service on that), we were in line shortly after 4pm and the line was long but went quickly so that we were there less than 30 minutes and our procedure at the desk took less than 2 minutes. I expected a run down room but that wasn't true at all. It was clean and recently painted. The tile was nice in the bath although there was a cigarette burn in the tub. The maid kept the room clean and towels replaced.The fridge worked well and the window opened on the 21st floor so my husband could sit and smoke and blow it out the window. They weren't luxurious surroundings but great for the cost. The breakfast cafe had very good food and service(thank you Carmen) was polite and helpful as it was throughout. We aren't really gamblers so I can't review the casino because I have nothing to compare to. Check out was no wait at all, accurate and again polite. All things considered it was a good experience and we would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “This is the most HORRIBLY managed hotel I've ever stayed at!”
Reviews.Author: MNRO1
Reviews.Content: The rooms are somewhat clean, but our room didn't have the fridge we were supposed to have. When I informed the front desk, they told me I could switch rooms, but only after I was asked if I "just missed it". I told them that we were settled already and that they could just bring in a fridge. I was told that they don't move fridges. The tub doesn't drain. None of the shops open before 6 am. (including coffee shops) The topper is that my wife and I were woken up by hotel security at midnight because they had us scheduled to leave a day earlier than reserved by our group. The rude person at the front desk said they had been trying to call us all night. When you can actually can find an employee, they can't speak clear English, or they are rude. Avoid this place at all costs. Their has to be a hotel in this price range in this town that doesn't suck this bad.

Reviews.Title: “Worse than I thought it would be.”
Reviews.Author: Crash71x
Reviews.Content: I normally stay at TI when I visit Vegas so my opinion may be a little skewed. The room was average with an incredibly small bathroom (R801). The casino smelled bad. It was like a cross between cigarettes and BO. Not a pleasant experience at all. The pool was ok. The only good comment about the hotel was the staff at Katys coffee shop(?) were excellent. Friendly and service oriented. STRONGLY URGE YOU TO STAY ELSEWHERE.

Reviews.Title: “Middle of the road at the bottom of the strip”
Reviews.Author: AKsadvice
Reviews.Content: We stay at the Riviera at least once a year, the remodeled rooms are nice and they have European syle quilts a big plus! Make no mistake the area is a bit run down since the demise of the Stardust and Sahara but the Wynn is just a little way up the road, as is the fashion show mall. For the money its a bargain. Staff are friendly and helpful, most have been there over 20 years. Be warned only the breakfast buffet is worth eating, there is not enough foot fall for the lunch and dinner buffet to be good. Swimming pool is OK, small pool with loud music in the summer, try and get a room facing the parking lot next door, lousy view but peaceful! The Queen Vic pub is a good place to eat, not sure where they got their recipe for steak and kidney pie though, certainly not England!

Reviews.Title: “Riviera Hotel, Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: gai01983
Reviews.Content: Rooms are old but very clean. Rates are low but then you pay for internet and any other items normally free outside of vegas. If staying for more than one night make sure to ask about all charges not just room cost. They add up.

Reviews.Title: “Just fine, if you can get a deal”
Reviews.Author: mdgates
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Riviera last week. It was neither wonderful nor terrible. If you want a budget place to stay on the strip (although fairly away from the main part of the strip) this is about as good as it gets. It's either the Riviera or Circus Circus with all those kids. You decide. I was able to check in early and my registration went smoothly. I opted for a $20 per night upgrade which put me into a room on the 18th floor of the Monaco tower, which is supposed to be the best. My room was fine with a south view of the back of the strip and mountains. I was surprised that the Monaco tower rooms are considered the best in the hotel because my room seemed fairly average and the bathroom was a bit shabby. But for about $70 a night with all the fees and taxes, it wasn't a bad deal. Circus Circus and Slots of Fun are across the street. And there is a Walgreens and Ross for Less with walking distance. But if you decide to stay at the Riviera, be prepared to take the Deuce bus or drive to the more active part of the strip. You can also walk through the Riviera's convention center to the monorail at the Hilton. There's an elevator to the parking garage that I walked through to avoid the sun. For $12 you can ride as much as you want for 24 hours and it's much more pleasant than trying to squeeze on the Deuce bus during busy times. I ate at the Riv Buffet on my first night. I was starving so the food tasted just fine to me. There's a good selection of comfort foods and deserts. So, if you can get a good deal the Monaco tower and realize that you're not staying at a four-star resort in the middle of the action, the Riviera is a perfectly serviceable place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Riv!”
Reviews.Author: dsm640
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Riviera on every trip to Vegas over the last 15 years. It continues to update it's rooms and services. There are good places to eat and great shows on the property. The room rates are great! Although it is on the Strip, it is a considerable way from the main attractions. However, the bus and trolley both pick-up across the street and there are taxis in the parking garage entrance at all times. I always look forward to staying at the Riviera while in Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “New Ownership travelers be ware!”
Reviews.Author: estaceee
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Riveria for many years, I've wrote good reviews about the hotel well last weekend 9/17/11 for Mr. Olympia finals the hotel and service was awful. When we 1st checked in they didn't have a non-smoking room as we had reserved we was informed its 1st come basis ...Can you believe that we never heard sucg a thing!!! After speaking to some employees I was informed their under new management which would explain why they have taken out all the little shops and replaced with slot machines and poker tables. When called for room service they were so rude we cancelled our order.. I had blood and food stains on my pillow cases. Oh let's not forget they charge for everything internet, and anything other than local tv, OMG they have hidden charges also , so please if your considering staying there just know you have been warned...

Reviews.Title: “Stay away from the Buffet”
Reviews.Author: Robert A
Reviews.Content: Was in town on business and stayed across the street at Circus Circus. Tried the Buffet at the Riviera on evening, Not impressed and should have walked out! The Casino has vanilla scent in the air, guessing to make you happy but gave me a really bad headache. Finally found the Buffet after wandering around the area when the signs ended. Had to ask at the gift shop, took the escalator up to the second floor and that damn vanilla scent was there too. The Cashier was friendly and the price was a little high (slot card got me a discount of 10%). Host was friendly and I found I was the only one there, no kidding. Went to the Buffet and had to ask if there was another Buffet line somewhere as the selection was pathetic!!! On one end you had 3 choices, I think it was like ribs, crusty mashed potatoes and something else...then you have the carving station with ham and prime rib? quite pink and almost rare, tasted nasty. Then another area had 3 choices, cut beef, noodles and something else and another area had the oriental (3 choices). That's it...mashed potatoes were crusted over, gravy had hardened layer and everything looked as it's been there since open 8 hours earlier and no one touched it. Casino had the dark colors with red neon and mirrors to make it look bigger, very out dated. I personally would never go back. If I had seen anyone else going to the Buffet I would have warned them to stay away.

Reviews.Title: “would not stay there again”
Reviews.Author: sherrin40
Reviews.Content: room were dated and smelled like sour carpet, check in and out was very slow took a long time, staff was less then friendly, some of the dealers at the tables acted like they hated being there were not friendly at all will not stay there again.Some friends that went us had to change room because theirs was so dirty bath tub was filthy.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable price for location”
Reviews.Author: KhaledEffendi
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated at the end of the strip, but in front a bus stop, which is easy for travel on las vegas boulevard. The price was quite cheap and reasonable. I would only have one complain and it concerns the cleanliness, be careful, you might find things close in the corners and other bed. Obviously this is not a huge hotel on the strip, don't expect anything like the Bellagio or Cesars.... It's mostly for sleeping.

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as people say”
Reviews.Author: mombmw1
Reviews.Content: I heard nothing but bad things about this place but believe me it is not s bad a s people say. The room was in the Monaco Tower. It has been updated and the furniture was new and in good condition. The carpet was new and looked clean. The bed was good as were the linens. The negative was that it was very small. The room was one of the smallest I have stayed in. The person who checked us in had a crappy attitude and was not helpful. In general it was worth the meager price of $59 that we paid. If you need a cheap room look at this place.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms, tired common areas”
Reviews.Author: Suki1180
Reviews.Content: Check in was horrendous, long, long lines. Lobby areas were very tired. Room was very nice but the shower was old.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay for the price we paid”
Reviews.Author: JanPaul11
Reviews.Content: Booked the hotel via a website on internet for a good price! The romms are spacious and clean. And you stay on the strip, but near the Circus Circus so it is on the quite part of the Strip. Breakfast was not included but was good.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay for the money!”
Reviews.Author: Myreed75
Reviews.Content: After reading prior reviews on your site, I was doubting my wisdom in choosing this hotel. However I was pleasantly surprised. We arrived at the hotel about 10:30 Monday evening - only waited about 15 minutes and then checked in with a very nice man from Waterloo, Ia. We did have to pay a resort fee but it wasn't a big deal. We had a great room in the Monaco Tower. It was clean and very neat. We had great experiences with all of the employees. Our only complaint would be that the air conditioner in our room was a bit noisy, but after the first night, that wasn't a problem. We ate at the buffet one morning at 11:00 and got in on both breakfast and lunch! The food court had several choices. Overall we had a very good experience here and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “If you really want to be in Vegas...”
Reviews.Author: ranchette7
Reviews.Content: Personally, I thought I'd like gambling and the casino thing but was quite put off by it. But if you're determined to be in Vegas, The Riviera is a great place to be. The room is very comfy. The bed is great. The bathroom is really nice - decent tub to lounge in.Free parking right under the hotel. It's one of those Vegas complexes that you basically don't have to leave...ever. Full casino, a nice outdoor pool, good restaurants, lots of shops. It's not in the heart of the action. That's about 2 miles down The Strip. But an easy drive down Paradise means you don't have to be stuck in the Las Vegas Blvd. traffic on the way to the action. I checked in on a Friday evening after a very long day that started with a sunrise hike in Bryce Canyon and continued with a hike in 103 degrees at Valley of Fire so I was tired and sweaty. Be warned - check in on Friday means a very long line. I was unpleasantly surprised. There's an "express check in" machine but for some reason it didn't recognize my reservation.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Beckieboo21
Reviews.Content: So there are lots of negative things said about this hotel so I'll try to give an accurate account of our stay. My boyfriend and I stayed here for 4 nights. We're both 21 and it was our first experience of Vegas. The hotel check in was quick and easy, waited in line for around 5 minutes. We were given hotel coupons (casino match plays, restaurant offers) and our room was complimentarily upgraded. Our room was perfect, quiet aircon and a fridge. The hotel is older than most on the strip and right across the road from circuscircus. It has good transport links to both downtown and the strip. Bus costs $7 for 24 hours or $20 for a 3 day pass. If you're looking for a good value stay in Vegas you'll find it in the riviera. The buffet was great, the pool has an awesome atmosphere

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again wihtout giving it a thought”
Reviews.Author: carinabramley
Reviews.Content: I arrived here, a 28 year old girl alone on a trip to go to a wedding. It was very last minute and i had only booked it the week before. I was slightly concerned as i knew it was a long way up the strip and was a budget hotel. I was very shocked at what i found there. it was amazing! Ok, so its not the belaggio, but its better than any hotel ive stayed in in England. I arrived at 830ish in the evening and the q had 3 people ahead of me and took a good 15 minutes (which was frustrating) but the assistant that served me was so nice. She upgraded me to a room that i later found out charges $500 per night usually and i had only paid $22 a night! She also gave me the fun book with vouchers in which came in very handy! Aftr an efficient check in i made my way to the room. It was out the back, past the pool into the monaco tower. The lifts were clean and the when i finally worked out the floor numbers i headed up and found it to be lovely. It was clean, crisp and bright. There is a drink vending machine and ice machine on each level by the lifts. I opened the bedroom door and was shocked. It was wonderful. I had a huge king bed and flat screen tv. A fridge and mirrored wardrobe. The bethroom was slightly small, but as i was alone, it was absolutely fine. There was a bit of mould on the ceiling above the bath, but to be fair, i would expect that in an older hotel. Seeing as i was room 6418, i knew they had quite a few to keep updated! The view was of the pool was ok. Be aware that they turn the pool music on at 830am and it goes on til late so you will hear it. They also clean the pool early and that can be quite noisy. The fridge was spotless. Tv had 23 channels which was good, travelling on my own i wasnt out late so watched a few films on fox. The staff were all friendly, the shops great, the ABC shop had everything i needed in it. I didnt really gamble, was on a budget that didnt really allow it. But i did do lots of shopping as well as go to the wedding. Taxi's were easy to get outside (the underground part) and i had to gt an early one to take me to the airport. Check out took seconds and the taxi was wating for me at the door. Downstairs is smokey, but all the casinos in vegas are as you can smoke in them. Took a bit of getting used to as in england you cant smoke in public places like that. My room was always clean, no smells. I apologised to the cleaners for doing their job for them, i made my bed, re used my towels and kept it all tidy, they just had to empty the bins. The walk from this hotel into the centre of the strip took a while. I had stayed at circus circus opposite before and i didnt remeber how long that walk was. Took an hour from riviera to mgm and that was walking fast! The duece bus is brilliant, $7 for the day and their are stops right outside the front of the hotel which is handy. Can ride for 24 hours on $7 and as many times as you like. utilsed this lots. (if you have lots of shopping, there isnt much space, and people tut at you, but i coped!) All in all this was a brilliant stay and i would have no problems staying here again. Well done riviera.

Reviews.Title: “Good value on The Strip”
Reviews.Author: ggabi
Reviews.Content: Hotel is a bit old but well maintained and everything is in good condition. Location close to the end of the Strip, but the atmosphere is the same. Nice casino, very nice food court, a couple of nice shows going on. You can avoid long queues at the reception ( a common problem in Vegas) by using the automated check-in kiosks.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap room, comfy bed, a bit dated lobby area, but overall great value”
Reviews.Author: wakayamachan
Reviews.Content: There is something a bit charming about the Riviera. It must have been such a great place back in the day, and now can't quite seem to keep up with its more splashy posh neighbours. Made me almost feel a bit of pity for it, as it is trying to get back to its glory days. I hope it succeeds. We stayed here as a stopover driving from LA to Denver. We didn't spend much time in the casino, as it was smoky and we aren't big gamblers. The pool also was just a bit strange in that it was more like a lap pool rather than a cool lounge and splash around pool. Not a huge fan of that. Frankly, if I was here for the gambling, I would go elsewhere. It is also a bit far off the main areas of the action on the strip. However, for the price, I felt the room was very nice- modern, clean, and seriously the best bed I've slept on in ages. Perfect for our needs!

Reviews.Title: “Vegas Trade show just looking for Clean, Friendly & Connivence”
Reviews.Author: amyzoee
Reviews.Content: This hotel which has a very smokey and dark floor, actually has decent rooms. I stayed in the Double Classic on the 8th floor & was surprised at how nice my room was. It is a basic hotel with clean rooms, AC & flat screen Tv's. The people in the casino are basic, smoking old enough to be your parents or your parents, parents. However, if you doing a show at the convention center you are 5 min away and you can walk there. So if your not going to party in your hotel and your looking for something on the cheaper side, this is a great place. The pool is small but nice and compared to the Excalibur this is a much nicer hotel except for the pool.

Reviews.Title: “Filthy rooms-beware this is not a bargain no matter how cheap you get the room!”
Reviews.Author: bonjouraz
Reviews.Content: Requested to be moved from the first room due to suspicious stains on sheets, furniture and drapery. Carpets and bathroom were soiled so badly that we were afraid to walk without shoes on in the room. Moved to second room equally disgusting. Front desk advised we had been upgraded initally to premier rooms non-smoking as a courtesy ( we showed them we actually paid for this in advance thru getaroom.com-they didn't give us anything) We spoke to the Manager who offered to move us for a third time, which we declined. They should have checked out the first two rooms before they moved us into them, moving from one filthy room to another was overall a very unsatisfactory experience. We checked out and moved to another hotel for a few dollars more a night for the duration of our stay.

Reviews.Title: “It was okay...”
Reviews.Author: PJay27
Reviews.Content: The hotel is pretty old. I stayed there about 8 years ago, and it was way better then. When we checked in, we had to wait in line for a good 15-20 min. However, the guest services host was pretty nice. We stayed in a standard two bedroom. We supposedly got an upgrade to a "strip view", but the only one right corner window (out of a wall where they could have made a nice large window) gave us a great view of the air conditioners and the Encore hotel...that's about it for the view. We did get a "fun book" at check-in, which had some good deals in the hotel. We tried out one of the restaurants on-site, which was like a English Bar/Restaurant. The server did not provide good service at all, she seemed very preoccupied with other things going on either internally or externally (not really sure). When trying to call the front desk, we were on hold for a good 5 minutes before even speaking to any one. Every time we called they were rude! All in all we were not treated like a guests in the hotel (with the exception of the check-in process). I would not recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “many changes”
Reviews.Author: straban
Reviews.Content: The place was in a flux of construction and not very busy. It was very loud with the construction and that made it not that easy to catch a few winks. Plus the fact that new ownership had taken over and let go of most or all of the gaming hosts it was a bit of a pain.

Reviews.Title: “"Getting Old "”
Reviews.Author: marjoe1
Reviews.Content: Hotel and Casino is getting old and outdated. Resturants within are just OK. Needs some repamping all around.

Reviews.Title: “Was really nice !!!”
Reviews.Author: chiringon
Reviews.Content: We didn't have any problem, at the beginning I was afraid about this hotel after reading all the bad opinion about it, but We have a good experience, the room was clean, nice, check-in and check-out times were normal. A good option if you don't want to spend a lot of money !!!

Reviews.Title: “I was expecting the worst but was pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: USMCgrl1904
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were going to the Deadmau5 concert on The 1st friday of this month and were looking for a low priced hotel on the strip. I saw the prices here at the Riviera and was happy to see the low prices.
