I then checked out the reviews here on trip advisor and saw many scarey reviews that had me regretting my booking with the hotel. For the next couple days i was worried that i had booked a dump and sweated it out. My 1st fear was people talking about the long wait to check in. We arrived at 3pm that friday and waited a total of 15 minutes in line to check in. The line flowed nicely, and what really was a wonderful surprise was the fact that our luggage would be taken up by a bell hop. We were offered to upgrade to a mini suite in the Monte Carlo tower and we gladly upgraded. Later on i saw how long the lines were and i could see how people could wait longer to check in. My advise to try to get there earlier to aviod longer lines and longer waits. Next fear was the room. We walked into a very very awesome room. Bed was comfy ( i wish i took pictures ) and having the fridge was awesome! Flat screen TV and bathroom was nice. Everything was clean and nice.We stayed at the luxor and didnt have a flat screen there and paid double. Channel choices were mediocre, but i didnt care since we werent going to realy be in the room. Negitive was the fact our remote didnt work. The view out the window sucked but who cares im not there in vegas to look out windows ill go to the strip to see things. I wish we'd join the riviera club while we were there also. Oh well, next time. An older man who was our bartender there at the hotel was nice but aparently didnt like the choices of drinks i ordered because he asked me why did i hate him. When i tried to order a mojito he told me they don't make those kind of drinks there?? Okay this is vegas and mixed drinks arent made there? I won't be going to that bar again. Walking to the main part of the strip was not a big deal. Its right down the road. Get some excersise and walk. Even with 110 degree heat its not that bad. Getting a cab was confusing, after walking around for awhile trying to find out where to get one we had to go down the escalator. Thats a pain in the butt. Oh and i got a tattoo and 3 Lions and loved it. Tyson the tattoo artist was awesome! And I used the coupon too ha ha. The bar and stuff could use improvements but i felt i was getting my money's worth. We will be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Don't even let the Riviera Hotel & Casino be an option !!!”
Reviews.Author: maxsmama05
Reviews.Content: Let me preface my review by stating that I did not want to stay here in the first place, but since I was going with friends I basically had no choice. The Riviera exceeded my expectations as far as being a dump. It is very low class & located directly across from Circus Circus. We stayed in room #1068, but you couldn't tell since the #8 had fallen off the door. The Riviera is located at the end of the strip and not very convenient to anything. As you walk throughout the hotel you can tell that its become so abandoned. Spaces that once occupied a store or an attraction are now closed. Our room overlooked a portion of the roof, and it looks as though one time there was a rooftop pool, and its now empty and dirty. All amenities are outdated, and our room was below average, not even a flatscreen tv in the room. The Casino area is dark, old-fashioned and stinky. While I understand that smoking is permitted other hotels have done a great job of keeping the stink down to a minimum. Not to mention that nothing in the hotel looks like it has been cleaned since the 1980's. I contacted the spa a week before our trip to make an appointment for a massage. I was told that reservations were not needed & to just call before coming. I called upon arrival and was told there was no availability for the entire weekend. The pool area was fair, however it should not be considered in any sense as nice. There were so many children splashing and driving it was impossible to relax. The hotel also had a Midget Wrestling Show that weekend...the Midgets had a Cabana and one, who said his name was Rod, was very harassing. Made crude sexual remarks and was very persistent, we ended up leaving. The food at the buffet was greasy & disgusting. Memorable Staff... Kelly with the blonde hair standing at the Guest Services Counter in the registration area...thank you for your awful demeanor and snotty attitude. Your dirty looks and unhelpful service was not at all appreciated. The moral of the story is nothing in Vegas is budget friendly. I recommend spending an extra $70 or $80 a night & staying at the Stratosphere down the street, whatever you do don't waste your money on this deplorable dump ! According to our taxi driver, the Riviera has been in the negative earnings the last few quarters & will most likely be closing soon...lets hope that is true...good riddance to you Riviera Casino !

Reviews.Title: “fabulous hotel but at the wrong end of the strip”
Reviews.Author: hmchiswell56
Reviews.Content: Great hotel but unfortunately this end of the strip seems to be disappearing as they are pulling down old hotels and not rebuilding therefore it is very quiet and a bit depressing. Room: we had a lovely room overlooking the pool, the room was large with a flat screen TV that had lots of free channnels, we had a queen size bed that was very comfortable as well as a fridge which is a bonus when the temparature is 115 degrees outside! Bathroom: large with power shower - lovely and clean with good quality complimentry toilitries. Food: we were room only but ate on several ocassions in Kady's coffee shop which is probably my favorite eating house in Las Vegas! the staff are fantastic nothing is too much trouble for them, the restaurant is clean and comfortable with huge windows overlooking the pool, the food is tasty with plenty of it and is reasonably priced. The hotel has bars and shops but as I said earlier it is now on a very quiet part of the strip due to hotels being closed. It is a clean hotel with pleasant staff and still has lots to offer especially to those on a budget

Reviews.Title: “Not bad if you're not there to relax”
Reviews.Author: Penny B
Reviews.Content: I went there for a quick inexpensive trip. Only there during the night and one day at the pool. The pool was quiet and clean. The Bar by the pool had a really cool older bartender working there. Can't remember his name. They were remodeling a bunch so not much to do inside. the little restraunt by the pool had good breakfast. Great waitress. The tower by the pool was old but still felt ok staying in the room. I know they are remodeling so dont' stay in that tower until it's done. The front desk was not so pleasant as the rest of the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent rooms and good value”
Reviews.Author: gpholtonk
Reviews.Content: I booked a single night here and spent the rest at MGM Grand. Although the public areas in Riviera are a bit shabby in comparison, the rooms are much better both in cleanliness and furnishings. This isn't a family hotel, the pool for example is spartan, but the in-hotel prices are lower, the range of things you can get in the hotel is better, and the range of eating experiences is reasonably comparable. Worst thing is the check-in. I know Americans love queues and manage to create them everywhere, but there really is no need to operate 11 check-in desks with 3 staff and a 30 metre queue.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed there our last 3 trips.”
Reviews.Author: JFFTraverseCity
Reviews.Content: We enjoy staying at the north end of the strip, and the Riv always gives us a great deal. Even though they were booked solid for most of our stay, they upgraded us to a mini suite that was very nice. They also have been updating and remodeling the place. New restaurant opened and a new sports book was being constructed. All restaurants are very good.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't want to stay anywhere else”
Reviews.Author: H M
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Riv several times and love it here. The service is exceptional in most cases. Some of the staff even remember us from year to year. I especially have a soft spot for Pepe the bellhop, he is a sweetheart.I don't understand how people can complain about the smallest things, like I found a hair in the sink or a crack in the door, etc. You are here to enjoy yourselves. CHILL! Also, when they say there are no amenities, that means you obviously don't gamble at all. We play a lot of slots, but just the penny slots. We don't spend thousands of dollars like high rollers, but they don't care if you're playing pennies or dollars, just so long as you're playing and using your players card. You can get room comps, show tickets,free buffets, and free slot play. The rooms are clean and comfortable and have great beds. Yes, there's less traffic at this end of the strip now, but we like that. Can only take so much bustling with the crowds. The casino is spacious and although does get busy at times is never over crowded. There are plenty of places to eat, and enough choices to satisfy everyone's tastes. The ABC store is very handy for every day stuff and if they don't have something you want, there is a Walgreen's just down the street. I love the old style Vegas atmosphere that they are trying to preserve while at the same time doing more and more updates all the time. When we were there in May, they were just starting a bunch of renovations, and we can't wait to see it all when we come back next spring. If you want to stay at a great affordable place for a relaxing holiday this is your place.

Reviews.Title: “Reservations mean NOTHING!”
Reviews.Author: SCLdyRebel
Reviews.Content: We had a CONFIRMATION number for a room with two queen beds. Imagine our surprise when we got there and were told we had a KING size bed for 4 people!!!! I told them they had made a mistake, we were CONFIRMED for a room with 2 beds. We were told by the desk clerk and 3 managers that a reservation only means you have a ROOM not that you get what you reserved!!!! The room was decent, but once you added a small roll a way and two adults had to sleep on that. The casino and adjacent rooms could all use a makeover. Cigarette smoke was horrible, obviously they have poor ventilation. While the staff was respectfull, I wouldn't go so far as to say helpful at all. I would avoid this property... there are so many other NICER options where I'm sure a CONFIRMATION of a RESERVATION means you get what you asked for!

Reviews.Title: “It wasn't the best of times it wasn't the worst.”
Reviews.Author: Christopher W
Reviews.Content: Well after reading some of these reviews I can only cringe at the thought of it happening to me. Unfortunately with all my being I believe them considering my own stay. I was in Vegas for a pool tournament. I stayed in the Monaco Towers during the tournament. The room, was spacious enough and clean. My bed was nice and housekeeping came by daily. Bathroom was clean and generally all around good service there. The staff was genuinely responsive and helpful with a couple of exceptions. During the tournament we couldn't bring beverages into the convention center unless they were bought at ONE stand. At any given moment the room was filled with at least 500-1000 people. All being serviced, by one stand with two people? Ridiculous. It's a convention center there should have been multiple stands or servers but it was horrid. This was a management issue, the next day it looked like they found a hit woman to start helping and things started to get better. Whoever that small woman is.. she needs a raise. There is a lot of smoking at the Rivieria. Not such a big deal if it wasn't EVERYWHERE even as a smoker you want to take a break sometimes. It's hard to find that at the Riviera for sure. The diner was ok but I find that service at the Rivieria is very, very basic and considering the other venues in Vegas it is surely lacking. However, considering rooms are cheap and I was actually rather busy trying to play in a tournament it did the job. Would I stay here again though? Probably not.. I just rather spend a little extra for great service.

Reviews.Title: “Worst stay ever--avoid at all costs!!!”
Reviews.Author: TravShopPolGirl
Reviews.Content: Took over 45 mins to check in at 10pm at night. When we finally made it to our room, the room had not been cleaned after the prior guest and was absolutely filthy. Called the front desk, but no one would answer the phone. Had to go back to check-in area to demand a new room. Finally got into new room around 12am--all his while traveling with a 1 year-old and a 4 year-old. Bathroom in new room had gross hair left in it. So disgusting. Self check-out next morning did not work and front desk still would not answer the phone. Demanded full refund, which was eventually given--after a fight. Stay away. If looking for a cheap room on the Strip, try the Excalibur. Standard rooms, but clean, and they actually provide decent customer service, unlike this awful place.

Reviews.Title: “It was a great stay!”
Reviews.Author: YvonneB_71
Reviews.Content: Even though this is an older casino, the rooms have been updated so it isn't a bad place to stay. The staff is friendly, and very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “great room”
Reviews.Author: Shore-Club-Hotel
Reviews.Content: I drove into town and was looking for a cheap clean room. I used my hotelpal application on my IPHONE and discovered the rate was $32 for the night. I then checked trip advisor and found mixed reviews. It seemed the great reviews came from those guests staying in the remodeled rooms. Withing 15 minutes I was checking in and requested a smoke free room. I was assisted by Maria at front desk who was very friendly and kind. She explained she was giving me a room in the remodeled tower which I believe is the Monaco. My room was in excellent condition, large king size bed, duvet bed cover, flat screen tv, granite countertop in the bathroom, dark wood furnishings and cold a/c. The room view was decent and the bed was very comfortable. Parking was free and no hassle. The public areas are a little dated but are in fair condition. It exceeded my expectation. Thanks

Reviews.Title: “OMG”
Reviews.Author: Sensitivewoman
Reviews.Content: Checking was awful almost 1 hour wait . only 2 clerks behind the counter. The room looked like motel 6 - sink was stopped up. The bed was busted very uncomfortable. I made a complaint and guess what i was told, you pay for what you get . What a thing to say to a customer. Never again will i stay at the Classic Riviera

Reviews.Title: “Leave your nose-ring at home and you'll have a great time!”
Reviews.Author: DidiSacramento_CA
Reviews.Content: The point is this place is not for the easily-fooled or easily-led! More later on that...This place is glitzy and huge!. The elevator in the parking garage, however, is disgusting, old, hot, and a little scary! You would think with all the money the casino makes they could fix that... on the brighter side, there are cameras and an intercom in the elevators. Walking from the parking garage to check-in through a maze of shops, restaurants, and the casino took several minutes as self parking is quite far from check-in, but I was told that will change when the re-modeling is finished. They were in the process of remodeling some areas of the building to add a bingo room and fix or change some other stuff. It was 6pm on a Sunday night and there was a line about 100+ people waiting to check in. I was tired from a 9-hour drive and trying very hard to find the humor in it, but just about all the people waiting looked very unhappy. The good news is I found out most of them could have used the express check-in computers but didn't know it. I tried it and it worked like a charm! Got 2 keys and all the receipts, info, and discount tickets from the machine within a couple of minutes! My room was very clean and the beds were quite comfy. The only thing missing was a fridge, or at the very least it could have had in-room coffee! The view from my 7th floor window would have been better if the outside of the windows was clean, but it was best at night with all the lights from Circus Circus and the surrounding buildings lit up. Oh, and the fitness room and Spa was completely non-operational. No massage people and they were re-modeling the fitness room - a disappointment there! There are a couple of vacation kiosks in which hungry timeshare salespeople will grab you as you walk by with offers of free shows and free dinners if you agree to listen to a 90-minute presentation. Go ahead if you want...the comedy show i saw was great. (Lucky for me it was part a package deal so i didn't have to listen to a presentation.) They also offer what they claim is the best topless show in Vegas... (If you want to buy a timeshare, i would suggest checking out resales first because they tend to be 1/2 the cost of what you pay from the developer.) One kiosk on the way from the parking to casino/hotel is well worth stopping at if you're a smoker...the e-cigarette place offers a free try and some great deals on electronic cigarettes to satisfy your smoking needs in even the most taboo of places. One girl who worked there all 3 days i was there was extremely helpful and very nice to talk to as well! Check-out was the same as check-in: Long line of people waiting, almost no one using the computers. I used the computer and checked out within 2-3 minutes, and noticed people lining up for them shortly after that.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly fine hotel”
Reviews.Author: WorcestershireNomad
Reviews.Content: This was my 10th visit to Vegas,and 2nd stay at The Riviera. the Riviera is an older style hotel and it meets all my needs.I am quite happy staying at a hotel like this or Circus Circus as it is spacious,clean,affordable and has plenty of character. Rather than splash out extra on rooms at the Wynn or Bellagio I would rather have extra spending money and pay less for the room.The Riviera is great.admittedly it is somewhat north of a lot of the sites but there is the monorail at The Hilton so if you want to go to the southern part of the strip and are too tired to walk you can jump on there for a few dollars. Personally I cant understand why people bother spending so much more on a room 10 minutes further down the strip.The Riviera is a smaller hotel,but is still 20 times bigger than most hotels in England. There is an English styled pub inside,which isn't very authentic but they have a Darts and pool room round the back.It is expensive and the food is just average to be honest. the showroom is pretty good there too.We saw a Karaoke show, a Rat pack impression show and a Motown show..all very good.When we walked out of the Motown show I came face to face with ex Heavyweight Champion Evander Holyfield who had been sat behind me..we had a photo and a chat with him so we were all quite happy about that! I would recommend this hotel to anyone.Rooms are fine,the buffett is great and the shows are ok too..the only downside is it is a bit of a walk to the Centre of the strip. But if walking is a problem for you then you shouldn't be in Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “Very Comfortable and lots to do”
Reviews.Author: jewelrydiva247
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Riviera for 2 nights before and after our California vacatiion. The hotel was huge and very well maintained and the rooms were clean and the showers were great! We also loved the casinos and also enjoyed the English Pub there. The pool was huge and nice atmosphere. For the price this hotel was definitely a great value.

Reviews.Title: “First and Last”
Reviews.Author: chugito23
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Vegas and we picked the Riviera Hotel and Casino for our 2 night stay....BAD IDEA! When we arrived all we wanted to do was check in to our room and get some rest....it took us about a hour to get through the check in line, once we got to the counter Joyce was assisting us. She was very polite when she informed us that our reservations were not in the system....we had to call vegas.com to have them fax our info, After another hour of waiting and faxing we finally got our room.....Not even a upgraded room or a apology. Now the room....I dont like to complain but I feel i need to this time. The room has a weird smell, the bed had hair on it, one of the hinges on the bathroom door was broke, the hinge on the front door was broke, and the housekeeping was horrible. We slept friday night , then Saturday we went for some breakfast and a strole down the strip, we returned about 4 hours later to our room still dirty. We called housekeeping and informed them she said they would send someone right up so we decided to go grab some 6:30 P.M!!! For what we paid for the 2 nights I expected better customer service and a cleaner room. We really considered changing hotels after the first night but we had already paid for this one. All in all if you can get past the smelly dirty elevators, smoke filled hallways and rooms, and food that I don't see how people could possibly eat then its perfect for you. I will consider staying here again once all the remodeling is completed.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Nicole N
Reviews.Content: Checking into the hotel took an hour and a half. Maybe they were understaffed? Either way that was extremely frustrating taking that long to get checked in. The location is terrible. Clear at the end of the strip. So if you wanted to go to the main part of the strip you better hop onto a bus or take a taxi. The rooms weren't special at all. Surprising because this is vegas you would think hotels would do anything to compete with each other. Beds were comfortable at least and it wasn't that it was dirty its just not as nice as I would have expected. If you're looking for some entertainment, again nothing special at this hotel. They have a pool with a live dj playing which was pretty cool. The only other entertainment was half naked chicks dancing on a pole in the casino during the night time. This hotel is cheap but I guess you get what you pay for!

Reviews.Title: “Little to enjoy at this has-been hotel”
Reviews.Author: Phen17
Reviews.Content: We received a three night hotel stay at the Riviera from a time share company. Even though the stay was free, my husband and I considered checking out each day due to the poor conditions of the room. We were originally checked into a room that had been used. There were price tags on the bed, hair on the table, the pillows on one bed were set up against the wall like someone had been lounging, there was trash in the trash can (including feminine products) and towels on the floor in the bathroom. I was disgusted and immediately called the front desk. They moved us to another room that was larger and, most importantly, clean. We were still not thrilled with the accommodations though. The entire floor smelled of water damage and the room itself was in need of renovations. I tried to focus on the fact that the Riv is a piece of Vegas history so that I wouldn't be terribly upset. We will not stay at the Riv again and wish we would have known that the rooms were in such poor shape.

Reviews.Title: “Ugh.”
Reviews.Author: PasqualWisdom
Reviews.Content: My wife took me along while she attended her three day conference at Riviera. Sports book (my favorite Vegas activity) was closed for construction. Slots and video poker were a money drain. There really isn't anything within a mile's walk other than the aptly named Circus Circus across the street. Had to be alert walking around so I wouldn't trip over the thousands of children. Since when do people bring toddlers to Vegas? Seriously. Wish we would've spent a little more and stayed somewhere else. On the bright side, the bed was decent. Although, the hotel doesn't allow the A/C to get cool enough for you to sleep comfortably.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap is it's only good feature!”
Reviews.Author: pinkba
Reviews.Content: If you stay here you have to get one of it's remodeled rooms, because if not then it's just not worth it. Everything is old, and kind of ugly. On our way from the lobby to our room we had to go through "under construction" spots, with workers and everything. The buffet is super ooooooverprized even though it is like 15 dolars! Stay here only if you cannot afford anything else, as we did at the time!

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and creapy”
Reviews.Author: jacksonlii714
Reviews.Content: Looks nice from the strip until you actually walk inside. The odor of the hotel will make you have an asthma attack. The corridor where the so called guest room is located is so dark that if I was a would be robber, this is the place to hang out. Although the room rates was cheap, under $50 for us, Do your self a favor, spend a little more and get a more decent place to hit the sack at.

Reviews.Title: “An underrated hotel, well worth a visit”
Reviews.Author: Lee C
Reviews.Content: In preparation for this holiday, I read a lot of reviews about the Riviera. The reviews seemed a real mixed bag, and I was unsure about whether it was a great idea to stay at the Riviera, as we have stayed at the MGM Grand and New York New York, quite swanky, very clean, super efficient, if a little soulless. But we went ahead with our booking, as the price was great, and we hadn't visited the top of the Strip properly on previous visits. One of the things we had read was that check in time was long. We didn't have to wait more than 10 minutes. When we got to the desk, the guy behind there was lovely, and upgraded us to the Monaco tower for no extra charge. Lovely. The room was smart and comfortable. We had to call housekeeping to clean and tidy because someone had just left. Housekeeping visited while we played the machines downstairs, and when we returned, the room looked great. The bed was super comfy and there was plenty of room. We signed up for the players card, and because of this we were entitled to a free buffet! The buffet at the Riviera is good, it's not the swankiest of places, but the choice was good and we enjoyed the food. I would recommend joining the players club for the buffet. The casino is one of the smaller casinos on the Strip, but it was a lovely casino with character. Some of the other casinos (e.g. Planet Hollywood) are a bit soulless, others (e.g. Circus Circus) are a bit grim and full of kids! Riviera casino was a lovely friendly place, and I think you need to have a good look around. On the last couple of days, we realised the casino was bigger than we first thought! I think I would have liked to have been offered more cocktails, but hey, I could see the waitresses walking around the place, they really do work their socks off. We had breakfast most days at Kady's Cafe. The staff there are lovely! Quite characterful, polite and amusing. We liked Patty, she was friendly and super helpful. The food was reasonably priced and the coffee was spot on! Being quite far north on the Strip, you do have to walk or get the monorail from the Hilton to get to places. Something I've noticed people moan about is that you have to do this! Use google maps, lazy people, to work out where the hotel is, doh! Honestly! We didn't mind that it took a bit of effort to get to other places, and we discovered that the Hilton has a nice casino and buffet, and the Wynn, has a fabulous casino, buffet and players reward card. We would not have visited these places if we had stayed elsewhere. If, like us, you've stayed in Vegas at the larger, characterless hotels on the south of the Strip, and you're looking for something different, try the Riviera. We loved it!

Reviews.Title: “We loved it!”
Reviews.Author: kellyg101
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the riviera from 3rd to 8th aug, i was worried after reading the reviews but was pleasently suprised and loved every minute we had there. i would say dont always believe what you read! people have different perceptions of places. i had never been to vegas to staying here was really nice! however if i had stayed somewhere like ceasers first then i probably wouldnt be saying the same sort of things. the reviews about check in however are correct - we only had to wait about half hour but i saw it much worse on other days! the hotel was clean. we had a room in the newly refurbished block. we were even upgraded for free becuase it was my 21st birthday.it was always clean. the pool area was clean and always busy. the casino isnt as good as other but the minumum bet is much cheaper and the staff are so lovely! they made our holiday! the queen vic pub is great although not very cheap. the buffet was brilliant - we used our free tickets there and there was so much choice in food - chinese, mexican, roast dinners, italian, lots of puddings! you cant go wrong. kadys coffee bar was ok...not the best to be honest! and sadly christophers was being refurbished - people cant complain its being refurbished - they have to do it at somepoint! people wouold complain more if it was old and tatty! although not in the centre of the strip - we walked down to the other casinos - its not that far away. excpet if you want to go down as far as luxor and excalibar etc. i would stay here again! it wasnt bad. its just not as good as ceasers or the ballagio!

Reviews.Title: “Our first stay and our last stay”
Reviews.Author: daisydollar
Reviews.Content: It took over two hours just to check into this hotel !!! They had only three clerks working the check ins and when we got to the front of the line and were next to check in, one of the clerks closed her window and took a break !!! Unbelievable !!! The only good thing about our stay was the bed. The bed was great. The walls are tissue paper thin and you can hear everything going on in the next room. The pool and cabana areas were good. The buffet was horrible and way over-priced. If you like to look out of the windows at the strip, good luck, the windows were so dirty that you could hardly see out at all. We would not stay here again, even if the rooms were FREE.

Reviews.Title: “I can't recommend this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: elkhnd
Reviews.Content: On the plus side the price was (almost) right, but the "resort fee" eliminates that argument. Resort fee for a pool? I will say the staff was pleasant, and the buffet (not the free chinese buffet) wasn't bad for the price but because of the following I cannot recommend this hotel: - check in lines, awful (1 hour plus), only 3 people working counter. I reserved a smoking room, was given a non smoking room, but was too tired to argue. - location, surrounded by empty lots/ half completed construction projects, if you are looking for a reasonable priced hotel closer to "action" stay at Ballys or the Flamingo. - You'll see adverts for a free buffet if you join their Riviera Club, this was for the Chinese Buffet, but when I went there literally all but one of the steam trays was empty ... a free ticket to a chinese buffet that had nothing left but a few egg rolls and some old lo mein. - a lot of construction in the hotel, and some flagrant OSHA violations; tiles being cut by people who did not have eye protection, no screens to keep the dust from affecting hotel guests who were walking by. I do like the Queen Victoria Pub, but again I just can't recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Many newer properties along the strip”
Reviews.Author: Cher_711
Reviews.Content: Check-in queue was ridiculously long (fortunately i checked-in with a group which was much faster)... Room was minimalistic and dated. Prob needs some re-furbishing... hotel was located off the strip so location will not be ideal for those who are looking to be in the midst of all the excitement... Casino was so-so.. but after visiting the casino at Wynn, the one at Riviera was definitely outdated..

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms but SHADY billing practices. Beware!”
Reviews.Author: TravisLaird
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through Orbitz from the UK. The room was fine but a little small. I paid online but when I went to check in there was an additional $40.00 charge. When I asked what the charge was for I was told for "other activities" and amenities. The receptionists showed me a sheet with all of the "special offers" I was entitled to for the $40.00. I could buy one beer and get another free at the pub... if I spent $50 on this or that service I would get another $10 worth of the service for free. All gimmicks to get me to spend more money at the hotel. The receptionist was VERY RUDE and told me that I should have read the fine print in terms and conditions. With all of the other hotels on and around the Vegas strip, I'll never stay here again. If the Riviera had rolled these fees into the initial cost I feel I could have then made a decision on whether I wanted to stay here or not. I just don't appreciate underhanded/sneaky tactics.

Reviews.Title: “Improving and only getting better”
Reviews.Author: Flyboy85
Reviews.Content: After my last stay at this hotel, I was not impressed. However when I heard that there was new ownership, I decided to give them another chance. Now I got here at about 9:30 on a Tuesday night. In fact, I am in my room as I 8write this. Checking in was fast ans easy. I got the room I had wanted, and it was spotless. Every employee has been extremely polite and courteous toward me. They are remodeling so some or the restaurants are closed. The buffet is better then it was, although I would like it better if they used real eggs in the omelettes. My only issue so far this trip is that I booked the room on a comp, ans the e-mail said free show tickets too. What I did not know was that in VERY small print, it said there was a play requirement. To meet this requirement, you need to play much, much more then even VIP tickets cost, so I am a little upset about that, but considering that the tickets are still less then $60, I'll buy them on my own. All in all, I am pleased with the Riviera and would just like to know where in the casino some of these new games are

Reviews.Title: “2.5 hours in line to check in, always no matter what time of day.”
Reviews.Author: jnjess
Reviews.Content: It takes 2.5 hours to check in. They have a line out the door at all hours. The people at the desk once you get there are rude about it. I have stayed at the Luxor, and Stratosphere both were way better than this dump. The pool smells and had stuff floating in it. It had no party scene at all. I contacted them by email to let them know dissatisfied I was and I got no response. The worst place ever.

Reviews.Title: “Only if it's cheap.”
Reviews.Author: herbert_eins
Reviews.Content: The rivieira was quite disappointing. There was an endless line for the check in (took as 45 minutes), the room was extremely hot and the towels were dirty. Just go there, if you want to save money.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: morten505
Reviews.Content: The Riviera is the worst hotel experience I had while traveling. I was not expecting something exceptional given the price, but I still expect something clean and acceptable. Far from it! First, we had to wait 50 minutes before getting our keys when we arrived. After all this time, we learned that the non-smoking Premier room we had booked was no longer available and the only room available was a smoking oasis room by the pool. The room stank of cigarettes and was so old and ugly. The cleanliness of the bathroom was poor. A very loud party was held in the pool until the morning. I do not recommend this hotel to my worst enemy. It is not surprising that this hotel is in financial trouble in recent years.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: Summertime4me
Reviews.Content: My family and I just got back from the Riviera. The hotel is a great value. The rooms in the MEDITERRANEAN NORTH tower are very nice also .I guess they were recently remodeled. The beds were very comfy and the room was vey clean. Nice TV I guess because I really don't care about stuff like that. You are not on vacation to watch TV anyway. We stayed here because it is one of the few remaining classic hotel which I love not like these new modern ones. However the smoke in the casinos can get to you the other casinos don't seem to be as smokey maybe the ventilation is better. Food court was nice and so was Kadys. However it was not open 24hours. The area of that end seems to be changing a bit. Over all our trip to the Riviera was enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “It was everything we expected and more”
Reviews.Author: Lerim
Reviews.Content: I was a little apprehensive on this trip to Las Vegas, with the new ownership and changes to staff. I have to admit I was pleasantly surprised at all of the positive changes along with the comfort of our "home away from home" atmosphere we always experience. The staff were "friendlier" if that was even possible and the service was excellent. The rooms were absolutely fantastic! They were clean and fresh and were always attended to by kind and courteous staff. I am looking forward to my next trip in February or March 2012!

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected. Give the ole girl a try... Retro Cool”
Reviews.Author: ItShowtime
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Riv the last week of July 2011. We were staying for a roller derby convention. As a savy consumer I kept watching reviews and was quite frankly getting a little nervous as so many people were pointing out all these negative things.... Well, much to out surprise it was an ok place to be.... So lets breat the trip down by the numbers. Flight in .. On time Luggage .. all in one piece with nothing missing Shuttle .. We used Executive. You get it on the airport property and they pick up and drop off at your hotel. Much Cheaper than a cab. $11.00 round trip for each of us. Arrival at the Riviera .. Earlier than check in. Bellhop met us at the door. Took our luggage and gave us a stub. No fuss, no worries. Advised us that they start early check in around 1230. Walking thru the casino .. A slight smell of smoke in the air.... However It is one of the oldest casinos in the city with a rich history.. I am fairly sensitive to cigarette smoke and it was NOT strong enough to be a bother. We arrived on a monday morning and it wasn't very busy. Yes some of the staff looked a little bored but hey they're human too.... Not much going on... chill We came out to the front of the casino across from Slots O Fun and Circus Circus. Opting to walk across and check out the casino's across the street just for fun. Circus Circus is very....... crowded. Signing up for players cards is of course quick and easy. Lunch at Rock N Ritas. not a bad place but to me the food was a little bland... (full disclosure I like some zing to my food). The pina colada my wife had was apparently a-ok! A quick walk back across the street and a line had formed for check in. Yes if you've read the reviews there is a wait to check in... However there is a wait at most LV hotels. That's the nature of the beast. Get over it, strike up a conversation with the people around you and chill. We checked in and was reassigned (by choice) to the Monaco tower. If you've read prior reviews this is the most up to date tower. It's nice. I recommend it (more in a bit). Bellhop service friendly and efficient (don't forget to tip). ROOM .. Our room was a normal hotel room sized king room. Bathroom small but efficient. Closet decent sized. Carpet, some wear but servicable. Bed comfy Serta. Tv, flat screen (32 inch maybe) countertops were marble and there is a refridgerator. The view was facing the pool and towards Las Vegas Blvd. They do offer room service. Things to know and to be warned of. They charge a "resort fee" (7 something a day per room). There is a safe in the room but they charge you a daily fee if you use it.. ($3.88). Yes they are nickel and dime fees but not too bad. Housecleaning staff .. quiet and efficient. (there is a tip envelope when you first come in, toss em $5.00 as a thanks for their often unappreciated hard work!) Food on site .. Various choices. A buffett (I didnt try it as there were so many bad comments, though you get a free buffet when you sign up for the players card. (A friend gave a specific and non repeatable comment about the poor taste of breakfast buffet.) Kadys .. Pretty good. I had a cheesesteak, my party had a french dip and the other a member had the meatloaf which looked, smelled and tasted awesome! There was a small deli area that I didn't try Off the the south of the casino (still inside, up a few steps and around the corner) is a food court. Jackpot inexpensive food right on site. The shops included, Indian, Burgers, Cheesesteak, Chinese, Wings, Pizza and mexican. The Cheesesteaks Etc offer a $5.99 breakfast special of a 3 egg omelett, toast, hash browns and side meat (bacon or ham) and a drink. Good solid way to start the day. (cheesesteaks were good too). Things to do.... You are in Vegas... there are unimaginable things to do. OK Get your Duece Pass (it's a double decker bus that runs up and down the strip and to other places in Vegas. Go to Freemont Street (old Vegas) . Go to Binions and get your free picture with $1,000,000.00 No fee. Walk up they take and print out the shot! Ride the zipline almost 2 blocks above Freemont. Hungry? Go to the 4 Queens. Sign up for their players club and take the coupon (2 for 1)to Magnolia Verandas. A $9.95 10 ounce prime rib with soup or salad (excellent gumbo) baked potato and carrots. Throw in a couple of sodas and you've spent less than 20 bucks and are WELL fed. Hop back on the Duece, Get off at Hoover St and walk a block to go to the world famous Gold and Silver Pawn shop (where they film Pawn Stars). Vegas is an interesting city. Lots to do from free to pay as you visit. Mix it up. I liked the Atomic Testing Museum. My wife enjoyed the Coke and M+M Stores. Our companion enjoyed the aquariums. Oh, fair warning if your easily offended there are card flippers along the strip. They hand out cards with less than fully clothed females that can come to your room. And there are newspaper racks of "services magazines". So shield their eyes and keep walking if the little ones are with you.... Oh and if you've read down to this part one last tip... Swing by and get your hair cut by Elvis (yes as in Presley) . Inside the Riv....... Only in Vegas!!

Reviews.Title: “You may think it a VINTAGE hotel, but the accomodations were AWESOME!”
Reviews.Author: beatkeeper07
Reviews.Content: The service from staff, including waitstaff, desk and parking attendants was great. I really liked the room...in fact I had stayed here one year before..at that time they had just been updated with new furnishings and TVs... It remains a well kept, clean and cumfortable casino hotel! The location is within a short walk to the middle of the strip. An all-around great value.

Reviews.Title: “Very Mixed”
Reviews.Author: AGKPDX
Reviews.Content: I have only one positive thing to say about a 3 night stay. For the price the remodelled rooms are OK. Service is very slow---check in lines are very long and slow--why all the people want to stay here is not clear. True other hotels have check in waits--but Riviers's is way too long. Only place to eat where there was acceptable service was the British Pub. Coffee shop needs major management change. Servers just did not know what to do. Buffet was way overcrowded --probably because hotel gave a free buffet visit if you signed up for the hotel Players Club---result was long delays. Was told that they was a new owner--good luck.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, a little bit away from the action though!”
Reviews.Author: prchic164
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a pool tournament with my team. The hotel is absolutely huge and the convention rooms looked amazing. We got in a little late and they were so overbooked they allowed us to stay in a suite for the night. The next day the front desk allowed us to stay in the suite for the rest of our stay!!! AWESOME!! The pool was nice and the gambling was fun. You are directly across from Circus Circus and a place to play $1 black jack on the strip. Other than that you are pretty far away from the action but if you don't mind walking it is not so bad. Would stay here again =)

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: CrystalDuncan
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my four night stay at the Riviera Hotel and Casino in Las Vegas, Nevada. Pros of the property included a prompt check in and friendly staff. I stayed in the newer Monaco Tower. When I arrived to my room, it was clean, spacious and the bed was soft and comfortable. I absolutely loved my 32" flat screen TV, large closet space and mini fridge with the wet bar. Housekeeping cleaned my room daily and always replenished my towels. There was an abundant food selection including a food court, a buffet and a Victorian pub with live music. Kristopher's steak house was closed for renovations. The pool was large, inviting and extremely refreshing after a hot day on the strip. The DJ kept the atmosphere at the pool upbeat, the music was modern and not too loud. I also liked the fact they had a lifeguard on duty at all times, as well as friendly cocktail waitresses serving drinks poolside. The property also offered several shows including the Rat Pack and Crazy Girls. The Casino had several games to choose from and the dealers were all extremely funny and entertaining. The ABC store really came in handy for my everyday needs, and the prices were reasonable. There was also a beauty shop, tattoo parlor and a wedding chapel. The deuce bus was a great way to get around the strip for a reasonable price. The bus pass was $5.00 and you could pay $2.00 more to upgrade to the 24 hour pass. I would suggest the bus if you plan on doing any sightseeing. The bus is also conveniently located in front of the hotel. Overall I was very happy with my experience and would recommend this property to all of my friends and family!

Reviews.Title: “Hate it and will NEVER return!!!”
Reviews.Author: sexxi_lady87
Reviews.Content: The madness started from the moment I checked in. 2 hours later I was finally at the front of the line and sent to a stale, musty room. I called downstairs and immediately requested a room change, which took an additional 45 minutes. My stay was for 4 nights and on my 3rd I was accompanied by a hefty, disgusting bedbug crawling across my comforter. I called down, they filed a report, took the bug in a specimen cup, and changed my room...then nothing! I expected some sort of apology, compensation, etc. They claimed that they inspected the room and found no more bugs so they are not at fault...what??! I couldn't believe it. I've spoken to managers and even wrote on their facebook page. They deleted my post 3 times!!! They're service is horrible. I've stayed there MANY times before and loved it. I heard ownership or something was changed. Whatever the case, I will never again in life patronize that hotel or casino!

Reviews.Title: “Won't be returning.”
Reviews.Author: Mrdbake
Reviews.Content: I did not like this hotel and felt robbed by the "Resort" fee. I would not classify this as a resort. Service: 4. There was a long line at check in and one of the clerks announced she was going on break. I understand it's a "Union" town but, come on! Cleanliness:3. The room was old and the bathroom looked like it was modeled after a truck stop restroom. A used truck stop restroom.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Be Afraid of the Riviera”
Reviews.Author: jltt
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Riviera for 2 nights during the 4th of July weekend. We were comped our room by calling and giving another player's card information. Being that we arrived late on Saturday night we were not able to get the type of room we requested but were offered a roll a way at no extra charge. We were barely in our room when housekeeping arrived with it. It was comparable to sleeping on a twin size bed....very comfortable. The check in line was long and somewhat slow the front end employee that assisted us was extremely friendly. The room was of average size but clean and comfortable. The bathroom was very large. The only problem we encountered was the shower did not work but the next morning we were moved to a new room with no problems. The pool area was very nice. On the outside marquee they were advertising $25 a night rate. We would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “i would avoid this hotel”
Reviews.Author: ARCADE82
Reviews.Content: we stayed here for 4 nights and days and our rooms were not cleaned properly. when your paying $100 a night you would expect the room to be cleaned up but this was not the case. when we called the maid service they lied and said we had put a do not disturp sign. this was not true. check in is etremely slow and we had to wait an hour. i would look for other hotels next time i stay

Reviews.Title: “DON'T WAST YOUR MONEY”
Reviews.Author: nickbERT
Reviews.Content: Was quoted 1 price for the room, then when we got there at Wed just before midnight, after waiting in line for over 40 minutes to check in, we were told that they were adding a resort FEE that was never mentioned, and gave us a black and white paper of things it covers, I.E. ___ Cabanas at the pool (Starting AT $200, still cost minimum $200. ) , Free Slot Play, which we did not receive, because we were told that they discontinued it the day before.) Free Local & 800 Calls, at a value of $1.00 each, --- ( Really a local call is a $1.00 value, please.), Also we booked a smoking room but were told it was not available we had to take a non smoking room, and there is a $250 charge if you smoke in it. May be it is the $9.00 Club sandwich which comes ala carte or all alone, fries like $2.50 extra,) soda like $2.00 something, or the $9.95 pancake and eggs breakfast , and the buffet prices are out of control for the below average food they provide, compared to other casinos in the area. I would have just paid extra to stay at a better casino if the resort fees were disclosed when we reserved the room, but they quote 1 price, and charge another when you arrive. Just plain deceitful, We brought my mom who booked her own room, and she is on a very fixed income so getting a room deal was important for her too, but all i can say is after years of coming here, DONT GO HERE, we Will Not Return, Oh and now a $20 pluss fee if you check out late. For a deal stay at Terribles, the cafe there rocks, $4.99 for a Buffalo burger, angus burger, or chix breast sandwich, $9.99 for a full rack of baby back ribs the T-Bone steak was below average, but i would try the top sirloin nxt time it looked better, they offer a shuttle to the strip, Or stay on Freemont street, that was so much fun there, .

Reviews.Title: “unexpected good experiance”
Reviews.Author: badgers4life
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Riviera for 2 nights in July. Was comped both nights so I wasn't sure what my experience would be like. I was admit I was pleasantly surprised. A good staff and a fairly decent room. The only negative comment about the stay was the parking situation. This was due to the renovation of the main parking garage. Overall, I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden costs for normal amenities.”
Reviews.Author: TravelMeHere
Reviews.Content: After sitting in traffic for hours and showing up at midnight, we were told that we had been reserved for a smoking room. When I told them we couldn't handle that, they informed me its a $20 a night upgrade to be in the tower where smoking was prohibited. I was too tires to argue, so I agreed. On the day we were leaving, I asked about a late check out and was told that would cost an additional $25!? I have never heard of a fee for asking to check out an hour later. There were also additional fees that were charged to me card because the claim we didn't return our keys, which we dropped in the return box on our way out. For what I ended up paying, I should have stayed at a five star hotel. Not happy about that!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value on the Strip”
Reviews.Author: debbie73
Reviews.Content: The Riviera is old style vegas..its not the ritziest, its not the most modern...but it is friendly, clean, and an excellent value for money location at the South end of the strip. The rooms were a little outdated but they were cleaned daily. The facilities were excellent. The waitresses in the casino were very attentive - i dont think we ever had an empty glass. And for the guys - a trip to the celebrity hairdresser at the back of the casino is a must.....trust me for the entertainment factor alone the man is worth $40 for a haircut. The hotel is a bit isolated at the moment but its only a short walk to centre strip - I hope they dont rip this one down - it would be a shame to see it go the same way as the Stardust.

Reviews.Title: “Skeptical at first but loved it”
Reviews.Author: Bananna1215
Reviews.Content: Checked in July 17 2011 -July 22 hit all week on all the machines cocktail service was good speedy got comp buffet when signing up at club riviera got the whole week room comp for my steady play on machines and also got conked for 100$ kristopher steakhouse best steak I ever ate two of us ate with wine and dinner only wound up paying tip was great beautiful pool clean and the deuce bus was great way to get around resonable stop for bus right outside the hotel would def stay again slot of remodeling gOing in which is a good think kristophers us also closing for remoldeling can't wait for my next stay at the riviera

Reviews.Title: “"The check in was horrible"”
Reviews.Author: pennyterrell
Reviews.Content: The first room was ridiculous. The door to the refrigerator was broke, there was no remote to TV, the phone did not work. They quickly got us into another part of the hotel with a much nicer room. The check in line was insane. I took us over tow hours to check in. There was only 4 check-in clerks, on a Friday after 4:00 pm. This will make people not want to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the wait”
Reviews.Author: mahern77
Reviews.Content: 1 person working the front desk to check in and it was 1 1/2 hours in line to check in. Only 1 of the 3 self check in terminals was working.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: lizacollins72
Reviews.Content: The first time my husband and I went to the Riviera was last year. We ususally stay at the hotels at the southern tip of the strip because the hotels at the end are resonable. The fancy hotels at the center of the strip charge a $100 resort fee (per day) that is due apon arrival. Who want to spend $400 right off the bat? On the other hand, the Riviera charges a resort fee of less then $10 (per day) that is due once you check out. The rooms are not five star rooms but what do we care. We're only going to sleep there. The Riviera is one of the older hotels on the strip. So, if you want a hotel with resonable rates and a laid back atmosphere then stay at the Riviera. The staff was great and the rooms were very clean. With that being said, my husband and I will be going back to the Riviera this year for an sencond time. Oh yeah, here's another tip. If you can get an earlier flight you might get lucky and check in early. Our flight landed at 8am and we were able to check in and be in our room by 11am, and we were the only ones in line.

Reviews.Title: “Old, tired, overwelmed Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Freondude
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night. Waited for an hour in line just to check in to have the double bed room not avail except in a smoking room... which we didn't want. Check in desk staff was courteous and were apologetic of the wait. They really need more than 3 staff working the desk. No guest should wait more than a few min to check in. A rollabway bed was delivered to the room promptly and was surprisingly comfy. Our "upgraded" room was small compared to modern business class hotels that charge the same price. Loooong walk to get to room but I guess that how all the mega hotels are in Vegas with thousands of rooms. This hotel seemed like it hit it's peak back in the 70's and didn't remodel since then. There are definitely better choices.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for the price, but far away from the action”
Reviews.Author: ourfamof4
Reviews.Content: The hotel was relatively clean. The remodeled rooms do NOT look like the pictures. We specifically asked for a remodeled room upon check-in and were told we had one. The sink in the bathroom would drain so slowly that after we both washed our hands, it would be full for at least 10-20 minutes. That being said, the hotel itself was clean. The staff was friendly. If you're staying here just make sure to take advantage of the bus service that goes up and down the strip, they are air conditioned. It was the beginning of June when we went and it was in the 90s the entire time.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected!”
Reviews.Author: nicoleGoodyear_Az
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in Vegas for 3 nights July 13-16th. We spent 2 nights in Ballys (center strip) and 1 night at the Riviera. We havent stayed on the South End of the strip for a long time. Its not the best area for walking the strip. You are pretty limited to Riviera, Circus Circus and Slots of Fun. But the bus stop is right out front of Riviera so that is convenient. The room was nice and clean. Mediterranean North Tower was where we stayed. It was much nicer than I expected. For the price of the rooms, I would recommend this hotel. Just buy a daily bus pass and venture out that way. We only ate at Katy's and had breakfast. The service and food were excellent! We went to the Riviera Comedy Club. Got 2 for 1 tickets and it came out to $38.00 for the two of us. The show was good. The check in was long....like many others say. They did let us check in early. Probably around 12:30. The self check in kioks did not work like everyone warned. We went through the whole check in process and after swiping the credit card, etc. etc. it said that i couldnt complete the process. When we went to the check in line and waited a 1/2 hour or so, the lady said " I see you tried to check in with the kiosk ". So I dont know if it just didnt work because it was too early to check in? That would be my only complaint.

Reviews.Title: “Old and kinda dingy”
Reviews.Author: EvaLady
Reviews.Content: The rooms were small the bathroom was a closet and everything was extremely dated. The hallways were extremely gloomy and dark it was kinda spooky. Casino smells like permanent cigarettes. Outside is kinda cool though. Not too much around the hotel to do outside except for circus circus. Surrounding area is also a bit unsavory. Although the hotel was not so up to date it was old school feeling of what it used to be like.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for, or less”
Reviews.Author: Jwilso5657
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights and decided to ask for a suite upgrade. Was told that pool suite was 69 a night extra and had adjoining room for other friends. Was supposed to have patio. That opened right onto pool and sitting area with king sized bed. OMG. Room was NASTY and smelled horrible. Only king sized bed, definitely no suite. Adjoining room was equally disgusting, both in "mediterranean" side. DO NOT BOOK THESE ROOMS. Seriously have never been in hotel room this bad. Somewhat good thing. Got room changes to Monaco towers. MUCH better. Still not perfect, but definitely better. Casino was pretty slow but buffet was great and comedy show was awesome. To break it down, I am the queen of finding really good deals on travel at great prices because I will spend hours checking before I buy. In almost 15 years of traveling with my husband he told me this was my one oops. To make matters worse it was for my sons 21 birthday and even he said I dropped the ball. All i can say is buyer beware.

Reviews.Title: “Location is weak, Monaco Signature room is very good. Thats about it”
Reviews.Author: johnnyvegas12
Reviews.Content: Ok, I am told I am picky. I prefer a 5 star hotel to this 2 star 99% of the time. However, I received an offer for a free weekend and tour with a host from a host who was at another property previously. I was reluctant, but had a free weekend without my daughter and thought it was worth a shot. I used to like the Stardust and the old school vibe it had. Since it's gone there is really nothing left. So I thought. Arrived about 7pm on a Friday night and check-in was long. I located the host and he took me to his office. After only a couple minutes we were off to a room in the Monaco tower, I was told it was updated. He shows me the sparse casino with many blank areas, and very few tables. We see a rundown cafe and a bnunch of empty shops. We go through a couple towers, the original North tower, Monte Carlo and I am not impressed. These have 70's decor and rooms do have flat screens but it is in the honey oak setting with old drapes and colors and carpets. I was nervous. We pass the buffet and head up to 59. We arrive at a clean, sparse newish carpet, marble and clean contemporary hallway. Once in the room i am surprised!! King bed, pillow top, 32" flat screen on dark wood with granite dresser thing, which housed a fridge. There was a comfy chair and ottoman,a desk and safe. The safe does cost $3.77 a day to use, and not covered in the $7.88 resort fee. The bathroom is tiny but updated nicely. Smelled and looked good. For the right price I will be back. Just keep in mind it is only close to Circus Circus and Slots a fun. THATS IT. Its $9 to Pallazzo via taxi. So if you need to be at Caesars, it will run like $12. For a cheap time machine trip it will do nicely. The pool is the original from 1955 and is very nice considering the age of the place. It was fun to relax and think of all the people and celebs who have been in that very pool.

Reviews.Title: “do NOT stay here”
Reviews.Author: mandy5124
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this hotel 2 weeks ago on a shopping trip with my mother..figured it didn't look bad for the price..well now I know why..after traveling for 8 hrs we arrive at the hotel with about 40 other guests to find only 1 girl working the check in counter..it took us 3 hrs before we could get to our room and relax..as well there was barely any staff to ever be found or help with anything..unless you wanted to go back to the counter and wait another 3 hrs to talk to the guest service girl?..basically after they get your reservation and credit card number they don't care if you live or die..the rooms were old and smelled moldy..the only good thing about this place was the tiny pool..and a tip= even tho it says" no outside food or beverage's allowed" at the pool, bring drinks because in a 5 hr period I only seen 1 waitress, once!?? wouldn't be surprized if they go out of business soon there's no way they can compete with the other hotels, this place was a dump..cirqus cirqus was right across the street and it was 5.00 cheaper and a million times nicer!

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: JetBlue777
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 Days and 2 nights as a part of a tour package. The hotel is located near the end of the strip but it's in walking distance to all of the action and night life. The hotel is nothing special, it's a typical Vegas hotel: loud and bright. The rooms were fantastic, the beds were very comfortable and offered good views of the city. Food inside the hotel was affordable and decent. Overall, a decent hotel for a brief stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Hutchy73
Reviews.Content: I was going to write a review saying how good the Riviera was, good rooms, pleasant staff, excellent food outlets, friendly poker room, brilliant selection of slots, beautiful passion pit girls, convenience of Macdonalds and the Peppermill...etc etc Instead I would like to address a few of the reviewers on here who complain about such things as ' the hotel is dated' or ' it's too far away from the main action of the strip'......are you people too lazy or too dumb to check these things out before you book? Yes the Casino is dated but if you want to stay in a new hotel that has none of the charm or charactor of old Las Vegas then stop being so cheap and check into one! Its too far away from everything....what do you want them to do...move?? If it's too hot to walk the strip then why not walk for 5 minutes and have a wander through the Encore and the Wynn......surroundings more suited to your dilliusions of grandure im guessing. I travel from the Isle of Man in the UK and have been to Vegas a few times but even when we made our 1st trip and stayed at Circus Circus we did basic research as to its location. The old Casino's of the Vegas strip need to be cherished because it will become a cold soulless place without them and I for one look forward to staying at the Riviera again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel I ever Stayed”
Reviews.Author: Binduraj
Reviews.Content: Worst Hotel I ever stayed. Very rude reception, very hostile environment, dirty swimming pool, rooms are way outdated and dirty, I booked a non-smoking room but still found cigarette buds and ashes all over the room. Would never recommend this to any one, better spend another 50 bucks and stay at another good hotel or off the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Vinodn76
Reviews.Content: The hotel is old in its style as well as its property is also old. It has a very dull look and very average feel. In comparison to most of the hotels in the city, the hotel looked below average in its attraction of customers as well as overall appeal. The buffet restaurant is above average. The staff in the hotel are mostly old and has average level of service orientation. The old wing especially was very BAD. When I was checked into the hotel, the room was not cleared at all. Location is also very far away from the main Las Vegas strip. It was left as it is. Not recommended at all.

Reviews.Title: “SEMA show traveler”
Reviews.Author: Traveler63Wisconsin
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a convenient and very comfortable hotel while attending any convention at the LV Convention Center then this is the hotel for you. Withing easy walking distance to the LVCC. Excellent service and lots of slots and table games to serve your gaming fanticies. Have been coming here for last 5 years for the SEMA show and staying at the Riviera.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel better than expected”
Reviews.Author: mushroom_10
Reviews.Content: Read reviews on here just prior to our visit, was not happy with a lot of what was written, so arrived with mixed opinions, check in was good although can be a long wait at busy times, had upgraded to the classic room which looked exactly like the pictures on the hotel website, so this pleased us. Kadeys diner was good and staff were helpful, food court offered a varied choice at competative prices. Quite a good way from the main Hotels although the Wynn and Encore were quite near. The Deuce bus stopped outside the hotel heading to Freemont Street or opposite outside Circus Circus Hotel to go up the Strip. This bus is very easy to use choose a 48hr ticket or longer then just hop on or off when you please, they run every ten minutes. Overall a good hotel with decent facilities, pool good. Hotel clean which is always a bonus.

Reviews.Title: “Flashback to the 80s ... And not in a good way.”
Reviews.Author: OkBrett
Reviews.Content: From our intro to the Riviera at the slow Reception desk to the cheesy, brassy decor to the hallways of closed shops, this place could really use one thing ...DYNAMITE! The old staff (almost all employees have worked there over 20 years, we asked them) coupled with the old clientele makes for a less than stellar experience. Those who are astonished at the negative reviews of the Riviera must not have stayed in a nice, modern hotel recently. 6 cable channels plus 6 hotel channels, Really? Crappy and expensive Internet access, REALLY? This place was cool the last time that big shoulder pads in women's outfits were rad. BTW, if you're into that kind of thing, the female bar staff still wears 30 year old gold accented paisley tops with sexy shoulder pads. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!!”
Reviews.Author: sanway
Reviews.Content: We spent a week at the Riviera after some friends referred us to it. When we checked in, the clerk gave us a triple upgrade at no charge. Since it was late at night, we were the only ones in line, so check in was timely. Room was immaculate every day, but sheets on my bed were too small. Asked for new ones, and they immediately fixed the problem. Bed was extremely comfortable and room was always quiet. It was in one of their totally nonsmoking towers, which was great for us. Everybody was friendly and helpful the entire stay. Enjoyed our visit very much. We booked it on priceline.com along with our flight and rental car...the price was more than reasonable. Would stay there again...and will!

Reviews.Title: “I loved it”
Reviews.Author: rita504
Reviews.Content: My mini suite was beautiful. There were 2 bathrooms, one with a tub another with a shower. Everything was clean and ready for me when I arrived. There was a balcony off the Kingbed room which I used to do my smoking, thereby keeping the smoke outside. There was an area in the room for sitting purposes and enough room to dine in when ordering in room. It was a wonderful experience.

Reviews.Title: “Probably Not Again”
Reviews.Author: CLEMCpollingwoodOn
Reviews.Content: 1st- On June 19th we had to wait 1&1/2 hrs to register , 2- We booked because brochure said Slot Tournaments were on Tues & Thurs . We got there not true ----One on Wed .... Then during tournament it was announced one on Thurs. Later same day in Play-off announced Free tournaments Daily. . Most staff seemed very disturbed due to change of Management and it came across to the Guests. We have been to Vegas many times & have stayed at the Riviera & have recommended it to many Friends. The CLINCHER is in all the Hotels & accommodations where we have stayed we have NEVER been charged for the use of an in ROOM SAFE. WHY ??? WHAT ARE WE TO DO WITH OUR VALUABLES? when Staff etc. have access to our room. I would love a response to this !!! t June Crowe 23 Glen Rogers Rd box 2462 Collingwood On Canada L9Y3Z1 We had Free Room offers to three other Hotels but picked you because of good past experiences. This is both my husband and my opinions. junecrowe@hotmail.com or njkro@hotmail.com

Reviews.Title: “When You Take a Gamble...”
Reviews.Author: WorfsBabyMama
Reviews.Content: ...this is what you get. I was hotel hopping during my stay in Vegas. Looking for a more reasonable rate, I decided to Priceline a hotel. I knew that I would never want to stay at the Riviera, but unfortunately that is what Priceline awarded me. You have no idea how disappointed I was. Firs, the line for check-in was TERRIBLE. I stood in line for about 1.5 hours. I was there so long that my cell phone battery died while I played games to amuse myself. I started to check my bags at the bell stand and wait until later, but the bell hop advised me that the line would get even longer as the day progressed. I had no choice but to wait. I will admit that I am no gambler, but the presentation of the casino area was a huge turn off. It smelled of smoke. Everything looked beyond its prime and outdated. Even the dealers looked like they'd been rode hard and put away wet. By the time I finally got up to my room, I was worn out. I was on the 6th floor of the South Tower, I believe. I can't remember now. I think I've blocked it out. The elevator smelled. The hallway was disgusting, littered with garbage people had thoughtlessly left behind. Housekeeping was still on the floor attending to rooms, but I'm sure that poor woman was swamped. When I entered my room, the only happiness I felt was that it was large and spacious. The outdated decor was depressing, but I don't usually get hung up on stuff like that. The bathroom was very small. The tub was absolutely filthy. It looked like the tarmac at JFK. I went out into the hallway to get the housekeeper and she informed me, "The black stuff won't come off. I'll be glad to scrub at it for you so you can see, but it's not going anywhere." Totally gross. The bed was moderately comfortable. I did sleep so I can't complain about that. But I will admit that I did not enjoy staying here. The place is just not really my scene. I believe it is for the older crowd that smokes 2 packs a day. An added annoyance is that the resort fee does not appear to actually include anything. Many hotels charge the annoying resort fee but there is usually something you get for it. At Riviera, the resort fee does not include internet or gym usage. I found myself wondering what the up charge was for. Overall, I would not recommend. This place is not romantic so it is not for couples. It's not swinging and hip, so it's not for singles. You could bring your family here but do you really want to expose your children to this sort of filth? I mean, whatever floats your boat but it is not recommended in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best choice”
Reviews.Author: oksooner1
Reviews.Content: This property has several things going against it. First is its location. It is far removed from the majority of other well known strip properties. Sure you can catch a cheap bus (and we did), sure you can walk (and we did) but bottom line you are not centrally located in a town where being central means being close to the action. Second, the hotel and the casino are dated. Think 1970 - 1980. Both were good decades and it might even be possible for the Riviera to capitalize on the retro look but instead it just feels old and worn. Third, the rooms are OK, but just OK. We stayed in a "Signature Room" in the Monaco Tower - supposedly remodeled - and really not bad. However, the safe didn't work in one of my rooms - they moved me. The air conditioner didn't work well in that room - they fixed it (which was great) - then the tub wouldn't drain- just one thing after another. I've got to believe that for a few more dollars you could stay in a nicer place and reduce these kinds of issues. Fourth, they charge a "resort fee" - a $7 charge to the room rate, per day. Perhaps it is semantics but I would have felt better just paying an extra $7 because the Riviera is not a resort by any stretch of the imagination. The pool is OK, but again just OK. I am unaware of any other amenities offered - no free wifi, a charge to use the in room safe, etc. Finally, they have a policy that if you have food delivered to your room from an "outside" source, say a late night pizza, they will charge you $500. This is small print "gotcha" kind of gouging at its worst. Perhaps other Vegas properties have this policy, perhaps not, but only by fortunate accident did I even discover this. Incredibly, in both rooms I had during my stay this week there were "outside" pizza fliers that had been slipped under my doors. If the hotel is so hardline against other food being delivered to the rooms then they should take proactive steps against these kinds of advertisements. One the plus side I found the staff there to be hardworking and friendly. Whenever I needed something I felt like they tried to take care of me. There just weren't enough of them. Check in was very slow - each person working behind the desk was working quickly but management has not scheduled enough workers. Calling the front desk was very time consuming. Most of the time I gave up before the phone was answered. Again, not enough workers. Going back to Vegas I'll choose another place to stay. Didn't hate it but I'd like to stay in a place I think is a better value.

Reviews.Title: “NEVER AGAIN!!!!”
Reviews.Author: claudiacapetillo
Reviews.Content: Every year my family takes a Vegas trip, this is the 2nd year we stay at the Riviera but Never Again! Since there were several, non-smoking rooms that were booked and paid for months in advance the hotel made a mistake in the types of rooms and placing the right individuals in the rooms together. The front desk personnel were VERY rude! They were not willing to help us in making things right, in addition to this, they wanted to charge us EXTRA for switching us to Non-smoking rooms, when in fact this is what we had all paid for months ago. My sister was overcharged in her credit card, and had to dispute the item because the front dest told her, "there is nothing we can do." She signed authorization for $32.00 for convenience fees but was charged $89.00. Convenient for whom???!!!! We are a group of 13 that will NEVER stay at the Riviera Hotel ever again!!!

Reviews.Title: “A Blight on the Vegas Strip”
Reviews.Author: ddaluise
Reviews.Content: This is the worst hotel I've ever stayed in. The problems are too numerous to profile in one review and started the minute I arrived for check-in. I attended a convention in Las Vegas this weekend and the Riviera had great rates and was close by the venue. First of all, I booked and PAID for my room several weeks in advance requesting TWO beds in a NON smoking room. When I arrived to check-in at 10pm on a Saturday night, there were TWO check-in attendants and over EIGHTY (80) people in line! The attendants were in no hurry to attend to these guests - so I used my cell phone (while in line) to call the night time manager and ask why they were so under staffed a the check-in counter that evening. Believe it or not, the manager said, "Oh, I guess most of the employees didn't show up, I didn't realize there was a problem! I'll send a few more people out in a minute to help." Ten minutes later, one elderly man (who must've been on his break)_shuffled into the terminal to help the two overburdened check-in clerks but that was it. The average wait period to check-in was an hour and a half. A nearby self serve check-in kiosk offered up guests nothing but confusing and incorrect information. If you entered your information into this system, it supposedly located your room and would issue a ticket to you for a $30 per day extra fee! (Either you agree to this or stand in line all night, was the premise). However, at the check-in desk, I learned that even this information was misleading and that the eventual fee to be charged would be $50 per day extra! In every way - this hotel is abhorrently awful and I would NEVER recommend this place. I could tell that the staff members were used to complaints and chastisements from customers; they all seemed totally immune to and anesthetized to every valid and outrageous call that I had to make. I'm certain the management is aware of all this - don't stay here!!! When it was finally my turn to check in (an hour later) I was told there were no more NON smoking rooms available NOR rooms w/two beds! When I complained that I'd paid (in full) in advance, I was told, "Well, that payment only guarantees a room with us - not necessarily one to your specifications." (huh???) Try telling that to an airline if you prepay for a flight ("We only guaranteed you a seat - not necessarily to your requested destination.") When we were finally sent to our SMOKING suite with only ONE bed - the room was FILTHY!!! Room service hadn't attended to this room since the last guest(s) left! By now it was almost 1AM and I called the front desk SCREAMING to speak to the manager again. We were eventually shuffled off to a clean, NON smoking room w/one large bed. Fair enough - that would have to do for the night. However, we requested a fold out bed to compensate for not getting our PAID FOR IN ADVANCE - two bed suite; and despite making SIX phone calls to the manager and then house keeping about this - the bed never arrived! Also, the cleaning crew never cleaned our room ONCE despite repeatedly phone calls to Housekeeping.
