Finally, I went in SEARCH of a domestic pushing a cleaning cart and demanded new towels and that our room be cleaned. I felt like I was in the twilight zone with these people... Each and every person whom I complained loudly and often to said the same thing to me, "Ma'am, we'll get on this right away!" Yet failed to show up to clean, to bring the folding bed AND clean towels....

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, Subpar Service”
Reviews.Author: kgnvu
Reviews.Content: We were on a bachelor/bachelorette party weekend, so no one was looking for luxury, but we did upgrade to the Signature suites of the hotel (hoping that would be a bit better). The craziest part is that the king bed didn't actually have sheets that fit it or a mattress pad that fit it, so when you got in bed, your feet were actually touching the mattress, which I find (especially in a hotel, where one would assume you could at least get sheets down) incredibly gross. And there is a single shampoo/conditioner bottle (no soap really) in the bathroom. I'm not saying I wouldn't stay here, as really, the price was kind of worth it, but they really (really) need to work on some super standard amenities if they are going to try to get people to upgrade to anything titled "signature."

Reviews.Title: “Value for Money with little dissapointment”
Reviews.Author: Loyallou
Reviews.Content: We have just come back from a 10 day stay at The Riviera in Las Vegas. The hotel is located at the bottom end of the Strip but still within reasonable walking distance of all the other hotels in the strip. Although being 6 months pregnant I couldn't manage it as often as I would have liked so we relied on the Deuce buses every day. I read that if you flash a $20.00 note in front of the receptionist when checking in you could get an upgraded room. Well I did this at the Riviera also commenting that I was six months pregnant and I managed to bag us an upgrade to a room with a view over the strip that would have cost us another $200 dollars extra per week, but we got it for free. So its definitely worth trying to bag yourself an upgrade with a bit of charm and courtesy. The room was very comfortable, although the air con a tad noisy. The kingsized bed was huge, high and probably the most comfortable bed I have ever slept on. There was a flat screen TV, ipod docking station and the room attendent added a little touch by shaping the tissues in the box into a rose bud every day. The only down sides to our stay was we were not informed by our travel agent that a week into our stay 4000 Celtic fans checked in for a week for their annual conference and basically took over the hotel. They crowded the pool area every day taking up all the sun loungers with none left for other guests, and were singing and partying every night by the pool. The pool is not the best in the strip, pretty plain and boring compared to all the other pools we saw. If you want a pool party every night, stay at Treasure Island. We also had a connecting door from our room into next door and one evening our neighbours came back drunk and had an argument that was rather loud. The other thing was the room we were allocated, although comfortable, was located on the top floor of the Monaco Tower a level below the ball room. When staff were preparing the ball room for a party / entertainment they would do it at 7.00am when we were still asleep, and they were dragging furniture across the floor, banging and generally noisy, disturbing our sleep. When the ball room was in use in the evening the music and noise could be clearly heard till at least midnight. So tip is ask not to be put in a room below the ball room. Overall our trip was fun and enjoyable and the staff lovely, especially in the casino, poker area. Remember if you play poker or sat at the bar playing the gambling machines, your alcoholic drinks are free. I could not take advantage of this being pregnant!! I would stay here again in the future if I had to bearing in mind all the negatives.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value Hotel”
Reviews.Author: HelenLiverpool
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed here on a weeks holiday with friends. We were a bit concerned given the cheap cost of the hotel however we were pleasantly surprised by the standard we found at the hotel. Our room was clean and modern (Flat screen TV, ipod dock, modern style decor), however our bathroom was yet to catch up - although very clean throughout. Our room was cleaned every day and was always done to a high standard. The hotel itself is clearly one of the older on the strip, however this was quite endearing. There were lots of facilities on site for food and drink, as well as its own wedding chapel and tattoo parlour!! But close by there was a McDonalds, Dennys and 7/11 for all your other needs. The Peppermill was great for a hearty breakfast and i'd definitely recommend this! The location of the hotel was around a 15 minute walk from the start of the main strip, which in the heat of the day could get quite unbearable, thankfully the Deuce which ran up and down the strip all day was a welcome relief - although sometimes taking around the same time in the traffic it was air conditioned and very useful for those late night returns to the hotel! The pool area was reasonable, although more of a sports centre pool than a holiday pool it was relatively quiet midweek, with the weekends seeming to become a hub for younger people and families packing out the sunloungers (weekend visitors). Overall i'd say the Riviera hotel is a great place for a cheap n cheerful stay. Its clean and tidy and on par with some British 3* hotels for its level of comfort and standard. If you're not fussy about being in a central location this hotel is fine by all accounts.

Reviews.Title: “Never Never Again”
Reviews.Author: ronGoole
Reviews.Content: Lied to and unprofessional conduct while we were booking in admitted the hotel manager. Paid£150 extra for a Premier room only to find non available.We were lied to and told we were given a Premier room but wasnt ...The room we eventually received was better but still not the type we had paid Expedia £150 extra for.We were told by Expedia wrong flight information regarding flight transfers and luggage.The casino food was atrocious.Hot food served on cold plates.air conditioning very cold in the morning in the Buffet and to top it all they put their prices up .In the Casino they played the same music [like a fairground]for the two weeks we were there.Be advised Dont book this hotel casino but if you have then there is Circus Circus across the road that is by far better.The British pub in the Casino was a bit better but pricey .A pint of beer was £4.30 Good riddance Riviera you wont see me again WE have since had appologies from the Riviera apologies from Expedia Aologies on behalf of U.S Airways.We only wanted a decent holiday.Could add a lot more . No shade at the swimming pool with expensive drink prices.See pool photograph.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised by the standard”
Reviews.Author: TravellingGal83
Reviews.Content: Myself and 7 friends stayed here from the end of May to the beginning of June to celebrate my friends 30th birthday. We booked this hotel as it was on the strip and because it was cheapest compared to hotels further up the strip. The location of the hotel was fairly good, granted it was not right up by the Mirage or Bellagio but it was a stones throw from Circus Circus, Wynn and Encore and right next to a Dennys, 7/11 and other eateries. There is a Deuce bus service which we used when we didn't fancy the stroll down to the main attractions in the searing heat, this came every few minutes and cost $7 for a 24 hour pass. We paid next to nothing for the hotel part of our trip and after reading some mixed reviews on here we were unsure of what to expect. We said 'as long as its clean we'll be happy' as you don't spend all that long in your hotel. We were pleasantly surprised when we arrived at the Riviera, the rooms were better than described and were very modern with flatscreen tvs and ipod docks. They also contained a good sized fridge and a safety deposit box (be warned though that the deposit box charges $3.50 a day when locked and that is not always publicised). In terms of cleanliness the rooms were spotless and could not be faulted. The only issue we had was that our shower water pressure was rubbish and we had to move rooms, but their service was still very good. They located all 8 of us in rooms very close to each other even though we had all booked seperately, which was very accomodating. The pool at the hotel wasn't the biggest I had ever seen but it was clean and well observed by lifeguards. There were plenty of sun loungers and always clean towels on hand. They played music by the pool which was fine and there was a waitress service for drinks. Prior to arriving in Vegas we purchased Groupon vouchers for the Queen Victoria Pub as we thought we would use them to drink (as we get enough English grub at home!). The staff there were very friendly and accomodating and we had no trouble spending our vouchers. We both drank and ate there and we had no complaints at all. Judy the server was particularly brilliant! The casino was much like any other in Vegas, full of slots etc. However as it was not a massive expensive hotel the minimum bets were not too massive and Slots a Fun was across the road and this was also excellent value for money. The only downside were the queues at reception, whether you were checking in/out or wishing to notify them of something, the queue was massive and the service very slow. They do need to put more staff on the reception. Overall apart from that, we were pretty impressed with the Riviera and would stay there again. It is a high 3*/almost 4* hotel and you can't really go wrong!

Reviews.Title: “loved the hotel, wedding chapel & casino”
Reviews.Author: Cook5
Reviews.Content: This was our first time to Vegas. Check-in was a bit long, but other than that, no complaints. Got married at the hotel chapel (Royal). The chapel staff were GREAT, very helpful. We saw the "RAT PACK" show at the hotel to see "old style" vegas, and it was worth it. Good impersonations! I was glad to be a bit away from the over-crowded streets (and sidewalks) of the newer casinos which were further down the strip. Good location to catch the bus to go to the historical "Fremont Street" area to the north, or catch the bus to go south to newer part of strip. (bus stop is at Riviera's front door.) We plan to stay here again, next trip to Vegas...

Reviews.Title: “Better Than Expected”
Reviews.Author: RetiredTraveler2009
Reviews.Content: Got a three night package through Casablanca Express. We were told we would be in Monaco Tower. Not true. The room was big but view was of old, deserted pool. Upgraded for $20 a night to Monaco Tower. Room was a little smaller but nicer overall. Would choose pool view instead of strip view. Rooms need a coffee pot and coffee provided. The is a small frig. It's a bit confusing finding your way around at first, but a map provided helps some, though it is not completely accurate. Slow check in process. Not enough people working the desk. No one working the Vacation Center when we went to get our free show tickets. Someone finally noticed and called for help. We returned after a short look around the casino. Lots of food choices. We ate at Kady's for dinner out first night in. Food was good and not expensive. Breakfasts are good. Everyone we came into contact with was very friendly. I liked the location since it was between the Freemont area and all the very upscale places. Overall, a nice place to stay. I would like to see all of the bigger hotels provide free or much less expensive internet service. McDonalds right across the street has free wi-fi. We would stay again. Oh, use Valet Parking if there is room. Very handy.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly Good Experience”
Reviews.Author: Bobsibaok
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights in May. Because it is an older hotel, my wife and I were concerned that the rooms would be old and smelly. But we were WRONG. They gave us a brand-new, refurbished room on a higher level (which we asked for). It was VERY quiet and clean. The free parking was close to an entrance and an elevator that took us right up to our room. We gambled here and made some money on the craps table. The food in their coffee shop was excellent and the service friendly. All-in-all we had a great time here and would definitely go back. Highly rated!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel loved it”
Reviews.Author: sadiepeach
Reviews.Content: stayed at the riviera in the Monaco tower had a great stay,lovely bed nice room very quite,staff were really helpful good pool would stay again great price too,and near to all the action,thanks for a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely great value for money”
Reviews.Author: Jenie4
Reviews.Content: I paid £20 for a room for one night here. Fab location- right opposite Circus, Circus; Speedy check in; 2 huge beds. It's not the most modern of hotels, but hey- for £20, I wasn't complaining!! Excellent base for exploring Vegas and I would certainly go back.

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed”
Reviews.Author: Igloo44
Reviews.Content: We had two rooms booked at The Riviera, one through Expedia for 5 nights, and one booked directly through the hotel for 1 night. They managed to screw up both bookings. When the girls showed up for the main reservation, they waited in line for 1 hour - to then be told that there was another reservation under the same name, also booked through Expedia. What they had done, was given their room to the other girl (the first name was spelt differently but apparently they didnt pick this up)....so because they had given the room away to this other person, they couldnt give us the room they booked. Instead, they checked them into a DIRTY room, refused to clean it until the next day, and said that they couldnt give them a discount as it was booked through Expedia....TERRIBLE SERVICE!!!!.....when I arrived to check in, it was a 45 minute wait (at 10pm), then I was told that even though they knew there were four of us in the room - this is what we booked in advance, that they could only give us a king bed and a roll away - I am no math wizz, but in my experience, that will not sleep four people. Luckily our friends were already in house (the dirty room), so one of the girls slept with them. Unfortunalty the other girls had to stay there for their entire trip - luckily for us we had rooms booked at Treasure Island for the remaining nights (Outstanding hotel). I will never stay at The Riviera again, and will tell everyone I know not to waste their time - they may have lower rates, but you get what you pay for!

Reviews.Title: “Awful, bad example of Vegas hotel”
Reviews.Author: LivChap
Reviews.Content: The room itself was fine - clean, big, and relatively quiet. HOWEVER, we arrived late one night and there was a queue out the lobby to check in. Even having pre-paid etc, we still had to wait an hour to check in, and even then there was no apology once we got to the front. With about 30 people queuing, there were only 2 (very slow) people on the check in desk. The staff were, without exception, sullen and unhelpful, which is totally opposite to our experience of service in the rest of our trip to California and Vegas. The casino is truly horrible. I thought it was the same as all the other hotels but having been into other similarly priced ones on the Strip I realise quite how tired, seedy and unpleasant the Riviera's is. In terms of the hotel room, there's no coffee maker, free WiFi etc which we got as standard in all our other (just as cheap) hotels booked elsewhere in the US. Don't stay here - go to another hotel on the Strip which will be a much more pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “I understand the mixed reviews”
Reviews.Author: georgiaapple
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 days. The first night stayed in a room that looked like it had not been updated since the 1980's. There was mold and mildew in the shower. The bath tub drain was horrible. Changed room the next day. It was more updated, but nicks and dents in some of the furniture. The staff was friendly. The casino was OK. It is a good place to stay if you smoke. I don't smoke. You have to pay to use the room safe and internet.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: TheKrizzler
Reviews.Content: You definately get what you pay for, it serves its purpose. We got our holiday from Expedia for about the same price as direct flights to Vegas, so I wasn't expecting it to be amazing. I wouldn't stay here again though, it's right up the old end of the strip, and whilst i knew this, i didn't realise how tedious the trek down to all the good stuff would be...i guess stay here if you like a half hour walk or $15 in a cab to all the action. The check-in queue was pretty long and the staff at the desk were slow. Most of the staff in the hotel were pretty miserable compared to the staff in the other hotels. It's definitely outdated and needs a complete refurb, the food was always a little bit cold, and it's a bit scary outside at night...lots of dodgy-looking characters about. The entertainment has definately taken a dive..there's a list on the wall which details all the acts over the years...they've gone from Dolly Parton, Tony Bennett, Frankie Avalon to Extreme Midget Wrestling..and there's rumours on the strip that it'll be closed this year, just like the nearby Sahara..wouldn't be a bad thing though...

Reviews.Title: “Viva Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: s6jst
Reviews.Content: Great hotel and friendly staff....built in 1955 and the first high rise hotel on the strip its now looking a little tired inside but enjoyed our stay there. Dont eat in the Chinese resturant called " banana leaf " its over priced and not nice.Food was luke warm and tasteless.the small chinese in the fast food " court" is much cheaper and far better. bus stop just outside with the bus service called the " Deuce " runs up and down the strip 24 hours. you buy a prepay ticket from machines at the bus stops which you swipe as you board the bus. Free towel service at the pool.

Reviews.Title: “will be going back”
Reviews.Author: ivykimberly2000
Reviews.Content: me and my family stayed at the hotel for four nights and when we went to checkin at the hotel the line was wrapped around that corner i have never seen any hotel like that before. we had four rooms and it just seemed liked we would never get to the rooms. so once we got to the counter they had all of our rooms except for one and we tired to tell the front desk clerk that every room was booked by a travel agency we gave her the name of the guest and she said can't find it we said has to be there the we told her to look at the paper work she looked at it but kept going by the last name finally i said to look at the confirmation number and wouldn't you know it therer was the reservation they missed spelled the name. anyway got to room it was fine i did not have service the first two day but had to call the 3rd day for service and when theyh came they did redo the bed and give clean towels but did not clean the bathroom at all.check out was good you were ablr to check on the tv which i thought was very good did not have to stand in the long lines.

Reviews.Title: “After Riviera, Hell seems like a nice and friendly place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Mean_Ogre
Reviews.Content: Purchased a travel package online (paid in advance). Arrived at Riviera at about 6:00 PM saw the check-in line of about 200 people. Was told it takes about 2 hours to get through the line. Being pressed for time chose to go to my scheduled meetings. Came back late at night and tried to check in. After more than 3 hours of waiting (way past midnight) I was told to go to the coffee shop and wait for my room there. When I chased down and confronted the manager she admitted that there were no rooms. Went elsewhere. They still charged me for the stay. Customer service has negative value - they hide from you, conceal the information (I could've gone to another hotel much sooner have known the problem), refuse service and still charge for it!

Reviews.Title: “Bloody Loved It!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: LucyConabeer
Reviews.Content: I had the time of my life!!! The room was clean and roomy!! Staff were more than helpful!! We were upgraded as we were over there to get married, which was just amazingly kind of them!! Cost very little but got so very much!! When I can afford to go back again I will definately be staying at the Riviera!! Thank you for making our special holiday/honeymoon so memorable!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: girl54
Reviews.Content: Very clean-Good service-very helpful housekeeping staff. Pool was great-lots of seating-towels-clean. Staff and the breakfast buffet were wonderful. Only downside was casino did not pay out. I heard this from many of the guests I spoke with. Overall a great hotel with lots of Old Vegas Charm.

Reviews.Title: “Riviera impressed me: SO MUCH!”
Reviews.Author: YezkaFlores
Reviews.Content: Well, I've got 2 comped nights at the Riv with my player's card and I thought that they would send me to those old rooms and stuff but they've sent me at Monaco tower and I had to do a walk through the first elevators, then through the huge pool and then I had to take the elevator and, once that I've opened the door, I was IMPRESSED: flatscreen TV, lovely beds, fridge...but the thing that I LOVE were the iPod dock: I plugged it in my cellphone and I've started my own party before getting ready to the nightclubs... Although that I had another 3 nights at the IP, I've decided to cancel this reservation and stayed at the Riviera instead... There is a downer: I love the hot-tub and this hasn't comes for free, because you have to pay (I don't know if its 15 dllr per usage or what?) as the gym usage too **but they gave me some coupons to use this feature, but not for the hot-tub :( ** Yes, I had to pay the resort fee (which it's kinda unfair) , but I think that the room what I've got (with fridge, flat screen TV and the Ipod Dock) it's a great value... BTW, there were many hot guys at the pool! (at the time that I've been there) Oh [--]! Although I've wanted to visit Sam's town, but I did never used the Shuttle, because I didn't knew where to take it... :((

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: twynings
Reviews.Content: The old adage, "you get what you pay for" rings true yet again. I don't know what the complaints on here are about. I paid $28 per night (including the resort fee at checkout) and went to the Riviera expecting a $28 per night room. I just don't understand how people can come to a cheap hotel expecting a Ritz Carlton experience. Life just doesn't work that way. Yes, the check-in clerk was rather indifferent toward me when I arrived at 2:30AM after a long evening of flight delays. Yes, the bedding had cigarette burns in it despite my request of a non-smoking room (no smell of smoke, however). Yes, the casino, lobby, and rooms are smoky and tired looking. Yes, the TV in the room looks like it was bought in 1989. And yes, the hotel is a bit of a hike from the main action on the strip. However, the room was clean and quiet, the bed was comfortable, and there is bus service for cheap that picks up right in front of the hotel. Did I mention I paid $28 a night for the room? Would I prefer to stay somewhere nicer next time? Sure. Would I pay 4x the rate for somewhere else? Not a chance. Thanks Riviera, you provided an excellent value for my money.

Reviews.Title: “Smoky”
Reviews.Author: pareshvernekar
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this casino for 3 nights because it was less expensive over the weekend as compared to the strip hotels. I stayed in the MOnte Carlo tower. Room was clean and quite big enough for two.However, the worst part of this casino is the cigarette smoke.It reaches everywhere. even though we were staying in a non-smoking part of the hotel we could smell the smoke. Just staying in the casino for half an hour would leave stale smoke smell on our clothes. Its too bad that you have to reach the non-smoking part of hotel by walking 5 minutes through a smoke filled floor.Not a good choice for families.The casino is real old and far away from the strip.Would rather stay on the strip where the action is

Reviews.Title: “Horrible customer service”
Reviews.Author: marilynn63
Reviews.Content: I booked my room online choosing a package from the Riviera website....the package said that my room would be upgraded free of charge if available, purchase one show ticket and get one free. My adult son and I were traveling together and arrived in Las Vegas late evening. We had to stand in line to check in. When I stepped up to check in they indicated that I would receive a King size bed. I told them that I had requested two double beds in my room when I booked. They told me that what you book is not guaranteed and you get what is available when you check in. I told them I had to have double beds. They told me the only had non-smoking double bed rooms. I asked them about my package could they upgrade me to a suite. They had no clue or record of the package....I came to find out that is some gimmick.....you don't really get anything special with the online package. They told me they had a suite with double beds but I would have to pay extra and it was not clean....we would have to wait two hours. It was already 10 p.m. local time and we had flown in from the Eastern time zone so were tired. I complained about having to pay for the upgrade since they did not have the room I requested. They told me that I could check the next day about moving to another room. I finally gave up because I was ready to get in a room. We went to the bell stand to store our luggage for the two hours we had to wait but were told that they would take our suitcases but not my rolling case that contained my laptop because they had had problems with theft in their bell stand and would not take responsibility for holding laptops. So for two hours I had to drag around my rolling case in the casino. We checked on getting the buy one show ticket get one free at the place they directed us but because we were not officially checked in we could not get any ticket deals. When we did go back to check in, I was fed up and complained more about the room situation with a different clerk. This clerk agreed to give us the suite at no extra charge for the first night and we could switch the next day....I told her that I would prefer not to change rooms and if I was going to have to do that I would go to another hotel. She finally agreed not to charge extra for the suite upgrade. We got our room keys and went to the room. As we approached our room, we noticed a housekeeping cart sitting beside our room door and the door propped open. When we entered the room we found two housekeeping employees sitting in the room chatting with the phone off the hook. I asked them if they were through with the room and they were rude. Would not let us in the room unless I gave them my key so they could verify that it was actually my room. I called down to the front desk to complain about this after they finally left our room. The room was just average. Nothing special....very low budget. The beds were very comfortable but that was the only positive. Next time I visit Las Vegas I will not try to find a deal in an older hotel but pay more and get the better service. I was completely appalled at their lack of customer service. There was a total lack of care for meeting my expectations and I had to be ugly and make demands to get any attention to my concerns. I do not recommend this hotel...it has seen better days and if the customer service does not improve their days may be numbered.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was overall a great stay for the price!”
Reviews.Author: em123-11
Reviews.Content: The Riviera hotel is certainly not comparible to the many new and bigger hotels on the Vegas strip. The casino is on the small side and "older" looking and the shops/facilities aren't top notch. However, our hotel room was lovely and maid service was great. We stayed in one of the signature rooms, the most updated hotel room the Riviera offers. It had a new and very comfortable bed, linens, and bathroom was big and clean. Check in did take about 20 minutes and the hotel adds fees each night, I believe it was $7 extra. The location wasn't bad either, a 10 minute walk from all the other newer casinos, but "the Deuce" bus was able to take us all along the strip and had a stop right in front of the Riviera.

Reviews.Title: “Long wait to check-in”
Reviews.Author: CanadianJane
Reviews.Content: We had to wait 30 minutes in a lineup to check-in. The room was fine, the toilet looked really old and there was no bathroom fan.

Reviews.Title: “Riviera is tired”
Reviews.Author: PFMica
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Riviera Hotel at the end of our month long US road trip. It was the next-to-the-worst hotel in our roughly 20 hotels (you don't want to know how bad the worst was). It's tired, but needs more than room spruce-up. It began with the elevator from the parking garage to the hotel (very dirty, from floor litter to wall dirt). The check-in wait was unnecessarily too long. It was 5pm, a group was arriving & they had only 2 at the check-in desk & eventually only 1! It would have helped if these check-in agents were friendly, but they weren't. In fact the only friendly staff I met was in the British Pub. I could be wrong, but this was the only restaurant I found (other than coffee, chocolate & snack stands). They have upgraded mattresses & bedding, but everything outside the bed needs work. The hall doors are chipped, the hall carpet dirty & dishes that were left outside several hallway doors in the afternoon were still there in the morning. I didn't check out the pool, so I can't comment on it, but it's not a resort quality hotel, so the resort fee is ridiculous. And while the location looked close to the heart of the strip, it's a long walk to the Belagio/Flamingo corner.

Reviews.Title: “It Was Not Great But Better Than We Expected”
Reviews.Author: Cdntraveller513
Reviews.Content: After reading all the negative reviews about the Riviera I was a little skeptical about booking here, but my sister and I were on a budget so the price was right for us. When we arrived we were greeted by a bell hop who took our bags, but we were a little leery about it so we asked to have them back and he seemed a little bit cranky about it. The lobby could use a cleaning but it wasn't awful. We stood in line for around 15 mins to check in and the woman who helped us was friendly enough and the process was fairly quick. We were fully aware of the resort fee so there was no need to make a fuss about paying it, and besides it's one of the cheapest in Vegas. We had some trouble finding the elevators to our tower but everyone we asked was friendly and helpful. When we entered our room(it was in the Mediterranean North Tower), it was clean and didn't smell like smoke at all and we had a flat screen TV and an iPod dock on the clock radio. The bathroom could use an upgrading and the shower head was really low but the pressure was good and we always had hot water. The beds were super comfy and the linens were clean and that's all we really needed as we weren't in the room for anything else but to sleep. The only problem we really had were the noisy people who kept slamming their doors and getting ice at the wee hours in the morning. It's a little ways from the real action on the south end of the strip but after a good breakfast at Denny's a little walk didn't hurt us. If you don't mind walking it's easily accessible to the Fashion Show Mall, Treasure Island, The Mirage and even Caesar's Palace and the Bellagio. If you get tired just hop on the Deuce or take a cab. This was the second time we stayed on the north end of the strip so next time we will probably try something on the south end but if you're on a budget the Riviera will more than serve your purpose.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel ever! Horrible customer service, old hotel, far away from the main action of the strip.”
Reviews.Author: CnBMurphy0906
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had a late flight coming in to Las Vegas and arrived at the hotel 11:50 pm on a Thursday. When we arrived to the hotel in our rental car we could not find the parking lot or where to go in and check in. There was no signs any where or anyone to help. I waited with the luggage at the first set of doors we came to while my husband went to locate parking. There was no one to help at all and there was no security here. I could not wait until my husband finally got back!! He said parking was horrible and a pretty far distance from hotel. When he came back we finally found someone to tell us where the front desk/check in was. When we get to front desk we see a long line going out the front door. People were telling others it will take 1 hour to get through because there were only 3 people working the front desk. *Apparently it was like this on a nightly basis. When we finally got to the front, an hour later I hand over the print up of our reservations and the lady states they do no have our reservations in the system. She then goes upstairs to check paperwork to see if it was there. In the mean time she rights down ORBITZ phone number and tells us to call them and have them fax paperwork while she looks around. So my husband calls ORBITZ on his cell phone while this lady frolicks around and dissappears for 10 mins. When she returns she states she did not locate it. My husband tells her that ORBITZ the front desk on one of their phone lines but they put them on hold. One of the 3 clerks answered the phone only to put the person on hold. The lady who was "helping" us then uses my husbands cell phone to talk to ORBITZ and has them fax their paperwork. We finally get our room an additional 45 minutes later. Checkin at 2:00 am! I would never ever stay here again and wish I never had. They do not care about customers. No security, not enough clerks at front desk, old dirty hotel, and far off from the strip. The long line to checkin was absolutely horrible and it was the same way for my brotherinlaw when he checked in the next day at 3:30pm. So this hotel just does not know how to operate a hotel professionaly. We only stayed here because we got a great deal. It was not worth the deal at all!!! I would much rather spend a little more and stay somewhere else where people actually care about their customers.

Reviews.Title: “Wasn't as bad as I expected”
Reviews.Author: Serenity31
Reviews.Content: I've always heard bad things about the riviera and i'm not really fond of the North Strip, but I got an amazing deal due through an expedia promotion which made my trip package practically free so of course I took advantage of it. Check-in was easy and I was given a room in the Monaco tower. I have absolutely no complaints about my room which was much nicer than I had expected. Very clean, comfortable and quiet. I signed up for a players card and given a choice of free promotional item, so I chose the free ticket to a show called Dao which was very good. Otherwise I didn't spend any time in their casino or buffet and chose to hang out more in the center strip for my gambling and dining. I did however eat at the food court twice by the hotel which had many inexpensive fast food selections when I wanted a quick bite. The only thing I wasn't pleased about was the resort fee as I don't feel I got any added benefits from it. In all I had a good stay and enjoyed my trip.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid; its time has come and gone.”
Reviews.Author: MSister23
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4/24-4/26/2011. I really wanted to like the Riviera. This was my 3rd trip to Vegas, and I’ve stayed at hotels center-Strip and the Riviera end. Even though it’s very far from most of the Strip action, I’ve always liked the idea of “Old Vegas.” Never again. There were so many issues, I will bullet them out. • Was told at check in no room upgrades were available (hard to believe, they don’t want our money?) • The minuscule bathroom was falling apart. Literally. I turned on the faucet and the ceramic came off both knobs. Really? Crazy Glue can fix that. The tub was scratched and pockmarked, and drained at a snail’s pace. The door did not open all the way and hit the sink. • All but 2 electrical outlets were disabled and covered over with plastic. Forget about trying to charge electronic devices or hairstyling items simultaneously. A cheap way to save electricity. • The air conditioning controls were hidden, and could only be opened with a nail file (thank God I had one). • When I called the front desk to ask where the AC controls were before I found them, I gave up after 25 minutes on hold. • Woke up to use the bathroom at night to find cockroaches in the tub. Awesome. • Breakfast buffet was mediocre, and had run out of omelets/any made to order items by 8 am. • We were given an adjoining room to another guest, and even with the door closed and towels shoved under the door, we could hear every word they said until they stopped partying at 5 am. I get it, it’s Vegas and people come to party. But if we weren’t invited, we shouldn’t have had to go. Most decent hotels have double or reinforced doors to adjoining rooms for that very reason; not this Hotel. • Most of the clientele appeared to be over 50/Seniors, or families from other countries. Which is fine, but not what I was looking for, because I am not in either category. If you are looking to meet, drink and mingle, this property isn’t for you. The gaming floor was just kinda…depressing for that reason. • The pool has no Jacuzzi/hot tub. Neither does the health club (no sauna either), which makes the resort fee silly and just an unnecessary revenue generator. • Inquired about late check- out, and was brusquely told by the front desk “there isn’t any.” When I pointed out the sign that said “Ask about our Late Check Out!”, the clerk said we could check out at noon, or stay until 6 PM an pay another $30; basically another weekday rate night’s stay. No thanks. • Because we were offered no late check-out, my companion and I had to wait 2 hours for our shuttle to the airport in the lobby, lugging our luggage with us. We ordered soft drinks from the coffee bar and tried to sit at one of the patio tables in the English Pub (there were a dozen empty tables and 3 couples eating on the inside, one on the patio). The hostess immediately ran over and rudely chased us out, saying that if we weren’t eating, we had to leave. Luckily, after some wandering around we found a food court on the sidewalk adjacent to the hotel with open seating, where that lovely woman could have directed us. But that would have been the nice thing to do. No reason to accommodate us after we paid our money. • The positives I will say was that the beds were new and comfortable and bedding was clean, and the employees at the on-site convenience store were very nice and helpful. To close, I guess you get what you pay for, but I expected better than what we got. We still paid a premium rate for Sunday night, and that makes the above unacceptable. Unless the Riviera plans some major renovations soon, do yourself a favor and pay the extra $20 a night and stay at one of the newer or renovated hotels. Like I said, I really wanted to like this property, but fair is fair.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Check-In and Mixed Emotions on the Rooms”
Reviews.Author: LOOneyPLR
Reviews.Content: We checked in on Monday April 18th and stayed until April 24th. When we got to the check in desk, thankfully we got there pretty quickly and were at the front of the line because with the queue full of people, there was only one person working to check people in. The lady at the check in was quite rude and even though we booked our rooms more than 12 weeks in advance, we couldn't get rooms on the same floor (3 rooms all booked on my credit card). When the lady said "Well, that's what you get for booking through Allegiant." and my mother replied, "Well, we stayed here last year for 5 days, we are staying here this year for 6 days. Next year, we'll stay someplace else." - she changed her attitude. We had 3 rooms on 3 separate floors. The only complaint I have about the rooms is that the showers are made for extremely short people. I stand 5' 9" tall and the shower head came just above my shoulders. My son, who stands 6'2" tall showered pretty much on his knees. The bathtub in my mother's room was recently relined and the lining wasn't attached properly and was very warped. Other than that - the rooms were very big and very comfortable. Housekeeping did a great job and the room was very clean and bright. I enjoyed it very much. Yes, the Riviera is a bit out of the way from the center of the strip, but that is part of the attraction as well as the casino was never so crowded that you couldn't move. The Deuce stops right in front or directly across the street and because it's not "Center Strip" you can always get a seat! I will definitely stay there again, I just hope some of the staff at the front desk gets a bit of "Customer Relations" training.

Reviews.Title: “WORST EXP. EVER IN LAS VEGAS”
Reviews.Author: robnm66
Reviews.Content: Traveling with 3 adaults and 2 children, called for reservations 1 week in advance, comped 2 days, good, needed two rooms (ajoining) was told we would have one room with king bed, and one room with 2 beds ajoining, no problem comped both rooms, when we arrived late at night, took forever to get to check in long line 18 or 19 stations with only 2 people working, when we got to check in, lady was rude, charged us for one night 2nd night free for one room, didnt get ajoining rooms that we had reserved, got 2 rooms ajoining with 2 beds in each room, would not do deal that was given me on the phone the week before even though we had conformation # etc. The only good thing that happened at the riviera was at 24 hour coffee shop waiter by the name of andrew, he was polite and very efficiant,(he should find another place to work he is to good for the riviera) Will never ever stay their again... stayed one night left and found another room elsewhere to make this trip barable....

Reviews.Title: “I was pleasantly surprised!”
Reviews.Author: Colliedog
Reviews.Content: Even though all my work colleagues advised against it, i booked myself and my husband into the Riviera for a night on the Strip. I have to admit i wasn't expecting much as it was the cheapest room rate out of all the casinos for a Friday night. On entering the casino i was surprised at how nice it smelled, normally the older casinos have that lived in cigarette smoke stench, but everything was clean and well looked after. We walked to the check in desk but the queue was impossibly long so thanks to a review on here, i knew about the check in machines in the hallways. I can highly recommend them, the process was quick and easy; and saved us about an hour waiting in line (we had tickets to a concert and were running late!) Our room was in the Monaco tower on the 43rd floor, again the corridor smelt clean and the decor looked quite new. The room itself was very well furnished with two double beds, a decent sized TV and fridge...although there was no mini bar! The room was spotless, and the sheets on the beds were clean and crisp! The bathroom was a standard hotel setup, with a few toiletries. Nothing exciting but again clean and well maintained. I seriously would recommend this hotel, it's cheap and old but has been well refurbished. Also the Queen Victoria Pub does a stonking good breakfast and if you are a Las Vegas local they give you 10% off the bill! The only down side is that it is a LONG walk to the center of the Strip, and not one i would recommend while wearing 3 inch heels!

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: lombaowski
Reviews.Content: I had heard mixed reviews about this place but decided to give it a try. I found the Riviera to be a really good deal for the money and my only complaint was really the internet connection. The room (Monte Carlo tower) was good, not fancy but clean and neat. The property was nice, solid buffet restaurant, inexpensive and nice shops, and the coffee shop was pleasant with great breakfast food. Casino has a mix of table games and the atmosphere is busy but not over the top like the IP or one of the swank joints that cost north of $500 a night. Dealers, staff, management and shop keepers were all polite and friendly. Sports book was actually really nice but the bar in there was never open, you couldn't get a drink and they didn't even offer simple bets like puckline bets (they would have taken my money on the bet I wanted to make). The book itself has incredible potential as it was roomy and comfortable but the atmosphere wasn't great. Overall I liked the Riviera a lot for the price and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised after all of the bad reviews. Would stay there again”
Reviews.Author: jo953
Reviews.Content: We were there on a special offer by Casablanca. The suiite was great (in fact who could ask for more). It was in the Monte Carlo Tower. The valet person was more than helpful to us. The bell hops were very friendly and offered to take us to where we wanted to go. We ate at the food court and the food was very good. We ate breakfast and dinner at Kady's. They have very nice and friendly people there. The hostess there was extremely helpful and remembered us when we came back. She won us over. My husband remarked that he had never been to Vegas where we have been treated so well..Everyone in the hotel was great. So don't believe the bad reviews. As far we are concerned, they are so wrong in their reviews. c e

Reviews.Title: “Caution - unauthorized charges to your credit card!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: bja43116
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reviews on Trip Advisor, I was a bit skeptical about booking at the Riviera but decided to be open minded and give it a try. My fiance and I have been to Vegas several times but neither had ever stayed at the Riviera. This trip was to celebrate my son's 21st birthday and his first trip to Vegas. I booked online about a month prior to our arrival date and the confirmation page indicated the booking was through a place called Tourico. We received a great deal on the room. After booking the room, the confirmation page stated that despite the fact that I indicated there would be 3 guests in the room, that we may be assigned to a room with only one bed! The confirmation also stated that 72 hour advanced notice was necessary to cancel reservations without penalty. I immediately called the hotel to ask if I should cancel the online reservation and book through the hotel direct. I was told that the reservation would not show up on their system until 3 days prior to the reservation date. So much for no penalty! I sent an email to the hotel hoping to receive a response from an Eloise Orndoff (Management) of the Riviera. I noticed that she had responded to negative reviews on Trip Advisor and thought I would give it a try. I received no response to my email. I ended up calling the hotel 72 hours in advance and indicated that I would need a room with 2 beds, which request was thankfully granted. The front desk person was extremely friendly and check-in was quick and easy despite the fact that there were only 2 individuals behind the front desk at the time (we arrived at 11:00 p.m. on a Friday night). When I opened the door to our room, the smell of cigarette smoke was overwhelming. The room looked clean, the bathroom was clean but there was no refrigerator, which would have been nice (or nice to know that we would not have one in our room). The room was nothing fancy but we could live with it as we weren't planning on spending much time in the room anyway. So I decided to let the smell of the room and the "no fridge" slide as to not ruin my son's birthday. We had a great time in Vegas despite some of the downfalls of the room. We decided to drive to Valley of Fire just outside of Vegas. A very friendly valet provided us with directions and insight regarding the Valley of Fire and Lake Mead, which was absolutely breathtaking. Our last night was wanted to go to the Riviera Comedy Club. I asked a person behind a small desk across from the front desk about where I could purchase tickets to the show for that evening. She stated she does not sell tickets, but gives them away. She then asked when we were leaving and I stated the next morning. She replied "I don't have any tickets to give to you." She was trying to get us to sit in on one of those time-share scams for the free tickets. The thing is, I just wanted to purchase tickets, not receive free tickets after sitting for hours in a boring, high-pressured sales presentation. Needless to say, I wasn't going to purchase the tickets after the treatment I received from this individual. The night prior to check-out, I asked the front desk if we could just leave the keys in the room as our room was prepaid. The person at the front desk indicated I could check-out via the television which seemed convenient. The next morning I tried to check-out via the television and noticed that there were charges on my bill for each day of our stay for Safe Rental. We did not use the safe in our room so I immediately called the front desk. They indicated that I would have to come down to the front desk to have these charges removed. So much for convenience! I went downstairs to the front desk and indicated that the safe rental charges should be removed as we did not use the safe. Granted, these fees were minimal but I am not going to pay for something I did not use. The front desk person said no problem and removed the fees. He provided me with a receipt as to the charges that were incurred, which I agreed to. Upon returning home, I looked at my bank account online and noticed that I was not charged the amount indicated on my receipt...but was charged more!!!! In addition to the charge, they also had a "pending transaction" of $60 on my account for who knows what! I immediately called the hotel (after waiting 27 minutes on hold) only to receive voice mail. The voice mail indicated that if this call is placed prior to 2:00 p.m. Vegas time (which it was) that I would receive a response that same day. It is now day 2 after my trip and no response. I called again only to receive voice mail again. The charge to my credit card in excess of the charge indicated on my receipt has been processed through my bank and the $60 charge is still on hold in my pending transactions. I suggest if you plan on staying at the Riviera do NOT use a credit card and pay in CASH!!!

Reviews.Title: “The room was fine for the price we paid.”
Reviews.Author: nicolediane
Reviews.Content: We had a nice room overlooking the pool. The room had been redone and the bed was great. Airconditiong worked good. The bathtub needed a redo but the room and bathroom were clean. We were a little nervous about staying because of the reviews but it turned out ok. We ate at Kady's the first morning and it was fine. The second morning we tried the buffet and it was awful. I don't think the scramble eggs were real eggs. There were bagels but nothing to cut them with. The choices were limited. The room was dark, dreary and depressing. We weren't in Vegas to do Vegas so the location wasn't a problem. As far as I am concerned all hotels in Vegas stink from the smoke. Wanted to say that the lady that checked us in was very friendly and upgraded our room.

Reviews.Title: “REALLY!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: george75701
Reviews.Content: We spent a weekend at the Riviera and the best thing about staying there is the arrival and the departure, becuase the vallets and bell men were the nicest people there. I understand that most of the employees are older, but most of them are also plan rude. To begin with, neither my wife or I made these reservations, since we usually stay at another hotel in town. Upon our arrival we were met by the vallet, Ron, who so was very nice with a warm smile and a pleasure to talk with. Once inside and as we made our way to the reservations desk the couple we were with noticed the hotel smelled like smoke, but I didn't notice it. The wait at the desk was not a long one, as others have spoke of, but the lady working the desk must have slept in one of the hotels beds because she was not in a good mood at all. When the reservations were made we requested a king sized bed, but of course, they didn't have any so we were given two "queen" beds. Once in the room I noticed the room was very old looking and the beds were not "queens" by any means. When we requested our luggae brought up to the room it was as if the bellmen had read my mind, because he was there very quickly. In the casino the employees are mostly friendly, but nothing that stands out. Sleeping, or should I say the lack of sleeping, is something you are faced with since the beds are small and very uncomfortable. The air conditioning was just as mean as the employees, working only when it wanted to. The drain in the shower was pluged, but we worked with that. We ate at the buffet the next morning and again the lady at the cash register must live at the hotel, because she was as grumpy as the rest of the employees there. The food at the buffet was no prize either. We paid for the champagne brunch and had to ask for the champagne three times, only to be told it wasn't ready yet. We sat down at the bar on Saturday before heading to dinner at another location and the bartender couldn't smile if his life depended on it. Also, when he was told that he got our drink order wrong, we were told that we were wrong not he. The second night we were again faced with no sleeping and my wife even tryed the other bed, which she said was better, but not great. Again, as we checked out, there were those vallets and bellman who were very friendly and great to talk to. I know this hotel is 54 years old, but some upgrading would be great. All in all, for those of you trying to get reservations at the Riviera you will find one less person who will stand in your way to get those rooms, because we will go back you our regular hotel, where the people greet you with a smile and are happy employees.

Reviews.Title: “Good For The Money”
Reviews.Author: cmsnig
Reviews.Content: Love the self check-in kiosks, no wait. However, the first room I was assigned hadn't been cleaned so I had to walk back to the main building (my tower was connected but not close to the front desk) to have a new room assigned. The room was decent but I didn't spend much time there. It's not in the midst of the bustle of the strip but it's close enough. Fitness center was a good size. The equipment wasn't state of the art but it has just about everything you need to get a full workout.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for...”
Reviews.Author: Bernard018
Reviews.Content: This old and tired establishment just needs to fade away. Rooms are not in good condition. Housecleaning does not refill all amenities as they should. King size bed bottom sheets do not fit so you wind up sleeping on a scratchy mattress. I even asked them to find bigger sheets and they could not. If you are a smoker, you are a second class citizen when it comes to the condition of your room. Upgraded to a Petite Suite (we paid the upgrade fee for it after the first dirty room had the pool literally outside our window!) and it did not have a safe. When I called down again they comp-ed the upgrade fee back so they did not have to move us again and suggested we RENT a box inside the cashier's cage.

Reviews.Title: “Better than I thought”
Reviews.Author: Geo920
Reviews.Content: I used priceline to book this room. I was a little scared with what I will actually end up with, but was pretty happy with the outcome. I ended up staying in a Monoco style room, in the tower behind the pool. Was clean and modern. Only downside was the long time it took to check in. Looking at the lines in other hotels my friends were staying in, it was about the same. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy rooms but still good value.”
Reviews.Author: seiko98
Reviews.Content: We're stayed 7 nights @ the Riviera north tower, and have to say our most negative point is something very important for us, the lack of sound isolation between the rooms, we could actually hear people speak in other rooms. On the very first night some folks were yelling and laughing the night through, opening the noisy sliding windows to have a smoke in their non-smoker's room we could actually smell. We could even hear security @ 4am asking to cool down. Most of the nights were unfortunately noisy. Facial tissues found on floor behind lamp between two beds. Mold on the shower curtain. Very few free tv channels (LCD screen). Mattresses were soft but still comfortable. Plenty of towels. Swimming pool area was pleasant in the courtyard. Buffet prices are a bit high taking in consideration the lack of food selection. We've rented a Hertz car and had great service. Overall it was just ok for what we've paid for.

Reviews.Title: “hidden charges.. better off staying at main hotels as it works out the same price”
Reviews.Author: gazzamazza
Reviews.Content: the hotel sprung a $40 charge on us when we were leaving, as they didnt take the full payment at check in?? we disputed this but we hadnt much time as we were late to catch a flight.. there is also alot of hidden charges such as $15 a day resort fee's, also you need to buy internet by the day.. its not a bad hotel, other than all the hidden fees.. when you add them up your better off staying staying nearer the strip cause it works out the same price!!! its like they hadnt updated the decor since the 70's. everything feels and looks like its 30 years old.
